excerpts: Cajun wings - chicken wings with Cajun sauce.
cajun wings.author: Wesley S.
cajun wings.review:
I don't eat seafood, so I got a few random plates:

Garlic noodles - pretty good! Very garlicky and lots of noodles.

Cajun wings - chicken wings with Cajun sauce. Not bad. 

Fried chicken tenders - good! The chicken tenders have a light deep fried layer of batter. Comes with tartar sauce for dipping. It's like ordering fish and chips... except it's chicken, and there's no chips.

My girlfriend got 1 pound of shrimp with hurricane sauce. She absolutely devoured it. Safe to say she really liked it here. It's not as good as Boiling Crab but it is the closest thing to it without going all the way to San Jose.

Next time I come back, I want to try the Cajun fries!

excerpts: and I highly recommend the Cajun wings and alligator sausage and fried catfish nuggets!
cajun wings.author: Morgan H.
cajun wings.review: I love the food here! It's Cajun and tasty and different! I have eaten here twice and I really enjoy it. It is also a great place to watch sports! They have a bunch of tvs everywhere. Beers are 5$ a pint and 16$ a pitcher! The happy hour 2-6 is super long food and 2 kinds of beer and I highly recommend the Cajun wings and alligator sausage and fried catfish nuggets!

excerpts: Cajun wings
- it was alright
but I would say too saucy for my taste.
I wish it was more spicy though.
Garlic noodles - really good!
Just the right amount of garlic!
Hurricane shrimp
- I liked it
but I felt it could've been spicier.
I think it's great that they serve it in a bowl instead of serving it in a plastic bag like other places do.
Way easier to eat this way!
cajun wings.author: Coco L.
cajun wings.review:
Meh I had high hopes for this place but I left feeling just flat...

My friend introduced this place to me and I've also heard great things so obviously I was hella excited. Came here for dinner after a long study sesh at school. We were brain dead and haaaangry! We came a little bit after they opened so it wasn't too busy. 

Parking - it may be a little tough no matter what day of the week it is since it's a busy street. Mostly metered parking but there is also residential parking if you're willing to walk a bit.

Service - very nice and friendly! 

Food - 
1. Cajun wings - it was alright but I would say too saucy for my taste. I wish it was more spicy though. 
2. Garlic noodles - really good! Just the right amount of garlic! 
3. Hurricane shrimp - I liked it but I felt it could've been spicier. I think it's great that they serve it in a bowl instead of serving it in a plastic bag like other places do. Way easier to eat this way! 
5. Cajun fries - I would say they're average. Nothing special but the fact that they're free for your check in makes it better! 

Don't know if I would come back but I'm glad I got to try this place out.

excerpts: My friend got the garlic noodles and Cajun wings.
Cheaper garlic noodles($5), cheaper Cajun wings..
and so on...
I'll Probably come back for a happy hour season but for now...
I'll stick with kicking crab in San Jose for my Cajun fix!!
cajun wings.author: Auden W.
cajun wings.review:
First Time eating Cajun in the city. I usually satisfy my Cajun cravings in South Bay such as places like boiling crab or my all time favorite KICKIN crab...

The food here is somewhat pricier than the South Bay locations but it's understandable since it's the city and everything seems more expensive... I got the lb of shrimp for 15$... Steam rice and sausages on the side. My friend got the garlic noodles and Cajun wings. We checked in for the free Cajun fries which was cool to have on the side. 

The shrimp it self were large sized and fresh.. In a balanced flavorful sauce.. (Hurricane sauce). Sausages and Cajun fries were on point but kicking crab has 12 pieces for 3.99 whole here was 6 pieces for 2.99. Garlic noodles were ... Like garlic noodles, so can't really complain about that .. 

I did however see a happy hour menu that's from 2pm-6pm with dollar oysters.. Cheaper garlic noodles($5), cheaper Cajun wings..($5$ and so on... I'll Probably come back for a happy hour season but for now... I'll stick with kicking crab in San Jose for my Cajun fix!!

excerpts: I went last night and ordered my usuals: spicy cajun wings, garlic noodles, garlicy green beans, and shrimp in mild garlic butter sauce.
There was only one person working initially
and he did not notice my friend and I for a long time -
we ended up seating ourselves and getting our own menus by the door while we waited for him to come over.
The server initially brought us fries, which we did not order, before realizing they belonged to another table - there were only 3 tables taken at that time.
Two items in our order came out wrong, which we confirmed when we got the check: our spicy wings were written down as 'mild' and our shrimp came boiled with no sauce at all....
I thought the waiter may have misheard me when I ordered
so I repeated the shrimp order and pointed to the sauce on the menu, but it seems it was still written wrong.
cajun wings.author: Vika M.
cajun wings.review:
Really sad to see this place going downhill since switching owners. This used to be my absolutely favorite place in the central Richmond. I went last night and ordered my usuals: spicy cajun wings, garlic noodles, garlicy green beans, and shrimp in mild garlic butter sauce. There was only one person working initially and he did not notice my friend and I for a long time - we ended up seating ourselves and getting our own menus by the door while we waited for him to come over. The server initially brought us fries, which we did not order, before realizing they belonged to another table - there were only 3 tables taken at that time. Two items in our order came out wrong, which we confirmed when we got the check: our spicy wings were written down as 'mild' and our shrimp came boiled with no sauce at all....I thought the waiter may have misheard me when I ordered so I repeated the shrimp order and pointed to the sauce on the menu, but it seems it was still written wrong. The green beans tasted fine, definitely the best thing we got, but the garlic noodles were noticeably dry and a smaller portion compared to my many previous visits. 

I get that switching ownership can take some adjustment, but it really feels like the quality of the cooking has gone down and the new staff is not well trained.

excerpts: For appetizers, we ordered the cajun calamari, cajun wings, and got a free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp.
The calamari was pretty good, it had like a curly fries taste to it
and they were really crispy.
The cajun wings were meh...
I thought they were going to be dry rubbed sort of wings, but they are really saucy.
I am guessing the sauce is their hurricane sauce.
I was not digging all the sauce on the wing, although it was okay tasting.
Imagine the shrimp sauce on a wing?
The fries were really good.
cajun wings.author: Vivian Y.
cajun wings.review:
tldr:: Food was okay. Prices are a little higher for the shrimp than I am used too. Dark New Orleans kind of interior design and atmosphere. 

Came to Swamp on a thursday afternoon around 3:30 with my boyfriend for their happy hour which runs from 2-6 pm. Place was kind of empty, but groups came in here and there. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
It was kind of dark inside besides the tables near the window, but I guess that's kind of the feel you would get if you're sitting next to the bar area. Not really digging the interior design, but I am not here to judge what the restaurant looks like.

Service:
The service is pretty good. There was one guy working the front. Only thing that kind of bothered me was that we came in for happy hour, and there is a separate menu for that. We originally wanted to order the happy hour wings and calamari...but when we saw the bill, the guy was like you pointed to the regular menu, not the happy hour one...no big deal though. Wish he was a little more enthusiastic or looked like he even cared about the service, but it's chill; he did what he had to. I liked that at the end of the meal, they gave us a hot towelette; makes the bathroom trip afterwards a lot cleaner as far as touching the handles and what not. 

Taste: 
For appetizers, we ordered the cajun calamari, cajun wings, and got a free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp. The calamari was pretty good, it had like a curly fries taste to it and they were really crispy. The cajun wings were meh... I thought they were going to be dry rubbed sort of wings, but they are really saucy. I am guessing the sauce is their hurricane sauce. I was not digging all the sauce on the wing, although it was okay tasting. Imagine the shrimp sauce on a wing? The fries were really good. They're perfectly crispy and seasoned; comparable to the Boiling Crab ones. 

We also ordered 1 lb of mild shrimp in the hurricane sauce with one corn. Shrimp was so friggen hot, so be careful when you start peeling them. Shrimp was pretty good. Sauce is on the thicker side, but still tasty. 

The bill came out to $60 after tax and tip (bf ordered a lb and 2 corns togo) (before that the total was around $35). I was surprised to see that a lb of shrimp costs $15. I am used to paying ~$10 at boiling crab, so the price kind of shocked me. Overall the food was good. If I am craving Cajun style seafood, I can imagine coming here again, since Boiling Crab is too far away.

excerpts: The Cajun wings were pretty good, so one star for that.
Seafood - zero stars.
cajun wings.author: Jennifer W.
cajun wings.review: Came to this place on Yelp due to the high reviews, but found it to be absolutely disgusting!  Seafood was extremely NOT fresh, in fact, it stunk!  I love mussels (love seafood in general), but the mussels here were not edible, they stunk and tasted terrible!  I wasn't able to eat them.  Even soaked inside the sauce they still tasted nasty.  The Hurricane Sauce was nothing special, pretty bland, in fact.  The garlic noodles were also bland.  Would never come back to this place.  Disgusting, old seafood.  The Cajun wings were pretty good, so one star for that.  Seafood - zero stars.

excerpts: My friend and I got two dozen oysters each ($1.25 each, happy hour price), fried catfish appetizer, and cajun wings.
All very decent, full of flavor, and very fresh (for the oysters).
Would repeat.
cajun wings.author: Maksim S.
cajun wings.review: Pretty empty late afternoon on Monday, but that was a good thing.  My friend and I got two dozen oysters each ($1.25 each, happy hour price), fried catfish appetizer, and cajun wings. All very decent, full of flavor, and very fresh (for the oysters).  Would repeat.

excerpts: Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6) -
I was excited to try this as it sounded exotic on the menu.
However, I'll pass on ordering it again the next time I visit.
grilled alligator sausage.author: Candice H.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
Variety of fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and great for large groups!



Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6) - I was excited to try this as it sounded exotic on the menu.  However, I'll pass on ordering it again the next time I visit.  It just tasted like a regular pork sausage.  

Hush Puppies ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#c8IXP1U-QtPQbdq8kFQmPA) - You get about 7 or 8 in a basket.  Too doughy and lacked in flavor.  I'd say skip this.

**I initially ordered a dozen oysters, but the waiter came back and said they were out, which was why I ordered the hush puppies.**

Cajun Fries ($3.50 or Free if you check-in on Yelp) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#LWCwmvTqXVsBgOrZ05S5tg) - A bit salty and lacked in heat.  However, can't really complain since it was free!

For the assortment of shellfish, there are four different boil flavors and spiciness levels to choose from.  

Boil Flavors:  Original Cajun (no sauce), Garlic Butter, Lemon Pepper, & Hurricane (all-in)

Spicy: None, Mild, Medium, & Spicy Habanero

1 lb. Habanero Hurricane Crawfish ($12) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#rTkc1evTmPI4g7lCfa9pYQ) - Tasty, but too spicy for the hubby.  I enjoyed it.  Next time, I'll have to order a side of French Bread to sop up all the sauce. 

1 lb. Medium Hurricane Clams ($12) - Clams were huge, but a few of them weren't edible as the shells weren't opened all the way. I felt like we didn't get our money's worth since there weren't a lot of clams in the bowl.

Service:
Friendly & attentive

Parking:
Can be a challenge since it's on Geary Street

excerpts: From what I remember on our first visit, we ordered Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6.50) and it tasted like chicken to us.
It's always a good experience to try something new though, even if you may or may not like it.
grilled alligator sausage.author: Mandy G.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
I am the poster child for Swamp! (Inside joke between my bf & I, hehe) 

One thing for sure, this place isn't swampy, hehe. I've been here twice and have had a good experience for both. My bf & I were both craving cajun food (second time) and it was between Swamp & Cajun House. Last time we were to Cajun House, it was super crowded, hard to find parking, and a bit of disappointment after purchasing a GroupOn deal. Swamp is located on the busy streets of Geary, but I don't think parking is too bad as compared to 5th Ave.. and they also have the awesome check-in deals for dine-ins - FREE cajun fries as appetizers! 

The interior here kinda brings me back home in NOLA because of all the festive decorations they have up. The staff is friendly and attentive. The manager(?) I think .. whoever the guy is, is funny. 

My typical order is always a pound of shrimp and a side of corn and rice. Hurricane flavor with medium spicy (always a regret). 

Pricing for my order: 
Shrimp - $14/lb 
Corn - $0.75
Rice - $1.50 
Coke/soft drink - $2.50 (free refill!) 

I guess for my review, I will let you know what my bf & I do. When our order comes out, we like to dump all the shrimp onto the plate to cool off. After a couple mins (even when still kinda hot), we peel all the shrimps and dump the excess remains into a bowl (provided by staff) and put the shrimps meat into the bowl that it came with (into the sauce bowl). Before we add the rice into the sauce bowl, we take out the excess sauce with a spoon and put it onto our plates, since we have no where else to put it (and in case you took out too much, you can add it back in). Lastly, we add the rice into the sauce bowl that already has the shrimp, and we mix it! Ta-da!! Even the manager guy liked our idea! ;) 

As for the medium spicy, I always forget that I shouldn't order it and regret it during my meal. For my second visit, I asked our waitress how spicy it would be and she said on a scale of 1-10, it'd be a 6. I took the chance and it felt like an 8!! T_T I should just order mild next time .. 

From what I remember on our first visit, we ordered Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6.50) and it tasted like chicken to us. It's always a good experience to try something new though, even if you may or may not like it. The gumbo ($8) from what I remember was good, nothing all that spectacular but maybe I'm biased because I lived in NOLA for awhile. 

Overall, I always enjoy my experience here and would definitely come back. When ordering the pound of shrimps, I highly recommend the hurricane sauce! Add a corn to your liking too ;)

Want to know the inside joke for the poster child thing? It's cause my bf & I were seated next to the front window when the restaurant was empty. People would see us eating and stop and stare or look at the menu before walking off or coming in. We would have a little argument that one of us was catching the attention and being the poster child, haha.

excerpts: We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!!
Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy.
For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce.
Crawfish was out of season.
The flavor was so delicious!!!
The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles!
Fully enjoyed every bite of it.
grilled alligator sausage.author: Nhung D.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
Had high hopes for this place due to all of the good reviews and I must say, it definitely lived up to my expectations. We came on a Saturday night around 9PM. Called in about 15 mins early to see if there was a wait and the person we spoke with said he would save a table for our party of five! Got there and there was a table ready for us in a packed restaurant, how awesome is that! 

Now onto the food..

We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!! Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy. For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce. Crawfish was out of season. :( The flavor was so delicious!!! The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles! Fully enjoyed every bite of it. We also ordered the gumbo which was just OK. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't order it again.

Compared to Boiling Crab: the sauce was not as thick, but definitely flavorful. It was much easier to enjoy as they put it in a bowl instead of a plastic bag.. Easier to use a spoon to scoop up some delicious sauce onto my garlic noodles with shrimp. They both have distinct tastes so if you're used to eating at BC all the time, then make sure to come here with an open mind.

Service was great! They tended to us quite regularly and cleaned up our table as much as they could throughout the course of the meal. No complaints there.

Overall, I would definitely come back! :-)

excerpts: I meant to eat only half the grilled alligator sausage.
Someone stole the rest.
Or did I eat it?
grilled alligator sausage.author: Peter K.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
The coleslaw has the yummy crack taste of a certain chain; you know what I mean. If you don't, the slaw here is good.

Crawfish bengiet. So good if you like crawfish.

Generous delicious portion of hushpuppies. 

Garlic noodles also made of crack.

I meant to eat only half the grilled alligator sausage.  Someone stole the rest. Or did I eat it? It's all gone.

Only came on for a snack.  Had to try several different dishes.  Do full, and I have take out.

excerpts: Grilled Alligator Sausage $6 (2.5 of 5)
Very excited to taste this.
It was one sausage sliced in half and grilled.
It was a little fishy.
But tasted better when we sprinkled lemon juice on top of it.
Then it tasted like a better chicken sausage.
This is definitely a pass when I go back a second time.
* Fried Calamari $8 (3 of 5) Not bad but not great.
Fried Oysters $8 (5 of 5)
Great batter and great size.
The fried oysters were still moist and juicy in the middle.
I would re-order and re-order.
Yummy!
* Fried Fish Fillet $8 (3.5 of 5) Tasted like really good and crispy fish fillet (like McDonald's).
Again great frying and great batter choice.
Garlic Noodle $7 (4.5 of 5)
I think this is one of my preferred garlic noodles now.
It was great noodle choice because it was soft and chewy.
I really liked the portion and the overall taste and texture.
If I can't eat Than Long's garlic noodle, this would be my next go to place.
* Garlic Butter Crab $30/each (4 of 5) Tasty.
Very nice sauce.
And exactly what it is named, garlic + butter.
Tasted extra good when we poured the sauce over the garlic noodle.
Delicious.
* Hurricane Shrimp and corn and sausage $12/lb + 0.75each + $2.50 (6 pieces) (4.5 of 5)
Hurricane is supposedly a mix of all flavors.
I liked it, especially with rice or the French Bread.
It was pretty good.
* Soda $2.50 free refill
grilled alligator sausage.author: Janice T.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
Great place for large groups. Lots to eat, great fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and free to be loud!!! I wasn't expecting this place to be great, but it was pretty good.
 
* 1 dozen Kusshi on the half shell $18 (4 of 5) Fat and creamy raw oysters served with lemon, cocktail sauce, and horseradish. The oysters were fresh and very good size. Delicious for $18.
* Sweet Potato Fries $4.50 (5 of 5) Fabulous. Looked like long cork screws and they tasted so good. Crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside. It was a really really really really good yam fry. Yummy!
* Cajun Fries $3.50 or FREE with yelp check-in. (4.5 of 5) Pretty good and even better when it was free. The fries were good wedge sizes but surprising the Cajun flavoring was outstanding. The Cajun powder wasn't too salty and it had a good heat hint at the end. It was really really really good. But the yam fries taste just a little better. 
* Deviled Wings (6) $6 (3.5 of 5) Not too spicy even though they are called deviled wings. But they are super fat wings. 
* Grilled Alligator Sausage $6 (2.5 of 5) Very excited to taste this. It was one sausage sliced in half and grilled. It was a little fishy. But tasted better when we sprinkled lemon juice on top of it. Then it tasted like a better chicken sausage. This is definitely a pass when I go back a second time.
* Fried Calamari $8 (3 of 5) Not bad but not great.
* Fried Oysters $8 (5 of 5) Great batter and great size. The fried oysters were still moist and juicy in the middle. I would re-order and re-order. Yummy!
* Fried Fish Fillet $8 (3.5 of 5) Tasted like really good and crispy fish fillet (like McDonald's). Again great frying and great batter choice. 
* Garlic Noodle $7 (4.5 of 5) I think this is one of my preferred garlic noodles now. It was great noodle choice because it was soft and chewy. I really liked the portion and the overall taste and texture. If I can't eat Than Long's garlic noodle, this would be my next go to place.
* Garlic Butter Crab $30/each (4 of 5) Tasty. Very nice sauce. And exactly what it is named, garlic + butter. Tasted extra good when we poured the sauce over the garlic noodle. Delicious.
* Hurricane Shrimp and corn and sausage $12/lb + 0.75each + $2.50 (6 pieces) (4.5 of 5) Hurricane is supposedly a mix of all flavors. I liked it, especially with rice or the French Bread. It was pretty good.  
* Soda $2.50 free refill
* Pitcher of Beer $16

This place was great for our group of ten. They were nice and accommodating. All the items very fairly tasty. Most of the frying dishes were yummy and great with the soda/beer. The seafood bowls were also very tasty too.

excerpts: My fave is the fried fish and the grilled alligator sausage.
grilled alligator sausage.author: Terry Y.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
This place is the best new spot in Inner Richmond! It's akin Boiling Crab but with more reasonable prices. You can be sure to get your cajun fix here. From the sublime gumbo to the crawfish w/ four options of heat and four different sauces. That's 16 different combos which mean endless time and cholesterol for you to sample all the insane possibilities. You can also include corn, potatoes and/or sausage in w/ your order of seafood. I also would recommend getting shrimp and clams as well. You can't really go wrong. 

My fave is the fried fish and the grilled alligator sausage. But for seafood, I go with the Shrimp and clams in their garlic butter sauce with a medium heat. 

If you enjoy seafood, this is a good place to start.

excerpts: - Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw.
Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage.
grilled alligator sausage.author: Tracy T.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
Highlights
- I came with a group of 6 on a week night after a Giants game and there was no wait.
- Bar area and tables, take your pick and good for large groups. 
- Includes TVs so you can definitely catch a game here as well as order beer and wine. 
- The perfect cajun seafood fix spot in SF. Not in the ghetto, clean, and close by.
- Oysters: Tasted fresh, but nothing special. 
- Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw. Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage. 
- Cajun Fries: A MUST. Free with the YELP check-in offer. A ton of flavor packed in these perfectly fried potatoes. 
- Shrimp in Hurricane Sauce: Hurricane is a mixture of all their sauce offerings: Cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper. Mild was good for me, since I'm a whimp when it comes to spicy things but Medium was more flavorful compared to the group. So good with their garlic noodles!

Improvements
- Dungeness crab in garlic butter: recommended by the waiter. Nothing special here. I would rather order another lb of the hurricane shrimp instead of this one. 
- Clams in hurricane sauce: I was never a fan of clams, so am my personal preference I would skip this one next time. If you love clams, this one is for you.  

Tip
- Parking can be difficult especially during lunch, dinner, and weekends.

excerpts: We also ordered the grilled alligator sausage as an appetizer.
It was ok.
Not something I would order again, but at least I can say I tried it.
And for the main, I ordered a pound of Hurricane Shrimp.
Very delicious!
grilled alligator sausage.author: Sheryll V.
grilled alligator sausage.review:
The first time I wanted to try Swamp, I was very excited. Found parking right in front and paid for meter. Walked to the door to find out they were closed. CLOSED ON TUESDAYS?! What is this. Went back home to my cravings unsatisfied. A few weeks later I went back on a Thursday. They just opened so my friend and I were seated quickly. 

The first thing we ordered was the cajun fries that we got for free. If you checked in, you get free fries. But anyways, the fries were great. Light, crisp, and just enough seasoning. We also ordered the grilled alligator sausage as an appetizer. It was ok. Not something I would order again, but at least I can say I tried it. And for the main, I ordered a pound of Hurricane Shrimp. Very delicious! Wasn't expecting their sauce to taste so good.

Friendly service. Our waiter was patient and gave good suggestions. I believe the owner was there as well. Checking up with every table and making sure our food was good. 

And to my surprise the bill was cheaper than I had expected. Turns out we came during happy hour, which took of 15%.  Despite swamp being closed on Tuesdays I still give it five stars. Clean restaurant, friendly service, and awesome food. Can't wait to go back.

excerpts: I ordered the fried catfish and hush puppies.
Catfish was alright, the hush puppies were hard and dry.
Where they did really well was the Crawfish and the "Boil".
You get to pick your sauce and degree of heat.
The Crawfish with lemon pepper was really good!
My Fiance ordered the "3- item Combination Boil" with Prawns, Mussels, Clams and Corn on the cob.
He picked the Hurricane Sauce, medium, and it was just the right amount of heat....nice, and not too crazy.
The Prawns were huge and everything was really tasty and fresh.
We will come back again for the Boil and Crawfish.
hush puppies.author: Christine Z.
hush puppies.review:
Stopped by SWAMP for dinner on our way to a show at the Fillmore on Saturday, 5/5/18.
It's a dark little restaurant, but the menu had a lot of selections, the Server took our order and brought drinks quickly.
The food was good.  I ordered the fried catfish and hush puppies.  Catfish was alright, the hush puppies were hard and dry.  Where they did really well was the Crawfish and the "Boil".  You get to pick your sauce and degree of heat.  The Crawfish with lemon pepper was really good!  My Fiance ordered the "3- item Combination Boil" with Prawns, Mussels, Clams and Corn on the cob.  He picked the Hurricane Sauce, medium, and it was just the right amount of heat....nice, and not too crazy.  The Prawns were huge and everything was really tasty and fresh.  We will come back again for the Boil and Crawfish.

excerpts: Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet.
hush puppies.author: Joy W.
hush puppies.review:
Excellent, PPQ brought Cajun seafood to the Richmond. We had been curious about Swamp, with its eye-catching name in blue lettering and black awning. The interior has some interesting faux window paintings of scenic ocean views. The rest of the restaurant is very simple without all the usual cheesy seaside decorations.
So we came for an early dinner once and sat by the window. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw some spindly legs moving along the wall. I turned to check out what was in my peripheral vision and it was a daddy long-legs. Since the restaurant was still fairly empty, they didn't mind us switching to another table. It's no one's fault. I just remember it vividly. Maybe the spider likes Cajun food too?

The shellfish menu is pretty simple. You just...
1) Choose your shellfish. Pay by the pound.
2) Choose a sauce/flavor.
3) Choose level of spice.
There is a good selection of starters and sides. Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet. 

We went with the 2-item Combo ($15/lb.) of Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane / Mild Sauce,
& added Corn ($0.75) + Hot Link Sausage ($2.95):
The shrimp were tender and sweet, and the mussels were nice and springy. The dark red Hurricane sauce was quite tasty. I think the spicy sausages we added brought the mild close to a medium spice.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter ($29/lb):
These king crab legs tasted fresh, tender, and sweet. The leg meat was nice and springy. I appreciate that the crab legs were cut into smaller segments. They fit nicely in the bowls and made for easier eating. It went really well with the creamy garlic butter sauce.

We checked in for the free Cajun fries. They were a thicker cut, not too crunchy, lightly seasoned, pretty good. 

After we ate all the contents in our bowls, we were still left with a lot of sauce, which was perfect for dipping the toasted bread.

I enjoyed the dishes we ordered. I have to say I prefer the garlic butter to their hurricane sauce. I would come back to try out the rest of their menu, including the alligator sausage. I had some alligator in Australia and I quite like it! I'd definitely like to take advantage of their Happy Hour menu (2-6PM) too.

excerpts: 2) Hush Puppies - dry, hard and BLAND.
Zero flavor.
They came with a sauce which was tasty, but didn't fit with the Hush Puppies.
hush puppies.author: Meghan L.
hush puppies.review:
WARNING: If you recently got back from Louisiana and are hoping to relive your amazing food and customer service experience, keep your expectations in check, this is SF after all. 

Service: What's that? When we first arrived it wasn't very busy, the 3 or 4 servers seemed flustered and confused. It only got worse as more customers arrived. No one is greeted when you walk in, and it isn't clear if you wait to be seated, or seat yourself. Once seated, menus were tossed at us hastily without a word being said. We quickly decided what we wanted, put down the menu and waited, and waited and waited until we eventually flagged someone down. She didn't ask us if it was our first time, didn't ask us what we wanted to drink, didn't ask if the sky was blue, nothing.  We neglected to order drinks and had to flag her down again. They didn't check on us ONE TIME during our meal, we had to flag them down for extra napkins and bibs which should already be provided because...messy. During our meal we saw several frustrated customers having to regularly flag someone down to get any services. I saw a women with a To-Go bag walk BACK in, speak to a server regarding her bill and then walk away, I made eye contact with her as she was leaving and she rolled her eyes and said "OMG". 
I hear ya girl! They also made a *BIG* error on our final bill. 

On a side note, the guy running around in sweat pants, who I assume to be the owner and didn't seem to do much of anything but hang near a couple tables in the back randomly turned on the music in the middle of our dinner, when he first turned on the music it was so loud, we saw several people startle, myself included. 

Food: This is NOT authentic. It is more Asian/Cajun Fusion. 
~ They should AT LEAST invest in Crystal hot sauce. It is straight from Louisiana.
1) Oysters: Can't really mess up raw oysters, but you CAN mess up the raw oyster experience. The limes (not lemons, LIMES) we were given were dry, they had no juice at all. The horseradish and cocktail sauce were in the same tiny container and if you don't like horseradish it was difficult to get the cocktail sauce out, they did NOT provide a spoon for the condiment and we had to try and use our forks....fail, Oyster Experience Ruined.

2) Hush Puppies - dry, hard and BLAND. Zero flavor. They came with a sauce which was tasty, but didn't fit with the Hush Puppies. SKIP THEM.

3) Alligator Sausage and Slaw - This was the best part of the meal. Sausage was flavorful, tender and juicy. The slaw was drenched in a tangy sauce. Good Combo. Needed Crystal Hot Sauce though!

4) Cajun Fries - Free with our YELP Check-In. The check in on Yelp says that it expired 6/30/2014, but apparently they are still accepting it. These were good, regular fries with a spicy seasoning. I'd order them again, but I'll never be back so maybe not. 

5) Shrimp and Clam Boil w/ Signature Hurricane Sauce - They should really put down what the Hurricane Sauce is, we were pretty disappointed. Given the name, we figured it would be a blend of true LA Cajun flavors...wrong. It is curry. The shrimp was cooked nicely, not overly done, however we have experienced shrimp much easier to peal than these ones.. The clams were good, but I did have a few that were really gritty. 

Decor: It is cute. I like the maroon wall painted up like bourbon street. I do think the other wall could use a huge mural of a bayou, but the small photo is OK too. 

Final Thoughts: I would not return to this place. I'll just go visit NoLa again.

excerpts: I also have to say the hush puppies are BOMB!!!
So crispy and delicious they will light up every pleasure center in your brain.
One more thing: if Cajun-style seafood is your thing, I recommend Ray's Crab Shack in Fremont, CA.
That one is my favorite, but I encourage you to try both and see what you think.
hush puppies.author: Erika J.
hush puppies.review: A very enjoyable and delicious dining experience! My boyfriend and I love boil-in-a-bag, order-by-the-pound seafood, and this place does a really solid job. I recommend the House Cajun seasoning but be warned that even the "mild" spice level might be a bit hotter than you're expecting. We had king crab, crawfish, mussels, corn, and potatoes all mixed together. YUM! I also have to say the hush puppies are BOMB!!! So crispy and delicious they will light up every pleasure center in your brain. One more thing: if Cajun-style seafood is your thing, I recommend Ray's Crab Shack in Fremont, CA. That one is my favorite, but I encourage you to try both and see what you think.

excerpts: We ordered the hush puppies for appetizer and we had our free Cajun fries too!
For main course, we ordered the 2 lbs combination of shrimp and clams in a mild curry coconut and of course garlic noodles.
The hush puppies is good
but it's something i usually don't order it
so I can't really say if it's a best or there's a better one out there
hush puppies.author: CJ B.
hush puppies.review:
We couldn't decide what to eat on a late Saturday for lunch and since we found a parking near this restaurant, we decided to try it. 
If you check in on Yelp, you get a free Cajun fries :)
The ambiance is good as you walk in the entrance you'll see an alligator head screaming at you :& lol 
We ordered the hush puppies for appetizer and we had our free Cajun fries too!  For main course, we ordered the 2 lbs combination of shrimp and clams in a mild curry coconut and of course garlic noodles.
The hush puppies is good but it's something i usually don't order it so I can't really say if it's a best or there's a better one out there
The Cajun fries is a meh...I can't taste the Cajun part of it but then again it's free so no complain on this
The 2lbs shrimp and clams mild curry coconut is very good...I would prefer it spicy but my friend doesn't like spicy so we opted for the mild. The curry coconut is very flavorful (that I just want to dip a toasted sour dough bread on it) yum yum!!! Though, the 2 lbs seems so little compare it to the 2 lbs we order from other restaurants.
As for the garlic noodles...this is disappointing! I couldn't taste the garlic at all plus the noodles are overcooked. I had tried so many different garlic noodles in different restaurants so I know my garlic noodles! So I improvised and took some of the curry coconut sauce on my noodles and yes it became much okay and became curry coconut noodles!
I "might" come back to try the hurricane spice but will not order the garlic noodles again. 
Definitely "Kickin Crab" and "Boiling Crab" are still my go to place!

excerpts: Hush Puppies ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#c8IXP1U-QtPQbdq8kFQmPA) -
You get about 7 or 8 in a basket.
Too doughy and lacked in flavor.
I initially ordered a dozen oysters, but the waiter came back and said they were out, which was why I ordered the hush puppies.
hush puppies.author: Candice H.
hush puppies.review:
Variety of fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and great for large groups!



Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6) - I was excited to try this as it sounded exotic on the menu.  However, I'll pass on ordering it again the next time I visit.  It just tasted like a regular pork sausage.  

Hush Puppies ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#c8IXP1U-QtPQbdq8kFQmPA) - You get about 7 or 8 in a basket.  Too doughy and lacked in flavor.  I'd say skip this.

**I initially ordered a dozen oysters, but the waiter came back and said they were out, which was why I ordered the hush puppies.**

Cajun Fries ($3.50 or Free if you check-in on Yelp) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#LWCwmvTqXVsBgOrZ05S5tg) - A bit salty and lacked in heat.  However, can't really complain since it was free!

For the assortment of shellfish, there are four different boil flavors and spiciness levels to choose from.  

Boil Flavors:  Original Cajun (no sauce), Garlic Butter, Lemon Pepper, & Hurricane (all-in)

Spicy: None, Mild, Medium, & Spicy Habanero

1 lb. Habanero Hurricane Crawfish ($12) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#rTkc1evTmPI4g7lCfa9pYQ) - Tasty, but too spicy for the hubby.  I enjoyed it.  Next time, I'll have to order a side of French Bread to sop up all the sauce. 

1 lb. Medium Hurricane Clams ($12) - Clams were huge, but a few of them weren't edible as the shells weren't opened all the way. I felt like we didn't get our money's worth since there weren't a lot of clams in the bowl.

Service:
Friendly & attentive

Parking:
Can be a challenge since it's on Geary Street

excerpts: He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.
He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.
He's still talking about it.
hush puppies.author: Scott A.
hush puppies.review:
I first went there after searching Yelp for new places to try.  I came across this one.  Being from South Louisiana, I'm always searching for places to "take me back".  

On Jan, 18, I drove to SwampSF from Oakland.  Not really set on a particular dish, I order the Oyster Po-Boy, to go. While waiting for my order, I wanted to buy one of their shirts, but the server couldn't find the size I was looking for.  :(  

When I got back to my car, the food smelled so good, I had to try it before I got home.  I ate half of the Po-Boy before I put the car in drive.  It was delicious.  Perfectly fried.

I told my coworkers about the place.  I could tell their mouths were drooling.

On 2/2, I took a coworker friend there.  He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.  I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.  He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.  He's still talking about it.  My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".  The crawfish beignet was interesting.  It wasn't bad.  I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.  There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.  I'll pass on ordering it again.  Overall the food was good, and they had the size of shirt I was looking for.

I'll definitely return.

excerpts: Hush puppies were forgettable.
Hurricane shrimp were dull.
Service was super slow even though the place was almost empty and there were a couple of people on duty.
hush puppies.author: Kris F.
hush puppies.review: Garlic noodles were great. Fried catfish was very good. Fries were good. Calamari were good. Hush puppies were forgettable. Hurricane shrimp were dull. Service was super slow even though the place was almost empty and there were a couple of people on duty.

excerpts: I had 1 lb. mussels and clams with garlic noodles, hush puppies. and crawfish beignets.
We tried quite a bit off the menu.
The total came to $55.
I also got a diet coke and they gave me refills.
Service is nice.
Owner comes by and checks out his customers.
It's got this Asian influence, and for me that makes me feel at home.
hush puppies.author: Denise C.
hush puppies.review: I saw someone post pictures on Yelp, so I checked out the Yelp page for Swamp on Geary in the Richmond and decided to bring my friend to try it. He kept talking about having crawfish at a restaurant, so we finally did. I had 1 lb. mussels and clams with garlic noodles, hush puppies. and crawfish beignets. We tried quite a bit off the menu. The total came to $55. I also got a diet coke and they gave me refills. Service is nice. Owner comes by and checks out his customers. It's got this Asian influence, and for me that makes me feel at home.

excerpts: I always order the hush puppies and a variety of shellfish in their hurricane sauce.
Compared to other places that serve boiled and seasoned seafood, Swamp has a great non oily sauce.
My hands aren't covered in grease after eating here.
This place is good for groups, but make sure you make a reservation on weekends since this place is pretty popular.
hush puppies.author: Joanne T.
hush puppies.review: Love love love this place.  The free cajun fries for checking in are a big plus and I love that they serve the seafood boil in special heating bowls rather than plastic bags like others do.  I always order the hush puppies and a variety of shellfish in their hurricane sauce. Compared to other places that serve boiled and seasoned seafood, Swamp has a great non oily sauce.  My hands aren't covered in grease after eating here. This place is good for groups, but make sure you make a reservation on weekends since this place is pretty popular.

excerpts: Hush puppies didn't have much flavor.
hush puppies.author: Linda L.
hush puppies.review:
The spicy cajun sauce was GOOOD!!! I had a pound of shrimp, 4 pieces of corn and sausage in it and it was lovely! Addicting actually. I ordered an extra basket of bread just so I could get more of the sauce. 

Besides that everything else was more like an "Eh". Hush puppies didn't have much flavor. Fries were just fries and the clams in lemon garlic sauce was pretty plain. 

There are a few more Cajun houses in Sunset/ Richmond area. I'd check out those places before I come back and try swamp. Maybe it will get better after it's been open a bit longer.

excerpts:
Try the hush puppies 
Shrimp is so sweet 
I love hurricane or garlic butter sauce.
hush puppies.author: Janipher C.
hush puppies.review:
Try the hush puppies 
Shrimp is so sweet 
I love hurricane or garlic butter sauce.
And I always get the gumbo

excerpts: I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets!
So much to offer on their menu!
hush puppies.author: Janny S.
hush puppies.review:
I can't believe its my first time eating Cajun style seafood boil and I am a big fan of seafood! Why are all these Louisiana seafood boil restaurants here in the Bay Area opened by Asian people? I'm always a little perplexed by that. They must have a lot of  Cajun culinary talent!

Started off with a dozen of Kusshi, Washington oysters to share. They were fresh and meaty, but didn't have a lot of flavor. I usually enjoy oysters that are sweet and briny. It came with one slice of lime which was weird because I think oysters should be served with an abundance of lemons. There were 3 of us and we went with two orders of the 2 item combo, the first combo with clams and mussel, and the 2nd with crawfish and shrimp, in the hurricane boil (all the flavors in one - Original cajun, Garlic Butter, and Coconut Curry), medium spicy and threw in 3 corns, $14/pound. The hurricane boil flavor is definitely recommended; the sauce is rich from the coconut curry and spices. I loved it. My favorite items from the 4 we ordered are the clams and the shrimp because they were much more rewarding and meatier. The clams were big and plump that night. I have made the decision that I am not a fan of crawfish because for the amount of work you have to put in, the reward is meager. The garlic noodles are delicious and garlicy. I like to pour the hurricane sauce all over it for more flavor! For checking in on Yelp, you get a free side of Cajun fries which was a nice addition because I wanted to add that anyway. I love free!

It wasn't very busy that night so the service was great! They came around to empty our shell bowls frequently. One big plus about this place is that the food is served in nice metal bowls, we get real plates and utensils instead of paper plates, plastic forks and food served in plastic bags. This was definitely a plus! I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets! So much to offer on their menu!

excerpts: can't stand too big hush puppies where you run out of crunch...
-Whole Dungeness Crab with the garlic sauce
/ Crab was good sized, fed 3 adults generously.
Not terribly crazy about garlic sauce, it had a good consistency
but I wished it was a bit more buttery tasting.
Had enough garlic but was missing something else, IMO.
-Cajun Fries (free with Yelp check in)
-Crawdads
w/ Hurricane Sauce /
Personally, I've never been a fan of crawdads just because I feel like I'm getting jipped.
They look big and meaty, but they're really just for sucking and minimal chewing, unless one likes chewing shells.
hush puppies.author: Elizabeth N.
hush puppies.review:
This is a very interesting hybrid of two styles of cooking: Asian and Cajun (rhyme time!) but with seafood and spices it just works. Came here two weeks ago for lunch on a Tuesday, it wasn't busy so that was good. We ordered:

-Seafood boil with corn and Hurricane Sauce (this is the mix of all their sauces) /definitely has the most tastiness and kick
-Garlic Noodles / tasted like those from Thanh Long or PPQ (seems like garlic noodles are a SF asian seafood restaurant staple). Was even better when you added Hurricane sauce to it!
-Hush Puppies / small, crisp with just enough cake moistness in the middle to balance the fried outside. can't stand too big hush puppies where you run out of crunch...
-Whole Dungeness Crab with the garlic sauce / Crab was good sized, fed 3 adults generously. Not terribly crazy about garlic sauce, it had a good consistency but I wished it was a bit more buttery tasting. Had enough garlic but was missing something else, IMO. 
-Cajun Fries (free with Yelp check in)
-Crawdads w/ Hurricane Sauce / Personally, I've never been a fan of crawdads just because I feel like I'm getting jipped. They look big and meaty, but they're really just for sucking and minimal chewing, unless one likes chewing shells. Don't get me wrong, I'll eat 'em if someone puts it in front of me, but its not my first choice of water critter. 

Everything was good and tasty. I really enjoyed my meal here and I'd definitely come back when I'm in the area. 

Pros:
-Public parking on the back side, entrance on 18th Ave
-Clean and casual restaurant
-Give lots of sauce, definitely ask your server for a container to take the leftovers home! The hurricane sauce could definitely be used on a lot of things (eggs, chicken, as a dip..)
-Good service, friendly, knowledgeable
-Fresh seafood

Cons:
- Its a bit pricey but it's quality seafood that's well cooked so can't totally ding them on that. 
-Depending on the time of day, parking in this area of SF can be tricky, but on a Tuesday at 12n, lot in the back was open.

excerpts: The garlic noodles, hush puppies, calamari, crab and shrimp combo cannot go wrong!
I myself tried the shrimp and clams combo with the all sauce mix, and my dine in partner tried the crab with garlic butter sauce.
No complaints.
The sauce is different, it is not greasy nor heavy.
It doesn't make you feel gross after eating an entire dish.
I suggest this place for anyone looking for something different in sauce quality.
hush puppies.author: Vic A.
hush puppies.review: 5 starts hands down! The garlic noodles, hush puppies, calamari, crab and shrimp combo cannot go wrong! I myself tried the shrimp and clams combo with the all sauce mix, and my dine in partner tried the crab with garlic butter sauce. No complaints. The sauce is different, it is not greasy nor heavy. It doesn't make you feel gross after eating an entire dish. I suggest this place for anyone looking for something different in sauce quality.

excerpts: The hush puppies are pretty good, the calamari is ok (kinda a small amount), and the cajun fries are delish, the alligator sausage kinda just tastes like sausage though.
hush puppies.author: Rohan D.
hush puppies.review:
Scrumptious! The hush puppies are pretty good, the calamari is ok (kinda a small amount), and the cajun fries are delish, the alligator sausage kinda just tastes like sausage though.


The broths for boils are all good, I had the garlic butter + clams and the crawfish + the all in broth. The guy there recommended getting some french bread and dipping it in the broth (best idea ever).

excerpts: Alligator sausages and hush puppies to start.
I'd recommend both, especially the hush puppies which taste like fried cornbread goodness.
The garlic noodles are a good side, but they were right when they said we should get some french bread to dip into our sauces (mild hurricane with crawfish, shrimp, clams, and crab legs).
The crab legs aren't a great deal, and the crawfish aren't very large, but man was everything spicy.
hush puppies.author: Danny C.
hush puppies.review: First off, the service here is freaking awesome. It's definitely not boiling crab, but it's not packed either. Alligator sausages and hush puppies to start. I'd recommend both, especially the hush puppies which taste like fried cornbread goodness. The garlic noodles are a good side, but they were right when they said we should get some french bread to dip into our sauces (mild hurricane with crawfish, shrimp, clams, and crab legs). The crab legs aren't a great deal, and the crawfish aren't very large, but man was everything spicy. Altogether, I'd say that this place has pretty decent portion sizes for the price, and you get also get free cajun fries for checking in on Yelp. The cajun fries are pretty popping too.

excerpts: The hush puppies and calamari as appetizers were all that!
Highly recommend!
hush puppies.author: Renee M.
hush puppies.review: This place was delicious! We had the dinner for 2 which included lobster, clam chowder (awesome!) cole slaw and  their garlic noodles were phenomenal! The hush puppies and calamari as appetizers were all that! Highly recommend!

excerpts: Hush puppies, cajun, and sweet potato fries were all decent and work great as appetizers to share with your table as you wait for your food.
hush puppies.author: Ryan L.
hush puppies.review: The selling point of Swamp is their Hurricane sauce. So incredibly tasty that it induces salivation. Unfortunately that's all Swamp has got going for it. The price is steep even for SF prices - $14/lb of shrimp? I think their 2-choice shellfish combo is a nice option for some variety. The spiciness difference between the mild and medium was pretty negligible so go ahead and spice it up to your hearts content. The shrimp and mussels tasted fresh so I can't complain. Cat fish fillets didn't taste like catfish, just deep fried fish; wouldn't recommend it. Hush puppies, cajun, and sweet potato fries were all decent and work great as appetizers to share with your table as you wait for your food.

excerpts: Hush puppies were fried well and not too oily.
They came with an amazing honey butter too!!
Garlic noodles were phenomenal!!
Portions were small on the side dishes and appetizers, but still worth getting!
Service was above average, but it was the grand opening...
I was charged twice for soda even after I asked about refills, so beware!
They don't give enough napkins (but they will gladly give you more upon request) at the table and don't leave a bowl for shells...
Just some small kinks to work out!
hush puppies.author: Jessyca M.
hush puppies.review:
Everything was pretty tasty and well seasoned.
Hurricane boil!!! Get it!!! It's a mixture of all of their other flavors (lemon pepper, garlic butter, and original cajun)...such a great idea! Shrimp and clams were cooked perfectly! We got medium spicy, but it really could be considered mild, so if you like spicy get the spicy habanero AND extra tobasco! 
Hush puppies were fried well and not too oily. They came with an amazing honey butter too!! Garlic noodles were phenomenal!!
Portions were small on the side dishes and appetizers, but still worth getting! 
Service was above average, but it was the grand opening...
I was charged twice for soda even after I asked about refills, so beware! 
They don't give enough napkins (but they will gladly give you more upon request) at the table and don't leave a bowl for shells... Just some small kinks to work out!

excerpts: Anyways, you can't go wrong trying anything from the appetizer selection such as the hush puppies to alligator sausage to the main specialty of crab, mussels or oysters.
It was all great.
But whatever you get, you must order the garlic noodles to accompany it.
It is a definite must have.
Ambience is great with tv screens and the noise level being at a medium.
Finally, is the service.
Top notch waitresses and waiter giving their undivided attention to the clientele to make sure everyone is happy.
Most specifically, Bill.
Quite the gentleman introducing himself and interacting with everyone on a personal level, brings that already great experience at Swamp, to a fun and special level.
Definitely Bill is what makes Swamp stand out from the rest!
hush puppies.author: Jas P.
hush puppies.review: Swamp is a great addition to the Richmond district bringing very tasteful Louisiana style cajun food. I can't be one to say whether it's traditional or not, but we did bring my brother-in-law who was born and raised on the outskirts of Battonrouge and he had nothing but high praises regarding flavor and variety of options of cooking the dishes so that must say something. Anyways, you can't go wrong trying anything from the appetizer selection such as the hush puppies to alligator sausage to the main specialty of crab, mussels or oysters. It was all great. But whatever you get, you must order the garlic noodles to accompany it. It is a definite must have. Ambience is great with tv screens and the noise level being at a medium. Finally, is the service. Top notch waitresses and waiter giving their undivided attention to the clientele to make sure everyone is happy. Most specifically, Bill. Quite the gentleman introducing himself and interacting with everyone on a personal level, brings that already great experience at Swamp, to a fun and special level. Definitely Bill is what makes Swamp stand out from the rest!

excerpts: We shared the cole slaw, french bread, garlic noodles & hush puppies.
My favorite was the hush puppies--so good!
I highly recommend.
hush puppies.author: Jane W.
hush puppies.review: Had a great dinner here last night. The staff was very friendly & attentive & everything was Delish! I had the Alaskan King Crab in garlic/butter w/corn on the cob & my friends had the shrimp. We shared the cole slaw, french bread, garlic noodles & hush puppies. My favorite was the hush puppies--so good! I highly recommend.

excerpts: Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet.
crawfish beignet.author: Joy W.
crawfish beignet.review:
Excellent, PPQ brought Cajun seafood to the Richmond. We had been curious about Swamp, with its eye-catching name in blue lettering and black awning. The interior has some interesting faux window paintings of scenic ocean views. The rest of the restaurant is very simple without all the usual cheesy seaside decorations.
So we came for an early dinner once and sat by the window. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw some spindly legs moving along the wall. I turned to check out what was in my peripheral vision and it was a daddy long-legs. Since the restaurant was still fairly empty, they didn't mind us switching to another table. It's no one's fault. I just remember it vividly. Maybe the spider likes Cajun food too?

The shellfish menu is pretty simple. You just...
1) Choose your shellfish. Pay by the pound.
2) Choose a sauce/flavor.
3) Choose level of spice.
There is a good selection of starters and sides. Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet. 

We went with the 2-item Combo ($15/lb.) of Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane / Mild Sauce,
& added Corn ($0.75) + Hot Link Sausage ($2.95):
The shrimp were tender and sweet, and the mussels were nice and springy. The dark red Hurricane sauce was quite tasty. I think the spicy sausages we added brought the mild close to a medium spice.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter ($29/lb):
These king crab legs tasted fresh, tender, and sweet. The leg meat was nice and springy. I appreciate that the crab legs were cut into smaller segments. They fit nicely in the bowls and made for easier eating. It went really well with the creamy garlic butter sauce.

We checked in for the free Cajun fries. They were a thicker cut, not too crunchy, lightly seasoned, pretty good. 

After we ate all the contents in our bowls, we were still left with a lot of sauce, which was perfect for dipping the toasted bread.

I enjoyed the dishes we ordered. I have to say I prefer the garlic butter to their hurricane sauce. I would come back to try out the rest of their menu, including the alligator sausage. I had some alligator in Australia and I quite like it! I'd definitely like to take advantage of their Happy Hour menu (2-6PM) too.

excerpts:
Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet.
crawfish beignet.author: Courtni W.
crawfish beignet.review:
Service: 

Waiter was 50 flavors of salty and rushed us to order as soon as we sat down. The staff spoke Cantonese to each other and would talk negatively about the customers. 

Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet. Dough was too doughy and there wasn't enough of crawfish. Very average. 

Shrimp: got the hurricane cajun flavor. The texture of the shrimp was decent and the flavor wasn't bad. Not worth $15.50 for the pound. You can find shrimp of equal quality at other places significantly cheaper. 

Gumbo: Very plain even after adding salt. Didn't taste homey and comforting like a gumbo should. I would not order this.

excerpts: My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.
The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!
crawfish beignet.author: Herb L.
crawfish beignet.review:
My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.  The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!  Fries had just the right amount of seasoning.

The pound of shrimp with the medium spicy hurricane sauce was good, and it really should be ordered with some bread so you can sop up the sauce.  That sauce was *really* good.  

We also ordered their lobster special with the "Golden Shallot Peppercorn" seasoning and it was excessively good.  Take a lobster, chop it up Chinese style, and then Cajun-ize the seasoning.

excerpts: I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.
My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.
I'll pass on ordering it again.
crawfish beignet.author: Scott A.
crawfish beignet.review:
I first went there after searching Yelp for new places to try.  I came across this one.  Being from South Louisiana, I'm always searching for places to "take me back".  

On Jan, 18, I drove to SwampSF from Oakland.  Not really set on a particular dish, I order the Oyster Po-Boy, to go. While waiting for my order, I wanted to buy one of their shirts, but the server couldn't find the size I was looking for.  :(  

When I got back to my car, the food smelled so good, I had to try it before I got home.  I ate half of the Po-Boy before I put the car in drive.  It was delicious.  Perfectly fried.

I told my coworkers about the place.  I could tell their mouths were drooling.

On 2/2, I took a coworker friend there.  He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.  I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.  He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.  He's still talking about it.  My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".  The crawfish beignet was interesting.  It wasn't bad.  I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.  There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.  I'll pass on ordering it again.  Overall the food was good, and they had the size of shirt I was looking for.

I'll definitely return.

excerpts: The crawfish beignet was nice and savory.
There's more crawfish there then in our combination and less work.
It reminds me of a donut with savory crawfish inside.
The garlic noodle was the last to come out
and we were waiting for a long time to go with the "mild" spicy Hurricane.
The "mild" really need something to go with it.
The garlic noodle had at least half a stick of butter?
(That is just a guess).
I can keep on eating that garlic noodle, but had to stop since I was really full from so much food.
They do have a set meal for $59 with clam chowder soup and probably everything we had.
I had to take home the sauce, no sense to waste such yummy sauce.
crawfish beignet.author: Helen L.
crawfish beignet.review: Groupon is way too dangerous for my waistline!  No, I didn't have the alligator, need to work my way through that menu to it.  Came exactly at 5:55 pm, had 5 minutes to order from their Happy Hour Menu, and so glad I did!  The oysters were so fresh, so next time we have to order at least a dozen!  Only $1 each, what the hey!  Splurge!  It's so great to have someone shuck them and present them, all I do is slurp them.  We had cajun chicken wings.  If my non-spicy friend can eat them, you can too!  We had to order the rest through the main menu since groupon does not cover Happy Hour items.  We had the 2 combinations with Hurricane sauce:  Mussels and crawfish.  Skip the crawfish next time, not much meat.  Stick with the shrimp.  Service was great, ask and you will receive.  Love having the bib, just because the messy person inside me always wants to come out.  The crawfish beignet was nice and savory.  There's more crawfish there then in our combination and less work.  It reminds me of a donut with savory crawfish inside.  The garlic noodle was the last to come out and we were waiting for a long time to go with the "mild" spicy Hurricane. I can keep on eating that garlic noodle, but had to stop since I was really full from so much food.  They do have a set meal for $59 with clam chowder soup and probably everything we had.  I had to take home the sauce, no sense to waste such yummy sauce.

Cannot compare, after you've had Brenda's beignet.
crawfish beignet.author: Ryan E.
crawfish beignet.review:
Place is pretty good! The broth is thinner than most places like kickin' crab or boiling crab. I like the spicy level they have. The group I was with said it was a little spicy so it really depends on your endurance of spice. The flavor is all there though, regardless of spice level. $14 per pound for a pound of shrimp. Seems a little pricier than other places. Service is A+ I loved our server, he was super funny and joked around with us while getting us anything we needed. Water levels were always full. 

Crawfish beignet was NO BUENO. Cannot compare, after you've had Brenda's beignet. 

There's parking in the back! And remember to check in for free caujin fries!

I had 2 glasses 

Crawfish beignet was ehh - tasted like a piroshki

crawfish beignet.review:
So I ate here for my 26th birthday yesterday  and I liked it ! There was 18 ppl in my party and the service was okay I think they did pretty good considering there's only 2 ppl working the front ... 

Any who we ordered

Calamari  yummy 
Free Cajun fries with yelp checkin also 
yummy

Watermelon ice tea  so good I had 2 glasses

Service is so so.
crawfish beignet.author: Pasha C.
crawfish beignet.review: Not as good as kickin crab or Ray's crab shack.  The sauce at swamp wasn't too tasty.  The only good thing is they serve crawfish beignet.  Ordered a crab but had no taste.  Service is so so.

excerpts: We ordered the crawfish beignet.
Lightly gummy but good flavor.
Needed spice.
crawfish beignet.author: Carol m.
crawfish beignet.review:
Sadly disappointed on Fat Tuesday! We stopped in around four to have cajun food. 
No cajun music just elevator music. Owners are vietnamese and HAVE NO SOUL!
We ordered the Alligator sausage. No way to tell if it was alligator or pork or turkey or chicken or tofu. Very mild no spice. It needed a sauce. We asked the server and she said no sauce. I noticed on the menu there was a remoulade sauce. We ordered a serving of it. Helped somewhat. The coleslaw was amazing.
We ordered the crawfish beignet. Lightly gummy but good flavor. Needed spice. We requested tabasco and a serving of the white sauce from the coleslaw. Helped.
We ordered the soft shell crab. Very crispy but the body hadn't been cleaned well and was strong tasting. It came vietnamese style with pepper and lime. Overall good.
I ordered the Deviled Chicken wings. They were not spicy and came with a ranch style sauce. As I remembered it there was no sauce.
Husband ordered the fried shrimp sandwich with added coleslaw. Love the coleslaw! The sandwich was large and filling. BUT NOT SPICY!
We ordered a pitcher of anchor steam. She never brought water or additional napkins. 
Total bill was $55.96. I DID NOT TIP. I WOULD NEVER RETURN!!

excerpts:
1 lb clams, hurricane style, medium -- Tasty
2 orders rice -- Have to soak up the juices
1 order cajun fries (free) -- taste like normal fries with a cajun seasoning dusted on top.

Surprisingly hot and crispy
1 order sweet potato fries -- nice crisp and not soggy!
1 order fried calamari --
Some places you feel it's 80% fried batter, NOT HERE.
lb clams.author: Jenna H.
lb clams.review:
It's no Boiling Crab, but it satisfied my "cajun seafood" fix on my birthday. They have a check-in freebie for free cajun fries, hence why we picked this place compared to the other cajun seafood place  on Geary. Walked in on a Saturday night around 6:15 and it was EMPTY. I couldn't believe it. We found awesome parking and didn't have to wait! 

What we got:
2 lbs shrimp, Hurricane style (The whole shebang), Medium spicy -- Nice BIG shrimps!
1 lb clams, hurricane style, medium -- Tasty
2 orders rice -- Have to soak up the juices
1 order cajun fries (free) -- taste like normal fries with a cajun seasoning dusted on top. Surprisingly hot and crispy
1 order sweet potato fries -- nice crisp and not soggy! 
1 order fried calamari -- Some places you feel it's 80% fried batter, NOT HERE. Actually very minimal batter.

The difference of this place and other cajun seafood establishments is they don't serve it to you in a plastic bag. There are plates and utensils on the table, and they bring your food in a pot. They give you an extra bowl for shells and routinely come around and empty the shells as you go.

Service was attentive, albeit it was extremely empty on a saturday night. Surprised too since we came during the Outsidelands festival and figured it would be crowded with festival goers.

excerpts: We added 1 lb shrimp (+$14) and it easily fed our party of 4, with plenty of left overs to take home.
lb shrimp.author: Geminyna J.
lb shrimp.review:
ORDER:
The Prix Fixe dinner for 2 is a steal at $49! We added 1 lb shrimp (+$14) and it easily fed our party of 4, with plenty of left overs to take home. 


FIXED PRICE MENU 
SERVED FAMILY STYLE for sharing:
* hearty bowl of Clam Chowder for 3-4 people, 
* side of vinegary Cole Slaw, 
* roasted Whole Dungeness Crab, 
* savory Garlic Noodles, 
* 6 light fluffy Beignets to end the meal.
** don't forget your order of amazingly crispy Cajun Fries, free with Yelp check-in!


THE BILL:
All that for $15.75 / person!  
2 pitchers of libations later and we doubled the $ amount per person (whoops), but sans alcohol, the food at Swamp is delicious and reasonably priced.


SAUCE RECOMMENDATIONS:
* "Hurricane Sauce" is the all-in house equivalent of Boiling Crab's shabang: Original Cajun, Lemon Pepper, and Garlic Butter (with a mild curry twist).

* Not your typical "Garlic Butter". The unexpected coconut milk base was rich and savory without being the usual oily sauces at other Cajun seafood spots. 


TABLE FAVORITE: 
Glad we tried the Swamp's rendition of Garlic Noodles, despite the mixed reviews on Yelp. 

Perfectly al dente, aromatic garlic flavor, all without the heavy greasy sauce typical of Vietnamese / Cajun Garlic Noodles. 

Pretty please remain consistently delicious. 


SERVICE:
Friendly and attentive.

The Manager interacted with each table, unfazed by the Friday dinner rush. He seated our party of 7 and explained the Swamp's sauce bases and their levels of heat. Nice guy with a great sense of humor. 

Our server made sure our long table remained well appointed with filled water carafes, plenty of napkins, hot towels, etc., all throughout our meal. 


PARKING:
Metered street parking until 6pm. Small public lot behind the building has a high turnover so once or twice around the block and you'll probably land a spot. 


GIST:
Yes we will definitely be back. Perhaps during Happy Hour (3pm to 6pm).


POST-SWAMP:
If you can muster up the stomach space, cross the street! 

It's almost impossible to save room for dessert but our fam favorites are right across the other side of Geary: a homemade scoop of Joe's Ice Cream or milk tea & boba from Sharetea.

excerpts: I also got 1lb shrimp with butter garlic
it was amazing!

lb shrimp.review: This place is welcoming! The workers are really nice! I'm from SoCal and came to San Fran for vacation this place reminds me of boiling crab and kickin crab back in so cal, but taste so much better. I would really recommend people to trying this place out if you love seafood! I recommend getting the garlic noodles it's amazing they have happy hour from 2-6 and the garlic noodles are 5 dollars during that time. I also got 1lb shrimp with butter garlic it was amazing!

Overall, it's ok, nothing spectacular
, perhaps i am simply used to the crab in the bag thing and flavoring so that it's no longer a novelty to me.
Not to mention they're cropping up more and more.
Anyone notice the old Cable Car Pizza/
lb shrimp.author: Amorette K.
lb shrimp.review:
12/19/12 Update:  Ok, i couldn't just let that first experience early on dictate my future eating experiences since I tend to frequent lots of restaurants in the Richmond District.  Exactly one month later I dragged a friend with me to give Swamp another try.  They've read the reviews and have definitely done some fixes.  The restaurant was nice and toasty upon entering and the staff was very attentive throughout the meal and that's with at least 7 other tables they were waiting on, also the hurricane boil for our crab was less saltier and more flavorful.  The shrimp is still my favorite as i can tear through 1 pound quick!  This 2nd return visit replaces my 1st so-so visit so there will likely be a 3rd, 4th, 5th, etc....

On 11/19/12, we ended up here after the owner/manager of Cajun SF stole our parking and we decided to ditch that place for this one but that's another story.  So here is the review for Swamp:

I know people have mentioned it's like the Boiling Crab type of places.  In overall concept it is except for one thing - food DOES NOT come in a bag!  It comes in a bowl and you better eat it fast because compared to coming out in a bag, it will cool down faster than you can eat it!  By the time you reach the last few pieces in your bowl you will be lucky if the sauce temp is luke warm.  Now what did we order?  1lb shrimp (Garlic Butter - Medium), Garlic Noodles and 1 crab (hurricane style - medium).  Overall, it's ok, nothing spectacular, perhaps i am simply used to the crab in the bag thing and flavoring so that it's no longer a novelty to me.  Not to mention they're cropping up more and more.  Anyone notice the old Cable Car Pizza/Hookah Lounge is now going to be something called Rockin' Crawfish?   

The food is ok, the crab wasn't the meatiest and the hurricane flavoring was too salty for my taste.  But the shrimp were pretty meaty and with spicy garlic butter pretty yummy but then I'm not surprised that they do garlic butter well.  After all the people running this place are related to the folks a few blocks away at PPQ!  Who...if you can keep following me....ran/run Perilla (also on Irving) which was replaced by Swamp!  

Service?  They're working out the kinks.  Like all new restaurants, they'll get it down.  They were attentive but tentative and tried to be helpful.  

A the end of the meal?  A bill total of $80, including tip, for two people, had me expecting a little more as far as food quality and left me feeling like I overpaid big time!  Of course had we not ordered the crab and just ordered another pound of shrimp, the bill would have been a lot less but then where is the fun in that?  Must have crab!

PS - If you go to my post about the old Perilla that was replaced by Swamp, I have a mention about the waiter who does not write orders down.  He's still here at this place!

Cajun Fries: B - Crunchy and spicy, a little too spicy.. all of the spices were piled on a couple of fries.

excerpts:
Ordered 1 lb shrimp, and 1 lb of combo.
shrimp was good and fresh, tasty, not too salty.
1 lb of combo for clam and mussel was less than we expected in quantity, maybe the shells were heavier than we think.

lb shrimp.review:
came on a sat. night. 5 min wait, which is good, but parking was hard to find in the area. 

Ordered 1 lb shrimp, and 1 lb of combo.
shrimp was good and fresh, tasty, not too salty.
1 lb of combo for clam and mussel was less than we expected in quantity, maybe the shells were heavier than we think. But it was not bad for the taste.

Overall taste are within my expectation, but my gf loves it. 

It would be a 4 stars if more clam and mussel for the combo.

excerpts: The coleslaw tasted like nothing, just bland.
Garlic noodles were delicious.
Garlic fries were awesome but they came later during dinner
so we didn't really get to enjoy them.
My clams and shrimp with flavored in the hurricane sauce with med spiciness.
It was good, the hurricane flavor was like the original flavor you get at rockin crawfish.
The beignets were tasty.
coleslaw.author: Janice J.
coleslaw.review:
I love anything seafood! Came here with my sister and a friend for dinner. There wasn't a wait (Yasss!) and was seated to our table quickly.

The service was quick when we ordered but the wait for our food was loooong! 
After 10 mins or maybe more of waiting we finally got our food.
-12 raw oysters
-coleslaw 
-clam chowder 
-garlic noodles
-garlic fries(free when you check in)
-2 item combo (clams/shrimp) -mine!
-2 item combo (crawfish/clams)
-1lb crab
-beignets

Oysters were good to me but it was my fist time trying oysters, but my sister said it could've been better.
The coleslaw tasted like nothing, just bland.
Garlic noodles were delicious. Garlic fries were awesome but they came later during dinner so we didn't really get to enjoy them.
My clams and shrimp with flavored in the hurricane sauce with med spiciness. It was good, the hurricane flavor was like the original flavor you get at rockin crawfish. The beignets were tasty. We had to wait for them even though it comes with the meal if you order the crabs.

Overall I wouldn't really come back, the service was quick at first but it was slow after we ordered.  If we're in the area maybe but for now it's a no.

excerpts: The meal started with fresh, crunchy coleslaw and chowder made in-house.
We devoured these.
coleslaw.author: Crystal C.
coleslaw.review:
I woke up to a group message from my girlfriends saying they were STILL full the next day from our little feast at Swamp the night before! This place is soo good!

My girls and I shared The Special for Two, it's on the menu for $60 for 2 but we split it three ways and it was more than enough. The meal started with fresh, crunchy coleslaw and chowder made in-house. We devoured these. Next we had Garlic Noodles and Lobster in Garlic Butter sauce, and let me tell you, it was as decadent as one could possibly hope. 

There was a ton of meat in the lobster and the sauce was heavenly. We doused our noodles with the drippings and just stopped talking for a good five minutes to fully enjoy the grub, which is a really long time for us not to say something. We looked up after our plates were clear, smiling, faces buttery, and clinked our glasses of Blue Moon in unison.

For dessert we enjoyed fluffy, hot beignets sprinkled generously with powdered sugar. My two wishes: that we had some strawberry jam to put on the beignets, and that we had some dipping bread for the garlic butter sauce. OK now I must got eat something because it's torture to write about such a fantastic meal without feeding myself something.

excerpts: We ordered a pound of shrimp in house sauce, cajun and sweet potato fries, and the coleslaw.
Sauce was delicious, fries were great, coleslaw was whatevs.
Most sides are definitely overpriced here, but overall, was a pleasant experience, but I wouldn't come out of my way to make another trip.
