coleslaw.review: Had a Groupon for two. We ordered a pound of shrimp in house sauce, cajun and sweet potato fries, and the coleslaw. Sauce was delicious, fries were great, coleslaw was whatevs. Most sides are definitely overpriced here, but overall, was a pleasant experience, but I wouldn't come out of my way to make another trip.

excerpts: Crab legs with lemon pepper, clams/shrimp combo with coconut curry, calamari, green beans and coleslaw.
I was not a big fan of coleslaw but green beans were great!
coleslaw.author: Erena S.
coleslaw.review:
We look so happy getting seafood! We ordered 3 dishes and we ordered more.  Crab legs with lemon pepper, clams/shrimp combo with coconut curry, calamari, green beans and coleslaw. I was not a big fan of coleslaw but green beans were great! We needed vegetable.

So fortunate to be friends for almost 20 years and we look like 3 year old babies here.

excerpts: I've tried the dungeness crab in coconut curry, coleslaw, cajun fries, hot links, garlic noodles, grilled asparagus, sautéed string beans, and a pound of shrimp tossed in spicy hurricane sauce.
coleslaw.author: Ann S.
coleslaw.review:
Sooooo... this place is quickly becoming one of my addictions. I'm what you would consider an Asian version of Mr. Bubba, himself. 

I sure do love me some shrimp. 

I like 'em sautéed, deep fried, barbecued, on kabobs, grilled, sashimi style, etc etc, but most of all, I like 'em boiled and slathered with heavily seasoned sauce. 

Mmmm mmmm! 

I came here late night ready for some good grubbin' and sure enough, I was not disappointed. 

I've tried the dungeness crab in coconut curry, coleslaw, cajun fries, hot links, garlic noodles, grilled asparagus, sautéed string beans, and a pound of shrimp tossed in spicy hurricane sauce. It was all so good! 

As the indecisive person that I am, I would recommend the hurricane sauce. It's a combination of all the sauce options. No need to choose. You get it all! Personally, I think it tastes best too.

Oh and don't think you can roll up in here all cute and dainty. They hand you a bib for a reason. I must've been flinging crab meat all into my hair throughout the entire dinner. 

Great service, casual ambiance.

Winner winner shrimpy dinner.

excerpts: Additionally, the alligator sausage with coleslaw is very good!
Definitely check this place out.
coleslaw.author: Masha V.
coleslaw.review: The food here is great! Shrimp in hurricane sauce (that is of course if you like spicy) is very delicious. We also get crab in butter sauce with corn and sometimes potatoes. Additionally, the alligator sausage with coleslaw is very good! Definitely check this place out.

excerpts: It comes with coleslaw, clam chowder, crab, garlic noodles, and beignets!
That's a great deal if you ask me!
The crab was alright but everything else was great!
The restaurant is Chinese owned and the service was great!
coleslaw.author: Jacqueline C.
coleslaw.review:
$50 for a three course dinner for two that includes crab! It's pretty good and it's totally worth it. 

So I have been looking for a good Cajun place in the city that serves delicious crabs and oysters. But when I saw the dinner for two I couldn't say know. It comes with coleslaw, clam chowder, crab, garlic noodles, and beignets! That's a great deal if you ask me! The crab was alright but everything else was great! The restaurant is Chinese owned and the service was great! I was extremely full by the end of the meal and felt that I got my money's worth. 

I didn't know what to expect when I first came to this place but I am happy that I have it a shot.

excerpts: From the coleslaw to the clam chowder to the crab are to die for!
The hurricane sauce is sooooo good.
Love the food, ambiance the service.
They have happy hour too!
coleslaw.author: Art M.
coleslaw.review: Had a great time last night! The delicious taste of Hurricane sauce of our the crab is still lingering in my mouth. Service from the 2 guys ( the asian manager or owner and good looking funny young man) are very casual, funny and superb. I like that they made the atmosphere very relaxing and chill. From the coleslaw to the clam chowder to the crab are to die for! The hurricane sauce is sooooo good. Love the food, ambiance the service. They have happy hour too!

excerpts: The coleslaw has the yummy crack taste of a certain chain; you know what I mean.
coleslaw.author: Peter K.
coleslaw.review:
The coleslaw has the yummy crack taste of a certain chain; you know what I mean. If you don't, the slaw here is good.

Crawfish bengiet. So good if you like crawfish.

Generous delicious portion of hushpuppies. 

Garlic noodles also made of crack.

I meant to eat only half the grilled alligator sausage.  Someone stole the rest. Or did I eat it? It's all gone.

Only came on for a snack.  Had to try several different dishes.  Do full, and I have take out.

excerpts: - Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw.
Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage.
coleslaw.author: Tracy T.
coleslaw.review:
Highlights
- I came with a group of 6 on a week night after a Giants game and there was no wait.
- Bar area and tables, take your pick and good for large groups. 
- Includes TVs so you can definitely catch a game here as well as order beer and wine. 
- The perfect cajun seafood fix spot in SF. Not in the ghetto, clean, and close by.
- Oysters: Tasted fresh, but nothing special. 
- Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw. Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage. 
- Cajun Fries: A MUST. Free with the YELP check-in offer. A ton of flavor packed in these perfectly fried potatoes. 
- Shrimp in Hurricane Sauce: Hurricane is a mixture of all their sauce offerings: Cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper. Mild was good for me, since I'm a whimp when it comes to spicy things but Medium was more flavorful compared to the group. So good with their garlic noodles!

Improvements
- Dungeness crab in garlic butter: recommended by the waiter. Nothing special here. I would rather order another lb of the hurricane shrimp instead of this one. 
- Clams in hurricane sauce: I was never a fan of clams, so am my personal preference I would skip this one next time. If you love clams, this one is for you.  

Tip
- Parking can be difficult especially during lunch, dinner, and weekends.

Sadly disappointed on Fat Tuesday! We stopped in around four to have cajun food. 
No cajun music just elevator music. Owners are vietnamese and HAVE NO SOUL!
We ordered the Alligator sausage. No way to tell if it was alligator or pork or turkey or chicken or tofu. Very mild no spice. It needed a sauce. We asked the server and she said no sauce. I noticed on the menu there was a remoulade sauce. We ordered a serving of it. Helped somewhat. The coleslaw was amazing.
We ordered the crawfish beignet. Lightly gummy but good flavor. Needed spice. We requested tabasco and a serving of the white sauce from the coleslaw. Helped.
We ordered the soft shell crab. Very crispy but the body hadn't been cleaned well and was strong tasting. It came vietnamese style with pepper and lime. Overall good.
I ordered the Deviled Chicken wings. They were not spicy and came with a ranch style sauce. As I remembered it there was no sauce.
Husband ordered the fried shrimp sandwich with added coleslaw. Love the coleslaw! The sandwich was large and filling. BUT NOT SPICY!
We ordered a pitcher of anchor steam. She never brought water or additional napkins. 
Total bill was $55.96. I DID NOT TIP. I WOULD NEVER RETURN!!

excerpts: Gumbo!
Garlic Noodles!
Seafood Boil!
What more can you ask for?
Great service and friendly!
gumbo.author: Ro N.
gumbo.review:
Gumbo! Garlic Noodles! Seafood Boil!  What more can you ask for?  Great service and friendly!  Our server offered suggestions and answered our question and was very generous with his time and advice. 

Nice eclectic offering of food. They have alligator too...

excerpts: We got the gumbo, sweet potato fries, garlic noodles, sausage, shrimp and crawfish hurricane sauce + corn (medium--it wasn't spicy so will try higher next time).
We were pretty hungry and felt the food arrived timely, hot, and in normal/expected portions to what we've gotten at other places.
I don't think we'd get the gumbo and sausage again
(it was fine, but we're not huge gumbo and sausage fans in general--got them just to try), but we'll definitely be back for the crawfish and shrimp boil.
Yes, this place is not the Boiling Crab
but it's good and hits the spot.
And I think the prices are reasonable considering restaurants have higher rent costs in SF so don't expect suburb prices.
gumbo.author: Kelly K.
gumbo.review: The hubby, bff, and I enjoyed our lunch here!  I was craving shrimp/crawfish boil and this was the only place nearby open for lunch and with a decent health inspection score (90!).  We got the gumbo, sweet potato fries, garlic noodles, sausage, shrimp and crawfish hurricane sauce + corn (medium--it wasn't spicy so will try higher next time).  We were pretty hungry and felt the food arrived timely, hot, and in normal/expected portions to what we've gotten at other places.  I don't think we'd get the gumbo and sausage again (it was fine, but we're not huge gumbo and sausage fans in general--got them just to try), but we'll definitely be back for the crawfish and shrimp boil.  Yes, this place is not the Boiling Crab but it's good and hits the spot.  And I think the prices are reasonable considering restaurants have higher rent costs in SF so don't expect suburb prices.

excerpts: The gumbo lacked the burst of flavor and excitement you would normally expect from gumbo.
The sauces that the seafood came in were bland and the flavors lacked any sort of dimension.
The fries were cold.
The raw oysters were overpriced.
gumbo.author: Kelly W.
gumbo.review:
My mom wanted to treat my family to dinner and this experience was a memorable one, unfortunately. 

The service was mediocre..and that is me being generous. They weren't rude or anything, just really slow and not very competent. 

The food was awful. The gumbo lacked the burst of flavor and excitement you would normally expect from gumbo. The sauces that the seafood came in were bland and the flavors lacked any sort of dimension. The fries were cold. The raw oysters were overpriced. Wait, it gets worse...

Later that night I felt queasy and unwell. When I started puking, I realized that I had gotten food poisoning. I wasn't the only one, my mom had gotten sick too. It's really unfortunate that she spent her money on such a lousy place. Thinking of the food makes me feel nauseous even now. Stay far away from this place, unless you're into puking your brains out and reliving a nightmare.

excerpts:
We tried the three things you would judge any Cajon/Creole restaurant on ... 
Gumbo.
Not!
gumbo.author: James G.
gumbo.review:
I'm sorry, but I am not sure, either, how this restaurant gets anything near a 4-star.  French Laundry only got a 4.5, for Christmas Sake!  Anyway, even "factoring" the type of restaurant it is, "homey" it wasn't even very good.  Maybe this is based on having been to New Orleans and many other Cajun/Creole places in the Bay Area.

Let me first say the only server in the place was VERY pleasant, though she was on her smart phone apps a lot of the time., back by the bar.

We tried the three things you would judge any Cajon/Creole restaurant on ... 
Gumbo. Not!  This was nothing more than watery roux and some canned crab sprinkled in for, I assume, legal minimum reasons.  

The Soft Shelled Crab was bordering on tiny, so that it was impressively more viscera than anything else.

The Garlic Noodles were pasty chow mien noodles, not even garlicky enough to keep the vampires away.

Beignets were, at least, the good news at the end of every newscast.  It did make us feel better for a moment.  This unobtrusive place is more akin to a fast food place in quality.
(Think Long John Silver's version of a seafood restaurant)  I'm sorry but if you invited me, and paid, I would pass.

I don't have to name them, but there are much/many better Cajun places in the Bay Area.

excerpts: The Hurricane sauce tastes a lot like gumbo...
Tasty, but doesn't really sit right for a crawfish boil (but then again, I don't know much about boils...).
Shrimp was cooked perfectly, nice and crisp.
gumbo.author: Doris K.
gumbo.review:
Don't come here expecting Boiling Crab because it's not even close. With that said, it's decent if you don't compare (too much). The restaurant has a slight "mardi gras" theme, with beads and stuff hanging from the wall on the right when you enter. The old man, who I assume is the owner, was very nice and cheerful. He seated me even though my friend wasn't there yet.

It was kind of busy for a Saturday night -- the restaurant was about three-fourths full. When my friend arrived, it took a while before we had our orders taken since the servers were suddenly MIA and the owner was chatting up the table next to us. But as soon as he noticed, he turned around and helped us. He was very nice about the free fries with Yelp check-in (no rolling eyes or exasperated look because someone is redeeming a coupon THEY put up, so that was nice).

Food came rather promptly. I had 1lb of the 2 item combo with shrimp and clam ($14/lb), medium spicy and Hurricane seasoning (equivalent to "The Whole Shebang") with sausages (I think it was 6 pieces for $2.50, which is way cheaper than BC I think) and corn ($0.75?). My friend had shrimp with corn and potato (they literally give you one huge spud haha). Food came in a metal bowl and at first I thought it wasn't going to be enough for me, but I was satisfied at the end. The Hurricane sauce tastes a lot like gumbo...Tasty, but doesn't really sit right for a crawfish boil (but then again, I don't know much about boils...). Shrimp was cooked perfectly, nice and crisp. But the corn was defnitely soggy and overcooked.

Service was good overall. We had our waters refilled without asking, and limes were brought out after we asked. At the end of our meal, they didn't rush us to leave or give us the check. They also give you heated hand wipes, which is a nice touch! Doesn't really get the smell out, but a nice gesture.

excerpts: For sides, I love the garlic noodles and the gumbo.
gumbo.author: Mary N.
gumbo.review:
One of the few places in San Francisco that do the cajun seafood boil (think Boiling Crab, but served in big bowls instead of plastic bags). 

The food for the "seafood boils" itself is good - I've only gotten the shrimp, crawfish, mussels. It's a bit pricey in my opinion ($15.99/lb) but worth it mostly due to lack of other options. I would skip adding the hot dogs / potatoes unless you reaaaaally want them. They're not amazing and I feel like it doesn't cook in the sauce long enough to really soak it up. I must say, the garlic butter sauce is delicious! For sides, I love the garlic noodles and the gumbo. 

For the ambiance - depends when you go! It's usually been pretty empty when I've gone (even weekends 6pm) so you don't have to wait very long. I personally prefer that because you can actually hear your party talking.  It seems like a nice place to watch Warriors games as they've got the big TVs, but no roaring crowd like in a sports bar or other venues to watch it amongst other fans. The decor itself is cajun themed and interesting to look at. 

Service is hit or miss. I've encountered strange waiters who make awkward and semi-insulting jokes, but also really kind and attentive one. I would imagine the service should be better because it's been empty with max 1-2 other parties when I've visited, but who knows.

excerpts: Fine, jambalaya wasn't an option so gumbo, hot link, Cajun fries and beignets is what I ordered.
Gumbo was pepper, like that was literally the only spice they used.
Hot links side was a half a link cut into 6 pieces (seriously?!).
Cajun fries were french fries with an over abundance of season salt.
And if that wasn't bad enough you can dip your hot link and fries in some authentic Cajun dip made up of a mixture of ketchup and barbeque sauce.
Last, but not least, we get to the beignets.
Only 2 had powdered sugar on them, and they were burnt.
If you are going to make the foolish mistake of burning something, and then have the audacity to serve it, the least you could do is cover that mess with sugar.
I laugh now, but at lunch time it was not so funny.
Thank God
I didn't get the $58 crab.
gumbo.author: Monica F.
gumbo.review: Where does one begin with a one star bad review.  The service was horrendous. I was trying to order a po boy and was informed that they no longer serve that. I could have the $58 crab though. In what realm does an $8 sandwich equate to a $60 substitute? Fine, jambalaya wasn't an option so gumbo, hot link, Cajun fries and beignets is what I ordered. Gumbo was pepper, like that was literally the only spice they used. Hot links side was a half a link cut into 6 pieces (seriously?!). Cajun fries were french fries with an over abundance of season salt. And if that wasn't bad enough you can dip your hot link and fries in some authentic Cajun dip made up of a mixture of ketchup and barbeque sauce.  Last, but not least, we get to the beignets.  Only 2 had powdered sugar on them, and they were burnt.  If you are going to make the foolish mistake of burning something, and then have the audacity to serve it, the least you could do is cover that mess with sugar. I laugh now, but at lunch time it was not so funny. Thank God I didn't get the $58 crab.

excerpts: Gumbo:
Very plain even after adding salt.
Didn't taste homey and comforting like a gumbo should.
I would not order this.
gumbo.author: Courtni W.
gumbo.review:
Service: 

Waiter was 50 flavors of salty and rushed us to order as soon as we sat down. The staff spoke Cantonese to each other and would talk negatively about the customers. 

Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet. Dough was too doughy and there wasn't enough of crawfish. Very average. 

Shrimp: got the hurricane cajun flavor. The texture of the shrimp was decent and the flavor wasn't bad. Not worth $15.50 for the pound. You can find shrimp of equal quality at other places significantly cheaper. 

Gumbo: Very plain even after adding salt. Didn't taste homey and comforting like a gumbo should. I would not order this.

excerpts: The gumbo was just gravy with some veg in it.
Their signature hurricane sauce was nothing special.
I think the boil was better [which means no flavoring].
gumbo.author: Heejin L.
gumbo.review:
Don't let the photos on Yelp fool you. I think I am being generous with 3 stars. 
It definitely does not look and taste like how the food is represented in those photos.

The seafood was definitely not fresh. The crawfish was not good at all. The meat stuck to the shells and they barely had any tomalley in them. Ordered an order of potato for the boil and it came with just half a potato.

The crawfish beignets were not good at all either. It tasted like pizza because it had huge pieces of bell peppers. That was mostly what you could taste.
The gumbo was just gravy with some veg in it.
Their signature hurricane sauce was nothing special. I think the boil was better [which means no flavoring]. The spicy habanero spice level wasn't that spicy as well. 

Definitely a poor man's version of Boiling crab.

excerpts: We ended up ordering a whole crab with garlic butter sauce, the shrimp & clam combo with lemon pepper sauce, 1/2 dozen raw oysters, gumbo with rice, garlic noodles, corn, potato, and French bread for dipping.
The gumbo is one of the best that I had and tasted very authentic.
The crab was tasty.
The legs were full of meat
and I was pleasantly surprised that they included the "goo".
Shrimp and clams were fresh and went really well with the lemon pepper sauce.
I would pass on the garlic noodles in the future.
gumbo.author: Michael T.
gumbo.review:
We came here because of the Groupon deal. I was a little hesitant because I equate restaurant Groupons with "desperate for business". When we walked in at 4:30pm, I thought my fears were realized since it was mostly empty. They even seated us by the window. A classic restaurant trick to attract outside foot traffic.

But as others have stated, the service here is great. The waitress was patient when we wanted  the crawfish and was told that it was out of season. We ended up ordering a whole crab with garlic butter sauce, the shrimp & clam combo with lemon pepper sauce, 1/2 dozen raw oysters, gumbo with rice, garlic noodles, corn, potato, and French bread for dipping.

The oysters were not that great. I don't think they were as fresh as they could be. The gumbo is one of the best that I had and tasted very authentic. The crab was tasty. The legs were full of meat and I was pleasantly surprised that they included the "goo". Shrimp and clams were fresh and went really well with the lemon pepper sauce. I would pass on the garlic noodles in the future. It was a little clumpy and did not have that garlic punch that you would expect from other crab places in SF.

Extra bonus was that they still offered Happy Hour prices on a Sunday. I would definitely come back again even without a Groupon deal. Also by the time we finished up, the restaurant was 80% full.

excerpts: We indulged in raw clams, shrimp in garlic butter sauce, deep fried soft shell crab, cajun fries, and gumbo soup.
Overall, the food was fresh and pretty decent though we had to flag the waitress down few times since during our lunch time
there was only one waitstaff running around.
Pretty good deal since we brought Groupon, can't complain.
Most definitely, returning for crawfish season to get our Cajun fixes.
gumbo.author: Stella L.
gumbo.review: We indulged in raw clams, shrimp in garlic butter sauce, deep fried soft shell crab, cajun fries, and gumbo soup. Overall, the food was fresh and pretty decent though we had to flag the waitress down few times since during our lunch time there was only one waitstaff running around. Pretty good deal since we brought Groupon, can't complain. Most definitely, returning for crawfish season to get our Cajun fixes.

excerpts:
For a party of 5 adults we ordered (and were completely stuffed after finishing):
- 2 lbs of crab
- 1 lb of clams
- 2 lbs of shrimp
- 3 orders of sausage
- 1 order of gumbo
- 1 order of garlic noodles
- 1 order of cajun fries (free with yelp check in!)
- 5 pieces of corn

Food came out at a good pace and the only hiccups we had with our meal were that the sausage was accidentally left out and that we were slightly overcharged for the crab special.
gumbo.author: Jenny C.
gumbo.review:
We came here for my husband's birthday and enjoyed our meal!

For a party of 5 adults we ordered (and were completely stuffed after finishing):
- 2 lbs of crab
- 1 lb of clams
- 2 lbs of shrimp
- 3 orders of sausage
- 1 order of gumbo
- 1 order of garlic noodles
- 1 order of cajun fries (free with yelp check in!)
- 5 pieces of corn

Food came out at a good pace and the only hiccups we had with our meal were that the sausage was accidentally left out and that we were slightly overcharged for the crab special. To Swamp's credit, each issue was quickly remedied! We also used a groupon with the meal which helped bring down the cost.

We're already talking about the next time we'll be going back!

excerpts: The gumbo ($8) from what I remember was good, nothing all that spectacular
gumbo.author: Mandy G.
gumbo.review:
I am the poster child for Swamp! (Inside joke between my bf & I, hehe) 

One thing for sure, this place isn't swampy, hehe. I've been here twice and have had a good experience for both. My bf & I were both craving cajun food (second time) and it was between Swamp & Cajun House. Last time we were to Cajun House, it was super crowded, hard to find parking, and a bit of disappointment after purchasing a GroupOn deal. Swamp is located on the busy streets of Geary, but I don't think parking is too bad as compared to 5th Ave.. and they also have the awesome check-in deals for dine-ins - FREE cajun fries as appetizers! 

The interior here kinda brings me back home in NOLA because of all the festive decorations they have up. The staff is friendly and attentive. The manager(?) I think .. whoever the guy is, is funny. 

My typical order is always a pound of shrimp and a side of corn and rice. Hurricane flavor with medium spicy (always a regret). 

Pricing for my order: 
Shrimp - $14/lb 
Corn - $0.75
Rice - $1.50 
Coke/soft drink - $2.50 (free refill!) 

I guess for my review, I will let you know what my bf & I do. When our order comes out, we like to dump all the shrimp onto the plate to cool off. After a couple mins (even when still kinda hot), we peel all the shrimps and dump the excess remains into a bowl (provided by staff) and put the shrimps meat into the bowl that it came with (into the sauce bowl). Before we add the rice into the sauce bowl, we take out the excess sauce with a spoon and put it onto our plates, since we have no where else to put it (and in case you took out too much, you can add it back in). Lastly, we add the rice into the sauce bowl that already has the shrimp, and we mix it! Ta-da!! Even the manager guy liked our idea! ;) 

As for the medium spicy, I always forget that I shouldn't order it and regret it during my meal. For my second visit, I asked our waitress how spicy it would be and she said on a scale of 1-10, it'd be a 6. I took the chance and it felt like an 8!! T_T I should just order mild next time .. 

From what I remember on our first visit, we ordered Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6.50) and it tasted like chicken to us. It's always a good experience to try something new though, even if you may or may not like it. The gumbo ($8) from what I remember was good, nothing all that spectacular but maybe I'm biased because I lived in NOLA for awhile. 

Overall, I always enjoy my experience here and would definitely come back. When ordering the pound of shrimps, I highly recommend the hurricane sauce! Add a corn to your liking too ;)

Want to know the inside joke for the poster child thing? It's cause my bf & I were seated next to the front window when the restaurant was empty. People would see us eating and stop and stare or look at the menu before walking off or coming in. We would have a little argument that one of us was catching the attention and being the poster child, haha.

excerpts: I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.
My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.
I'll pass on ordering it again.
gumbo.author: Scott A.
gumbo.review:
I first went there after searching Yelp for new places to try.  I came across this one.  Being from South Louisiana, I'm always searching for places to "take me back".  

On Jan, 18, I drove to SwampSF from Oakland.  Not really set on a particular dish, I order the Oyster Po-Boy, to go. While waiting for my order, I wanted to buy one of their shirts, but the server couldn't find the size I was looking for.  :(  

When I got back to my car, the food smelled so good, I had to try it before I got home.  I ate half of the Po-Boy before I put the car in drive.  It was delicious.  Perfectly fried.

I told my coworkers about the place.  I could tell their mouths were drooling.

On 2/2, I took a coworker friend there.  He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.  I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.  He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.  He's still talking about it.  My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".  The crawfish beignet was interesting.  It wasn't bad.  I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.  There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.  I'll pass on ordering it again.  Overall the food was good, and they had the size of shirt I was looking for.

I'll definitely return.

excerpts: I would recommend trying the grilled alligator (really yummy seasoning) and the seafood gumbo.
The oysters weren't the best I've had in the city.
gumbo.author: Alli N.
gumbo.review: We ordered the shrimp seafood boil with the garlic butter sauce. It was really filling and big enough to share. I would recommend trying the grilled alligator (really yummy seasoning) and the seafood gumbo. The oysters weren't the best I've had in the city.

excerpts: We also ordered the gumbo which was just OK.
It wasn't bad
gumbo.author: Nhung D.
gumbo.review:
Had high hopes for this place due to all of the good reviews and I must say, it definitely lived up to my expectations. We came on a Saturday night around 9PM. Called in about 15 mins early to see if there was a wait and the person we spoke with said he would save a table for our party of five! Got there and there was a table ready for us in a packed restaurant, how awesome is that! 

Now onto the food..

We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!! Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy. For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce. Crawfish was out of season. :( The flavor was so delicious!!! The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles! Fully enjoyed every bite of it. We also ordered the gumbo which was just OK. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't order it again.

Compared to Boiling Crab: the sauce was not as thick, but definitely flavorful. It was much easier to enjoy as they put it in a bowl instead of a plastic bag.. Easier to use a spoon to scoop up some delicious sauce onto my garlic noodles with shrimp. They both have distinct tastes so if you're used to eating at BC all the time, then make sure to come here with an open mind.

Service was great! They tended to us quite regularly and cleaned up our table as much as they could throughout the course of the meal. No complaints there.

Overall, I would definitely come back! :-)

excerpts: I had the gumbo with rice with lots of hot sauce (I love spicy food) - it filled me up and was tasty.
My friends had the shrimp (1 lb. on the mild side, and 2 lbs. with butter and garlic).
Both were scrumptious.
The atmosphere is laid back, and the staff was very attentive, friendly and humorous.
Overall, it had a family homey feel which I liked.
gumbo.author: Marie M.
gumbo.review:
I was a first timer to "Swamp" last night (Friday, October 10th) and I must say my first experience was a tasty one.  I had the gumbo with rice with lots of hot sauce (I love spicy food) - it filled me up and was tasty. My friends had the shrimp (1 lb. on the mild side, and 2 lbs. with butter and garlic). Both were scrumptious. The atmosphere is laid back, and the staff was very attentive, friendly and humorous. Overall, it had a family homey feel which I liked. I even bought myself a "Swamp" t-shirt the staff was wearing.  

I will definitely be back.

excerpts: We decided to ordered takeout of gumbo, fried oysters, alligator, garlic noodles & fried shrimp.
Can you say delicious.
The alligator was on point!
I ordered so much
but I didn't realize, they gave us a box.
I definitely will be going back & trying more menu items, plus the oysters & gator.
I really struggle with guilt from eating the gator but gosh it's good...
gumbo.author: Tosha F.
gumbo.review: My daughter and I decided to try something new & we love seafood. We decided to ordered takeout of gumbo, fried oysters, alligator, garlic noodles & fried shrimp. Can you say delicious. The alligator was on point! I ordered so much but I didn't realize, they gave us a box. I definitely will be going back & trying more menu items, plus the oysters & gator. I really struggle with guilt from eating the gator but gosh it's good...

excerpts: I especially love the gumbo, garlic noodles, clams boiled hurricane Cajun style & habanero spice level.
The gator sausage is amazing too.
Do come here, bib up & nom!
gumbo.author: Katie W.
gumbo.review: Swamp is so good I make sure to workout real hard before I come here so I can eat one of everything. I especially love the gumbo, garlic noodles, clams boiled hurricane Cajun style & habanero spice level. The gator sausage is amazing too. Do come here, bib up & nom!

excerpts: And I always get the gumbo
gumbo.author: Janipher C.
gumbo.review:
Try the hush puppies 
Shrimp is so sweet 
I love hurricane or garlic butter sauce.
And I always get the gumbo

excerpts: Also ordered the oysters and gumbo which was a perfect starter before the crab.
gumbo.author: Joe N.
gumbo.review:
Excellent service, even better food.

Went here with my girlfriend after discovering this place on Groupon. Boy, were we glad we came here. First off, the service was top notch. Very quick, attentive, and the great conversation they provided really made the experience worth while. (Billy Boy was awesome!)

We ordered the Dungeness Crab w/ the Hurricane sauce, medium spicy. This was the best decision ever. The Hurricane sauce happens to be their house special, and it is for a reason. Also ordered the oysters and gumbo which was a perfect starter before the crab.

Will absolutely come back here again, and plan on it at least once a month, just to have a crack at everything on the menu.

excerpts: I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets!
So much to offer on their menu!
gumbo.author: Janny S.
gumbo.review:
I can't believe its my first time eating Cajun style seafood boil and I am a big fan of seafood! Why are all these Louisiana seafood boil restaurants here in the Bay Area opened by Asian people? I'm always a little perplexed by that. They must have a lot of  Cajun culinary talent!

Started off with a dozen of Kusshi, Washington oysters to share. They were fresh and meaty, but didn't have a lot of flavor. I usually enjoy oysters that are sweet and briny. It came with one slice of lime which was weird because I think oysters should be served with an abundance of lemons. There were 3 of us and we went with two orders of the 2 item combo, the first combo with clams and mussel, and the 2nd with crawfish and shrimp, in the hurricane boil (all the flavors in one - Original cajun, Garlic Butter, and Coconut Curry), medium spicy and threw in 3 corns, $14/pound. The hurricane boil flavor is definitely recommended; the sauce is rich from the coconut curry and spices. I loved it. My favorite items from the 4 we ordered are the clams and the shrimp because they were much more rewarding and meatier. The clams were big and plump that night. I have made the decision that I am not a fan of crawfish because for the amount of work you have to put in, the reward is meager. The garlic noodles are delicious and garlicy. I like to pour the hurricane sauce all over it for more flavor! For checking in on Yelp, you get a free side of Cajun fries which was a nice addition because I wanted to add that anyway. I love free!

It wasn't very busy that night so the service was great! They came around to empty our shell bowls frequently. One big plus about this place is that the food is served in nice metal bowls, we get real plates and utensils instead of paper plates, plastic forks and food served in plastic bags. This was definitely a plus! I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets! So much to offer on their menu!

excerpts: The gumbo tasted like rice with gravy--any yelpers who enjoyed the same gumbo I received have clearly never tasted authentic gumbo.
The "fried catfish" looked more like fish n' chips from an Irish pub.
gumbo.author: Chelsie D.
gumbo.review:
I'm not sure why this place has so many stars. Take it from a New Orleanian, this place offers nothing like we've got down south. 

First off, the prices are outrageous for the quality of food and the amount of food you receive. I called my mom to tell her the price per pound of crawfish here--- $14.50. Are you kidding me?! My mother's statement explains it all "...you've got to be kidding me! That's highway robbery!" Truth, mom, truth. (And I get it, of course crawfish will be more expensive here....but $14.50 per pound is outrageous--FYI back home it's $1.50/lb) 

I could go on forever really. Nothing served was authentic. The gumbo tasted like rice with gravy--any yelpers who enjoyed the same gumbo I received have clearly never tasted authentic gumbo. The "fried catfish" looked more like fish n' chips from an Irish pub. Even I can make yummier fried catfish than the Swamp; this coming from a girl who can't even properly make Kraft mac and cheese. 

The experience overall was pretty pathetic. Oh and since when is boiled crawfish served in a soup? Never. Since when does crawfish not include your corn and potatoes? Unheard of. 

And last, but not least, the service was awful. I think we waited for about 15 minutes for anyone to even ask us what we wanted to drink. 

This place is not Cajun. There's no southern hospitality present, and most of all, the food is nothing like home.

excerpts: , Gumbo was good too.
Price is fair.
Good food good service, will come back for sure!!
gumbo.author: Lex R.
gumbo.review: Just ate here, wow one man show but crab was delicious, Washington Oysters outrageous, Gumbo was good too.  Price is fair.  Good food good service, will come back for sure!!

excerpts: Gumbo was unique,  It didn't actually taste like gumbo, but some type of creamy? ?? who knows-what?
Final thought: would go back for the tasty food...on a relaxed, no rush evening.
gumbo.author: Sharine d.
gumbo.review:
service was good....there was a middle aged man (I'm assuming owner) who was actively managing the resturant experience.  He was excellant!
I don't know that I agree that price reasonable, I thought a bit high.  But......the king crab was WONDERFUL!!!! The garlic noodles were the perfect pairing for the hurricane base I had the crab cooked in.....very tasty.  Gumbo was unique,  It didn't actually taste like gumbo, but some type of creamy? ?? who knows-what?  Final thought: would go back for the tasty food...on a relaxed, no rush evening.

excerpts: We ordered a gumbo without rice, they brought over a plate of source with two pieces of chicken and a few small pieces of chopped up sausages inside.
gumbo.author: J. X.
gumbo.review:
They serve very small portion here. We ordered a gumbo without rice, they brought over a plate of source with two pieces of chicken and a few small pieces of chopped up sausages inside. It was $8.95!

We have tried many Cajun restaurants in the bay area, this is the most expensive one yet serves the smallest portion. The flavor was okay, but I won't come back.

excerpts: Really liked the alligator sausage and the gumbo.
gumbo.author: Ross I.
gumbo.review:
Tried to go to rockin crawfish first but there was a line.  While we were waiting, the waitress announced they ran out of crawfish.  This caused my friend to make a really bad joke to the waitress and when she didn't get the god-awful joke, he got embarrassed and we had to leave.  They probably wouldn't have served us anyway because the joke was so bad.  

Swamp sat us right away.  Really liked the alligator sausage and the gumbo.  The sauce with the crawfish was nothing to brag about, but once you've had the whole sha-bang à la boiling crab, nothing else will really come close.

The waitresses were friendly and the older guy was also nice to us.  Good thing we prevented our friend from making any more dumb jokes or else that probably would not have not been the case.

excerpts: Gumbo: I would opt out of getting this item.
gumbo.author: Amy L.
gumbo.review:
If you happen to be in the area and happen to crave some Creole/Cajun food. I love how you can get a free side of cajun fries with a check in, TOTALLY worth it because the Cajun fries is delicious. It comes out piping hot with a healthy sprinkling of seasoning. It's salty and spicy and what a good fry should be. 

This place can fit big parties, so it can accomadate large parties. I know a lot of people might compare this place to Boiling crab and in a way the menu is simple like boiling crab. But, there are unique items on the menu as well. 

Garlic noodles; delicious and the noodle is like chow mein. 
Shrimp with the hurricane is pretty much a mixture of all the seasoning. It is their house special and it is really delicious. It is kind of like a soup and the flavors are really not overly salty. 
Gumbo: I would opt out of getting this item. Definitely not their strongest and the ingredients are really sub par. 

I would definitely go back if I am around the area.

excerpts: Good food, good crab, good gumbo, in fact, everything we tried was good.
This is the 1st time we went here, and we tried the Shrimp, Dungeness crab, King crab, Gumbo, alligator sausage and calamari......
gumbo.author: Andy L.
gumbo.review:
Good food, good crab, good gumbo, in fact, everything we tried was good. This is the 1st time we went here, and we tried the Shrimp, Dungeness crab, King crab, Gumbo, alligator sausage and calamari......all good, nothing left to go. 

We have tried the various "crawfish" type places in the city, and the Swamp stands out as the best tasting so far.  We will be back.

excerpts: Got to taste the gumbo.
I would've gone in for another spoonful, but  didn't want to be rude.
gumbo.author: Lydia S.
gumbo.review:
I think they've taken the earlier critiques to heart and worked very quickly to fix everything. I went with another six people from SF Foodies Meetup.

Charlie, the chef-owner and everyone else  guaranteed we had a great meal tonight. The service staff seem to have already hit their stride. Once orders were taken, drinks were served and then, our several shared appetizers quickly followed. This transplanted Southerner loved the crispy hushpuppies with toothsome whole kernels of corn served with honey butter. The soft-shell crab was perfectly cooked. Loved the alligator sausage.

Entrees are perfectly cooked a la minute. I had the shrimp in garlic butter sauce with habanero spice. Definitely spicy! The warm French bread toasts were perfect for soaking up the sauce. Got to taste the gumbo. I would've gone in for another spoonful, but  didn't want to be rude. Our table ordered a wide range of entrees and everyone was really happy.

Comparing to similar restaurants in the Bay Area, Swamp came out on top. We all agreed we'd definitely be going back for more!

excerpts:
1 order of gumbo w/ rice

Overall, i have to say my favorite part was the shrimp.
The gumbo wasn't bad, but I've had some better gumbo in my days of having cajun food.
gumbo.author: Kenny L.
gumbo.review:
Another new cajun style joint in the City? I'm not mad at that

This spot is definitely family owned and I always respect that. They greet you nicely here as you walk in and they make good suggestions on what to order if it's your first time here. 

I believe the owner was the one who seated us and kind of gave us a 2 second overview of their menu before we dove into it

We ended up ordering:
1 IB of shrimp (hurricane / mild)
2 corn
1 side of bread
1 order of fried fish
1 order of cajun fries (comp'd w/ yelp check in)
1 order of gumbo w/ rice

Overall, i have to say my favorite part was the shrimp. The juices and sauce it came with in the bowl was PERFECT (not too watery and not too saucey), just the right texture. 
It wasn't too spicy for mild which was also perfect. 

The gumbo wasn't bad, but I've had some better gumbo in my days of having cajun food. The fries were a nice add since it was a comp'd w/ the yelp check in. 

The fish was MEH, pretty bland and the pieces were really small. I think they would be better w/ some of the cajun seasoning they use on the cajun fries (IMO)

Lastly, everything total was well worth it. I'd be back again the next time I want some cajun!

excerpts: From the sublime gumbo to the crawfish w/ four options of heat and four different sauces.
That's 16 different combos which mean endless time and cholesterol for you to sample all the insane possibilities.
You can also include corn, potatoes and/or sausage in w/ your order of seafood.
I also would recommend getting shrimp and clams as well.
gumbo.author: Terry Y.
gumbo.review:
This place is the best new spot in Inner Richmond! It's akin Boiling Crab but with more reasonable prices. You can be sure to get your cajun fix here. From the sublime gumbo to the crawfish w/ four options of heat and four different sauces. That's 16 different combos which mean endless time and cholesterol for you to sample all the insane possibilities. You can also include corn, potatoes and/or sausage in w/ your order of seafood. I also would recommend getting shrimp and clams as well. You can't really go wrong. 

My fave is the fried fish and the grilled alligator sausage. But for seafood, I go with the Shrimp and clams in their garlic butter sauce with a medium heat. 

If you enjoy seafood, this is a good place to start.

excerpts: We ordered Crab, Shrimp, Gumbo, Etoufee & Aligator Sausage.
ALL DISHES WERE EXCELLENT!
A few of us in the group preferred mild seasoning and their mild was actually pretty spicy.
Although it was spicy, it was still good!
On paper the Alligator sausage sounds exotic, but tasted like a regular sausage.
gumbo.author: Richard B. F.
gumbo.review:
I went to Swamp for a friend's Birthday this past Saturday 3.16.2013. This place reminds me of Boiling Crab minus the long wait and the plastic bags they serve the seafood in. I went with a group totaling 13 people. 

To start things off, the owners and servers were extremely friendly. They had a few beers on Tap I had the Hennepin which was good. There was a yelp check-in offer where you receive an order of Cajun fries when you check-in. About 4 of us took advantage of it and Swamp accomodated the offer. The Cajun fries were good and had spice.

A few of us grouped together and ordered a few things. We ordered Crab, Shrimp, Gumbo, Etoufee & Aligator Sausage. ALL DISHES WERE EXCELLENT! A few of us in the group preferred mild seasoning and their mild was actually pretty spicy. Although it was spicy, it was still good! On paper the Alligator sausage sounds exotic, but tasted like a regular sausage. They could have easily served us regular sausage and said that it was Alligator.

Overall, I would definitely go back for the food. I would also definitely go back for the extremely friendly and funny staff & owner.

excerpts: We ordered the gumbo, the Cajun shrimp appetizer, the soft shell crab appetizer, the  garlic noodles, the green beans, and the crawfish and clams in the garlic butter sauce.
The gumbo was just alright, not amazing, but still good.
but everything else was fabulous.
We love garlic, and the garlic noodles and the garlic butter sauce was sublime.
The flavor were strong but not overdone.
The soft shell crab and shrimp were fried perfectly, soft yet crispy.
The seafood was fresh.
Great service too.
When I left, my only thought was how good the food was when am I going to have a chance to come back.
gumbo.author: Courtney L.
gumbo.review: I went to swamp today, and wow, I left super happy. I can't say I'm a Cajun food expert, but I've had my fair share of Cajun food in the past.  We ordered the gumbo, the Cajun shrimp appetizer, the soft shell crab appetizer, the  garlic noodles, the green beans, and the crawfish and clams in the garlic butter sauce.  The gumbo was just alright, not amazing, but still good.  but everything else was fabulous.  We love garlic, and the garlic noodles and the garlic butter sauce was sublime.  The flavor were strong but not overdone.  The soft shell crab and shrimp were fried perfectly, soft yet crispy.  The seafood was fresh.    Great service too.  When I left, my only thought was how good the food was when am I going to have a chance to come back.

excerpts: Also, tried out fries and gumbo.
Both were good, but not really memorable.
gumbo.author: Neeners H.
gumbo.review:
This new cajun place popped up  in the city, so..of course..I had to try it out. My friends laugh at me because of this ridiculous obsession, but I'm pretty determined to find a local fave place outside of San Jose.

I'd come back if I was in the area, but probably wouldn't go out of my way. Nice, friendly service. Clean. Weird/quirky alligator head thing in the doorway when you walk in. Food was good. Got lemon pepper shrimp and hurricane shrimp. Asked for the spicy habanero, but seemed a little mild (for me). Sauce was still good though. Also, tried out fries and gumbo. Both were good, but not really memorable.

excerpts: The Gumbo, Shrimp bucket, & Beignets are recommended!
gumbo.author: Amnon R.
gumbo.review: Great please if you like Creole style cooking. The Gumbo, Shrimp bucket, & Beignets are recommended!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I ordered an alligator sausage, 2 sodas ( they forgot to serve and did not apologize when asked for it), Cajun fries, a gumbo with rice and a pound of shrimp, and apparently that was not enough for their attentions, even though they were not busy.
gumbo.author: Maggie L.
gumbo.review: Food was ok but the service really need some improvement. Make sure you dress up and order their crab if you expect better service. My boyfriend and I ordered an alligator sausage, 2 sodas ( they forgot to serve and did not apologize when asked for it), Cajun fries, a gumbo with rice and a pound of shrimp, and apparently that was not enough for their attentions, even though they were not busy.

excerpts: Do NOT get the gumbo!
While it has a few - very few - lumps of tasty seafood and sausage, 95% is thick, worthless gunk.
The fried calamari was good, also the seafood bengets.
gumbo.author: Roger H.
gumbo.review: Do NOT get the gumbo! While it has a few - very few - lumps of tasty seafood and sausage, 95% is thick, worthless gunk.  The fried calamari was good, also the seafood bengets.  Good Cajun fries too.  Those around us seemed to enjoy the boils but I'm too lazy to want to do my own shucking.  I should have gotten oysters too.

excerpts: The gumbo we ordered was kind of grossly thick and overly flowered, but generally this place was good.
gumbo.author: Valerie A.
gumbo.review: We saw this place in the neighborhood and thought we'd give it a try since we've never tried cajun food before. The place was pretty fast, reasonable, and the boil was pretty good (we got crayfish and shrimp). The gumbo we ordered was kind of grossly thick and overly flowered, but generally this place was good. Also got free cajun fries with our yelp check in!

excerpts: My family and I ordered gumbo, cajun fries, garlic noodles, and shrimp with the hurricane sauce.
Everything came out relatively quick.
Cajun fries were good, wasn't too salty.
Gumbo was alright, it seemed to lack more flavor.
Shrimp and hurricane sauce was okay.
The sauce has a water like consistency but the shrimp were huge!
The sauce I believe is a mixtures of garlic butter and lemon pepper, did not really wow me.
My favorite dish was the garlic noodles.
I felt that the noodles had the right amount of garlic flavor and more importantly, not oily.
Customer service was good, they kept refilling our waters, asked how our food was, and asked if we needed anything else.
They do not have dessert here so they can't sing happy birthday unless you bring your own cake.
Well our server said he would sing if we had brought our own cake haha.
gumbo.author: Brigitte M.
gumbo.review: Came here for a birthday dinner on an early Sunday evening. It was not crowded at all. My family and I ordered gumbo, cajun fries, garlic noodles, and shrimp with the hurricane sauce. Everything came out relatively quick. Cajun fries were good, wasn't too salty. Gumbo was alright, it seemed to lack more flavor. Shrimp and hurricane sauce was okay. The sauce has a water like consistency but the shrimp were huge! The sauce I believe is a mixtures of garlic butter and lemon pepper, did not really wow me. My favorite dish was the garlic noodles. I felt that the noodles had the right amount of garlic flavor and more importantly, not oily. Customer service was good, they kept refilling our waters, asked how our food was, and asked if we needed anything else. They do not have dessert here so they can't sing happy birthday unless you bring your own cake. Well our server said he would sing if we had brought our own cake haha.

excerpts: I've tried the raw oysters, raw clams, calamari, crawfish, lobster, crab, mussels, gumbo, and garlic noodles
(that's pretty much everything).
Definitely coming back.
My go-to: raw oyster shooters and garlic butter lobster with garlic noodles.
This place will not disappoint!
gumbo.author: Allen D.
gumbo.review: Their garlic butter sauce is definitely the best. I've tried Boiling Crab and Cajun House also and Swamp is definitely up there. I've tried the raw oysters, raw clams, calamari, crawfish, lobster, crab, mussels, gumbo, and garlic noodles (that's pretty much everything). Definitely coming back. My go-to: raw oyster shooters and garlic butter lobster with garlic noodles. This place will not disappoint!

excerpts: Next time I come back, I want to try the Cajun fries!
cajun fries.author: Wesley S.
cajun fries.review:
I don't eat seafood, so I got a few random plates:

Garlic noodles - pretty good! Very garlicky and lots of noodles.

Cajun wings - chicken wings with Cajun sauce. Not bad. 

Fried chicken tenders - good! The chicken tenders have a light deep fried layer of batter. Comes with tartar sauce for dipping. It's like ordering fish and chips... except it's chicken, and there's no chips.

My girlfriend got 1 pound of shrimp with hurricane sauce. She absolutely devoured it. Safe to say she really liked it here. It's not as good as Boiling Crab but it is the closest thing to it without going all the way to San Jose.

Next time I come back, I want to try the Cajun fries!

excerpts: For food, we had an array of cajun fries, fried shrimp, fried calamari, and garlic noodles.
As for drinks, we had a bottle of their sake ($30), which the server was amazing to offer us in hot and cold.
Our server Benjamin was so great that we ended up getting a second bottle of sake.
He truly went above and beyond to get us everything we needed and even joined in on our laughs and fun.
cajun fries.author: Cindy Z.
cajun fries.review: A group of us ended up here for drinks and small bites after Outsidelands on a Friday night. They were quick to accommodate a huge group of 8 for us. For food, we had an array of cajun fries, fried shrimp, fried calamari, and garlic noodles. As for drinks, we had a bottle of their sake ($30), which the server was amazing to offer us in hot and cold. Our server Benjamin was so great that we ended up getting a second bottle of sake. He truly went above and beyond to get us everything we needed and even joined in on our laughs and fun.

excerpts: I also got cajun fries which were great and the garlic noodles are delicious as well.
cajun fries.author: An L.
cajun fries.review:
I went around 9:45PM and it was not too busy because they were close to closing. The customer service was great because even though they were close to closing, I never felt rushed or anything along those lines. The waitress was very accommodating with water refills, more napkins, and limes. 

The mild hurricane sauce was mouthwatering and compliments the shrimp, crawfish, and mussels very well. I also got cajun fries which were great and the garlic noodles are delicious as well. 

Overall, customer service was great and so was the food! I'll definitely be coming back :)

excerpts: Our Cajun fries didn't take long to arrive.
Small size but good flavor.
The server gave us bibs and a big bowl to put shells in.
After the party of 11 received all their food, we received ours.
I ordered their 1 lb of hurricane Cajun shrimp with medium spiciness.
cajun fries.author: Claudia N.
cajun fries.review:
The boyfriend and I arrived at 2:30p on a Saturday, and it wasn't too busy. We got seated right away. There was a party of 11 seated right across from us. All family members. We knew our food was going to take a minute to get to us due to the large party. I didn't seem to worry since I was enjoying their happy hour beer, $4.25 for a pint of Corona. They have an awesome selection of beers on tap. Our Cajun fries didn't take long to arrive. Small size but good flavor. The server gave us bibs and a big bowl to put shells in. After the party of 11 received all their food, we received ours. I ordered their 1 lb of hurricane Cajun shrimp with medium spiciness. 7/10

The food was 4/5. Service 5/5. Beer section 5/5 

However, I do want to address an issue I had with my experience. While I was eating, I kept hearing the large party complain about every little thing ( the price, the slowness, the attitude of the staff, the selection of hot sauce ). I was truly embarrassed with the situation. When the large party got the bill, they were unhappy with the required tip for large parties. They were complaining among themselves on why they had to pay almost $60 in tip. When one of them discussed it with the server, the server explained very calmly how they charge a 15% gratuity tip for parties of 6 or larger. The lady complained how it was ridiculous they were being charge that much "since the service was slow and the food had no flavor." I don't know what this lady was expecting. Every restaurant I have been to requires a gratuity tip for large parties. It sucks but I understand. The lady kept saying how she was going to leave a horrible review on Yelp. I'm giving five stars to this location because of the way they handle this rude ass lady.

excerpts: My go to order is soft shell crab app (maybe Cajun fries too for a large party-- or if I'm feeling like being extra) and a pound of shrimp hurricane medium.
My mouth is literally watering as I type this out
The garlic noodles are an amazing addition to soak up all that left over sauce that is just TOO GOOD TO WASTE!
cajun fries.author: Georgia N.
cajun fries.review: Swamp is BY FAR the best Cajun boil place in the city! Believe me I have tried them ALL. It's my favorite food and guilty pleasure and I come here at least once a week. The wonderful people who run it have become like family to me! They make you feel so welcome and you leave feeling full of food AND love! Do yourself a flavor... I mean favor... and GET OVER TO SWAMP! My go to order is soft shell crab app (maybe Cajun fries too for a large party-- or if I'm feeling like being extra) and a pound of shrimp hurricane medium. My mouth is literally watering as I type this out The garlic noodles are an amazing addition to soak up all that left over sauce that is just TOO GOOD TO WASTE!

excerpts: Loved the happy hour deals, we got a dozen oysters which were very fresh, some nicely seasoned + perfectly crispy cajun fries, and an order of the heavenly garlic noodles.
We tried the garlic butter and hurricane sauce, both of which were great!
cajun fries.author: Michelle N.
cajun fries.review:
Since moving to SF from San Jose, I've been hard pressed to find a Boiling Crab/Kickin Crab replacement. Discovering this place was a happy accident :)

Loved the happy hour deals, we got a dozen oysters which were very fresh, some nicely seasoned + perfectly crispy cajun fries, and an order of the heavenly garlic noodles. We tried the garlic butter and hurricane sauce, both of which were great! I love how this place allows you to do half shrimp and half crawfish (or mussels or clams) unlike other places, so you don't have to choose just one.

Steve the owner was running the whole show on the Saturday afternoon that we came in, working as the only front of house person and probably cooking in the back too. He was super friendly and provided great service! This place has earned our loyalty and we'll definitely be coming back next time we've got a cajun seafood itch to scratch.

excerpts: We checked in for the free Cajun fries.
cajun fries.author: Joy W.
cajun fries.review:
Excellent, PPQ brought Cajun seafood to the Richmond. We had been curious about Swamp, with its eye-catching name in blue lettering and black awning. The interior has some interesting faux window paintings of scenic ocean views. The rest of the restaurant is very simple without all the usual cheesy seaside decorations.
So we came for an early dinner once and sat by the window. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw some spindly legs moving along the wall. I turned to check out what was in my peripheral vision and it was a daddy long-legs. Since the restaurant was still fairly empty, they didn't mind us switching to another table. It's no one's fault. I just remember it vividly. Maybe the spider likes Cajun food too?

The shellfish menu is pretty simple. You just...
1) Choose your shellfish. Pay by the pound.
2) Choose a sauce/flavor.
3) Choose level of spice.
There is a good selection of starters and sides. Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet. 

We went with the 2-item Combo ($15/lb.) of Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane / Mild Sauce,
& added Corn ($0.75) + Hot Link Sausage ($2.95):
The shrimp were tender and sweet, and the mussels were nice and springy. The dark red Hurricane sauce was quite tasty. I think the spicy sausages we added brought the mild close to a medium spice.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter ($29/lb):
These king crab legs tasted fresh, tender, and sweet. The leg meat was nice and springy. I appreciate that the crab legs were cut into smaller segments. They fit nicely in the bowls and made for easier eating. It went really well with the creamy garlic butter sauce.

We checked in for the free Cajun fries. They were a thicker cut, not too crunchy, lightly seasoned, pretty good. 

After we ate all the contents in our bowls, we were still left with a lot of sauce, which was perfect for dipping the toasted bread.

I enjoyed the dishes we ordered. I have to say I prefer the garlic butter to their hurricane sauce. I would come back to try out the rest of their menu, including the alligator sausage. I had some alligator in Australia and I quite like it! I'd definitely like to take advantage of their Happy Hour menu (2-6PM) too.

excerpts: I checked in on Yelp for the free Cajun fries.
Thank god
I did not pay for those fries.
It was the worse fries I've ever had and the smallest!
It was not crunchy nor was it hot.
In addition, there was barely any Cajun powder.
cajun fries.author: Tina P.
cajun fries.review:
I came here because of the groupon deal because their seafood prices by the pound are pretty expensive and I would say overpriced. I did have high expectations of this place because it did have decent ratings and I've been wanting to try it, but I was disappointed :( 

The server came pretty quickly but we weren't ready yet. However, when we were, it was pretty hard to get ahold of the server even though the restaurant was pretty empty. We were also not offered bibs, while I noticed other people had them on. A few other things I've noticed that were different from other Cajun places I've been to was that the food came in bowls instead of bags, we weren't offered limes, and we use plates and forks instead of the table and our hands. 

I checked in on Yelp for the free Cajun fries. Thank god I did not pay for those fries. It was the worse fries I've ever had and the smallest! It was not crunchy nor was it hot. In addition, there was barely any Cajun powder. I couldn't taste any Cajun at all. 

We started off with a pound of shrimp and clams in the hurricane sauce and the medium and habanero spice. The clams weren't worth it at all. The clam meat was very small and there were even some that were empty. The shrimp wasn't bad, but I've definitely had better. The shell was stuck to the shrimp pretty well, so it was hard to peel. 

As for the hurricane sauce, I am not the biggest fan of coconut curry, so it didn't come as a surprise that I wasn't the biggest fan of the sauce. It wasn't bad, but I prefer the house sauces at Cajun House and Boiling Crab. I don't really like the sweetness of it, so I probably should've tried the garlic sauce instead. Not to mention, there wasn't enough garlic in the sauce like I would normally expect.

We were still hungry so we decided to order another pound of shrimp and to try the garlic noodles. My mom told me not to because it's easily made and pretty expensive but since there were so many reviews about it, I thought I should. Man did I regret it. The bowl of garlic noodles came in a smaller bowl than the shrimp! My mom thought it would be oily because it would be made with butter but it barely had any at all. Normally that would be good, but this meant that the noodles had no flavor! I could barely see any garlic and you couldn't taste the garlic much either. The garlic hadn't been cooked to the point where the flavor had all come out yet or there just wasn't enough. I wished I had gotten something else instead....

Lastly, when I was about to use the groupon deal I found out I couldn't use the $50 value one because we didn't have four people, so we ended up paying an extra 30 instead. I guess it was my fault that I misunderstood the terms when it said dinner for 4 but I had just thought that it meant that the food was enough to fill four people...I mean if 2 people are eating $50 worth, doesn't that mean each person is paying more? That should be better for the business right? Well apparently not. If I had known ahead of time, we wouldn't have ordered the second pound of shrimp and the garlic noodles, especially since the groupon wasn't saving us that much to begin with. 

In conclusion, I probably wouldn't come back here again. The groupon is a good deal but $25 can't get you much food and definitely not enough for two people to be full. I don't particularly like the sauce either and definitely not the fries and noodles. Both my mom and I have agreed that we prefer Cajun House in terms of sauce, portion, freshness, service, and noodles! Of course, my favorite will always be Boiling Crab, but that's considerably further.

excerpts: Cajun Fries - Free with our YELP Check-In.
The check in on Yelp says that it expired 6/30/2014, but apparently they are still accepting it.
These were good, regular fries with a spicy seasoning.
cajun fries.author: Meghan L.
cajun fries.review:
WARNING: If you recently got back from Louisiana and are hoping to relive your amazing food and customer service experience, keep your expectations in check, this is SF after all. 

Service: What's that? When we first arrived it wasn't very busy, the 3 or 4 servers seemed flustered and confused. It only got worse as more customers arrived. No one is greeted when you walk in, and it isn't clear if you wait to be seated, or seat yourself. Once seated, menus were tossed at us hastily without a word being said. We quickly decided what we wanted, put down the menu and waited, and waited and waited until we eventually flagged someone down. She didn't ask us if it was our first time, didn't ask us what we wanted to drink, didn't ask if the sky was blue, nothing.  We neglected to order drinks and had to flag her down again. They didn't check on us ONE TIME during our meal, we had to flag them down for extra napkins and bibs which should already be provided because...messy. During our meal we saw several frustrated customers having to regularly flag someone down to get any services. I saw a women with a To-Go bag walk BACK in, speak to a server regarding her bill and then walk away, I made eye contact with her as she was leaving and she rolled her eyes and said "OMG". 
I hear ya girl! They also made a *BIG* error on our final bill. 

On a side note, the guy running around in sweat pants, who I assume to be the owner and didn't seem to do much of anything but hang near a couple tables in the back randomly turned on the music in the middle of our dinner, when he first turned on the music it was so loud, we saw several people startle, myself included. 

Food: This is NOT authentic. It is more Asian/Cajun Fusion. 
~ They should AT LEAST invest in Crystal hot sauce. It is straight from Louisiana.
1) Oysters: Can't really mess up raw oysters, but you CAN mess up the raw oyster experience. The limes (not lemons, LIMES) we were given were dry, they had no juice at all. The horseradish and cocktail sauce were in the same tiny container and if you don't like horseradish it was difficult to get the cocktail sauce out, they did NOT provide a spoon for the condiment and we had to try and use our forks....fail, Oyster Experience Ruined.

2) Hush Puppies - dry, hard and BLAND. Zero flavor. They came with a sauce which was tasty, but didn't fit with the Hush Puppies. SKIP THEM.

3) Alligator Sausage and Slaw - This was the best part of the meal. Sausage was flavorful, tender and juicy. The slaw was drenched in a tangy sauce. Good Combo. Needed Crystal Hot Sauce though!

4) Cajun Fries - Free with our YELP Check-In. The check in on Yelp says that it expired 6/30/2014, but apparently they are still accepting it. These were good, regular fries with a spicy seasoning. I'd order them again, but I'll never be back so maybe not. 

5) Shrimp and Clam Boil w/ Signature Hurricane Sauce - They should really put down what the Hurricane Sauce is, we were pretty disappointed. Given the name, we figured it would be a blend of true LA Cajun flavors...wrong. It is curry. The shrimp was cooked nicely, not overly done, however we have experienced shrimp much easier to peal than these ones.. The clams were good, but I did have a few that were really gritty. 

Decor: It is cute. I like the maroon wall painted up like bourbon street. I do think the other wall could use a huge mural of a bayou, but the small photo is OK too. 

Final Thoughts: I would not return to this place. I'll just go visit NoLa again.

excerpts: Cajun fries - I would say they're average.
cajun fries.author: Coco L.
cajun fries.review:
Meh I had high hopes for this place but I left feeling just flat...

My friend introduced this place to me and I've also heard great things so obviously I was hella excited. Came here for dinner after a long study sesh at school. We were brain dead and haaaangry! We came a little bit after they opened so it wasn't too busy. 

Parking - it may be a little tough no matter what day of the week it is since it's a busy street. Mostly metered parking but there is also residential parking if you're willing to walk a bit.

Service - very nice and friendly! 

Food - 
1. Cajun wings - it was alright but I would say too saucy for my taste. I wish it was more spicy though. 
2. Garlic noodles - really good! Just the right amount of garlic! 
3. Hurricane shrimp - I liked it but I felt it could've been spicier. I think it's great that they serve it in a bowl instead of serving it in a plastic bag like other places do. Way easier to eat this way! 
5. Cajun fries - I would say they're average. Nothing special but the fact that they're free for your check in makes it better! 

Don't know if I would come back but I'm glad I got to try this place out.

excerpts: I gave it 3 stars because I got there during happy hour and they would not honor the free Cajun fries when checking in using the Yelp app, even though we ordered from the regular menu.
I was kind of disappointed with the customer service.
cajun fries.author: Funk G.
cajun fries.review: Swamp is probably the best substitute for Boiling Crab.  It's about a 3 1/2 star place.  I gave it 3 stars because I got there during happy hour and they would not honor the free Cajun fries when checking in using the Yelp app, even though we ordered from the regular menu. I was kind of disappointed with the customer service.

excerpts: Cajun fries, bad.
claim chowder, bad.
mussel in hurricane sauce, good.
crab in hurricane sauce, ok.
I don't think I will go back anytime soon.
cajun fries.author: Michelle Z.
cajun fries.review:
Went there after warriors game night. We were trying to get something similar to boiling crab, but near by. yelp and found Swap. It was only two tables when we got there around 9pm. First of all, have to say the waiters(two of them) are really friendly and didn't give us a attitude because of we are late customers. 
But the food was really just ok. really salty and the shimps were not that fresh. Cajun fries, bad. claim chowder, bad. mussel in hurricane sauce, good. crab in hurricane sauce, ok. 
I don't think I will go back anytime soon.

excerpts: We checked in for the free Cajun fries which was cool to have on the side.
Sausages and Cajun fries were on point but kicking crab has 12 pieces for 3.99 whole here
was 6 pieces for 2.99.
Garlic noodles were ...
cajun fries.author: Auden W.
cajun fries.review:
First Time eating Cajun in the city. I usually satisfy my Cajun cravings in South Bay such as places like boiling crab or my all time favorite KICKIN crab...

The food here is somewhat pricier than the South Bay locations but it's understandable since it's the city and everything seems more expensive... I got the lb of shrimp for 15$... Steam rice and sausages on the side. My friend got the garlic noodles and Cajun wings. We checked in for the free Cajun fries which was cool to have on the side. 

The shrimp it self were large sized and fresh.. In a balanced flavorful sauce.. (Hurricane sauce). Sausages and Cajun fries were on point but kicking crab has 12 pieces for 3.99 whole here was 6 pieces for 2.99. Garlic noodles were ... Like garlic noodles, so can't really complain about that .. 

I did however see a happy hour menu that's from 2pm-6pm with dollar oysters.. Cheaper garlic noodles($5), cheaper Cajun wings..($5$ and so on... I'll Probably come back for a happy hour season but for now... I'll stick with kicking crab in San Jose for my Cajun fix!!

excerpts: So we ordered garlic noodles, oysters, wings, calamari, and got a free order of cajun fries from checking in on Yelp.
We also ordered drinks.
cajun fries.author: Dara S.
cajun fries.review:
Stumbled upon this spot while I was in the area waiting for my boyfriend. I noticed their Happy Hour sign and was pretty impressed how they include weekends as well. So we ordered garlic noodles, oysters, wings, calamari, and got a free order of cajun fries from checking in on Yelp. We also ordered drinks. Their watermelon iced tea was SO F****** GOOD. It was so refreshing with the right amount of sweetness and it also had pieces of watermelon in it. 

We spent about $30 for all that food and we didn't even finish our noodles because we were so full. Def worth trying out if you're in the area. HH is from 2-6pm everyday. And the owner was a really nice guy.

excerpts: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free Cajun fries :)
The ambiance is good as you walk in the entrance
you'll see an alligator head screaming at you :& lol
We ordered the hush puppies for appetizer and we had our free Cajun fries too!
For main course, we ordered the 2 lbs combination of shrimp and clams in a mild curry coconut and of course garlic noodles.
The Cajun fries is a meh...
I can't taste the Cajun part of it
but then again it's free
so no complain on this
The 2lbs shrimp and clams mild curry coconut is very good...
I would prefer it spicy
but my friend doesn't like spicy
so we opted for the mild.
The curry coconut is very flavorful (that I just want to dip a toasted sour dough bread on it)
yum yum!!!
Though, the 2 lbs seems so little compare it to the 2 lbs we order from other restaurants.
As for the garlic noodles...this is disappointing!
I couldn't taste the garlic at all plus the noodles are overcooked.
I had tried so many different garlic noodles in different restaurants
so I know my garlic noodles!
So I improvised and took some of the curry coconut sauce on my noodles and yes it became much okay and became curry coconut noodles!
I "might" come back to try the hurricane spice but will not order the garlic noodles again.
Definitely "Kickin Crab" and "Boiling Crab" are still my go to place!
cajun fries.author: CJ B.
cajun fries.review:
We couldn't decide what to eat on a late Saturday for lunch and since we found a parking near this restaurant, we decided to try it. 
If you check in on Yelp, you get a free Cajun fries :)
The ambiance is good as you walk in the entrance you'll see an alligator head screaming at you :& lol 
We ordered the hush puppies for appetizer and we had our free Cajun fries too!  For main course, we ordered the 2 lbs combination of shrimp and clams in a mild curry coconut and of course garlic noodles.
The hush puppies is good but it's something i usually don't order it so I can't really say if it's a best or there's a better one out there
The Cajun fries is a meh...I can't taste the Cajun part of it but then again it's free so no complain on this
The 2lbs shrimp and clams mild curry coconut is very good...I would prefer it spicy but my friend doesn't like spicy so we opted for the mild. The curry coconut is very flavorful (that I just want to dip a toasted sour dough bread on it) yum yum!!! Though, the 2 lbs seems so little compare it to the 2 lbs we order from other restaurants.
As for the garlic noodles...this is disappointing! I couldn't taste the garlic at all plus the noodles are overcooked. I had tried so many different garlic noodles in different restaurants so I know my garlic noodles! So I improvised and took some of the curry coconut sauce on my noodles and yes it became much okay and became curry coconut noodles!
I "might" come back to try the hurricane spice but will not order the garlic noodles again. 
Definitely "Kickin Crab" and "Boiling Crab" are still my go to place!

excerpts:
- You can purchase a Groupon (although be wary of weekend restrictions)
- Yelp check-in for free cajun fries
- They take reservations!

Avoid the line on busy nights
-
cajun fries.author: Rachel I.
cajun fries.review:
I love that a restaurant like this exists in San Francisco. As someone who lived in LA, it satisfies my nostalgia for an affordable, no-frills, casual, food-forward establishment that isn't pretentious enough to call itself Asian fusion but is exactly that. Cajun shrimp is on the menu, but you can also have your seafood boiled in coconut curry broth. You can have a side of french bread, or garlic noodles. A pitcher of Lagunitas, or Singha. 

The staff is attentive and the owner is really amicable and energetic. You feel taken care of, but never rushed.

Dine-In Tips: 

- You can purchase a Groupon (although be wary of weekend restrictions)
- Yelp check-in for free cajun fries
- They take reservations! Avoid the line on busy nights
- They have TVs (in case you're worried about missing a game during dinner)

Food Recs: 

- Recommended sides: garlic noodles, crawfish beignets 
- Stand out dishes: two people I've dined with have independently said the clams in lemon pepper sauce were the best clams they've ever had; the green beans are fantastic, and basically anything in hurricane sauce is amazing

excerpts:
Pros:
Happy hour menu prices
Pretty plump shrimps
Decent prices
