Crunchy Cajun fries

Cons:
Inexperienced/incompetent service - even with only a few diners in the restaurants, the servers were flustered, confused, and missed a few of our orders
Garlic noodles were over-cooked
"Spicy" isn't even hot
cajun fries.author: Thao T.
cajun fries.review:
Pros:
Happy hour menu prices
Pretty plump shrimps
Decent prices
Crunchy Cajun fries

Cons:
Inexperienced/incompetent service - even with only a few diners in the restaurants, the servers were flustered, confused, and missed a few of our orders
Garlic noodles were over-cooked
"Spicy" isn't even hot
It seems the shellfish were quickly tossed into the bag w/ sauce and brought out. I found myself pealing shrimp and clams and re-dipping them into the bag for more flavor.

excerpts: We got our usual which was cajun fries, clams, sausages and bread and lets
just say I was very disappointed.
cajun fries.author: Angela S.
cajun fries.review:
Came here for good food since we come here all the time but sitting down I realized they changed ownership. We got our usual which was cajun fries, clams, sausages and bread and lets just say I was very disappointed. The bread came cold and not even toasted and was as if they just cut it and through it in the toaster for 30 seconds. 

The service was horrible. The waiters were rude and yelling at other waiters and it was a mess. They obviously have not been in the service industry because they were carrying around food orders and instead of dropping it off at the table they went to get wet towelettes for others. They would continuously walk around with the food not dropping it off to the tables and doing other things instead. They were also very condescending in how they spoke and was rude as well. I would not come back anymore after the change off ownership.

excerpts: We ordered alligator sausage, which tastes like chicken sausage, the garlic noodles which were nothing special, the Cajun fries were good, but how do you screw those up, and finally the crawfish is tornado sauce.
cajun fries.author: Brianna S.
cajun fries.review:
Not good at all... We were really disappointed with this as we had so been looking forward to a delicious experience. First off, you open the door to the pungent smell of fish- which is understandable, but hot, sour, fish smell in the dining/waiting space is a hard way to start your meal. We waited off to the side for about 15 minutes, but the staff wasn't very welcoming. 

They sat us down, and had some issues with pouring a Sapporo for my fiance. Asking him several times to repeat his order. Finally got to order, which was easy enough, no frills. We ordered alligator sausage, which tastes like chicken sausage, the garlic noodles which were nothing special, the Cajun fries were good, but how do you screw those up, and finally the crawfish is tornado sauce. 

We didn't get through half of the food because it just wasn't good. The sauce was not good, the crawfish were dirty tasting, even though I was open minded about them, I spent half my time cleaning out the veins. The noodles lacked flavor other than noodles and garlic. We kind of felt jipped when we paid. It was that bad.

We just won't be going back. 

Seems popular for high school/20 year olds.

excerpts: We ordered shrimp and mussels with hurricane sauce (mild), garlic noodles, sweet potato fries, cajun fries and fried shrimp for the kids.
I was so excited to try their sauce because I have been on a hunt to find a good sauce just like boiling crab and kickin crab without having to drive all the way to SJ.
I was a little disappointed, because it didnt taste nothing like boiling crab.
I mean, it wasnt bad
cajun fries.author: Nicole D.
cajun fries.review:
I called a week before to make a reservation for party of 9 (with two kids), and requested for two high chairs. When we got there our table was ready with two high chairs (thumbs up!).

Our server asked if it was our first time and explained everything on the menu. We ordered shrimp and mussels with hurricane sauce (mild), garlic noodles, sweet potato fries, cajun fries and fried shrimp for the kids. I was so excited to try their sauce because I have been on a hunt to find a good sauce just like boiling crab and kickin crab without having to drive all the way to SJ. I was a little disappointed, because it didnt taste nothing like boiling crab. I mean, it wasnt bad it was just not what I expected. 

However, the customer service was excellent!

excerpts: First off: Free cajun fries with a Yelp check-in.
The fries definitely taste stale and overcooked.
But they're free
cajun fries.author: Nicole J.
cajun fries.review:
I understand the novelty of Swamp if you've never had this type of cuisine. But if you've had experience with Boiling Crab or any other equivalent, this place is only okay. 

First off: Free cajun fries with a Yelp check-in. The fries definitely taste stale and overcooked. But they're free so I guess you can't expect much. 

Following previous Yelp reviews, I ordered 1 lb of crawfish and mussels ($14/lb for a choice of two) in hurricane sauce and medium spiciness level. The mussels were awesome and large. The crawfish was so tiny and it was hard to feel full because there was so little meat on them. I would not recommend getting the crawfish unless you like working 20x harder for barely any protein. We ordered a side of french bread to go with the hurricane sauce it was such a good call. I definitely recommend some sort of carb to soak up the flavors.

Service was fantastic. Our waters were constantly refilled and the waitresses were attentive. We were served promptly and the experience was nothing short of professional.

Overall, 2 stars because the food was very mediocre and "meh. I've experienced better."

excerpts: Cajun fries with the Yelp check in are just regular fries with a pinch of Cajun seasoning.
No flavor whatsoever.
Service was nonexistent.
The shrimp was overcooked.
The shell was scorching hot.. but the meat itself was cold?
1lb of clams was literally 8 pieces.
Not worth it at all...
cajun fries.author: Sandy W.
cajun fries.review: Cajun fries with the Yelp check in are just regular fries with a pinch of Cajun seasoning. No flavor whatsoever. Service was nonexistent. The shrimp was overcooked. The shell was scorching hot.. but the meat itself was cold? 1lb of clams was literally 8 pieces. Not worth it at all...

excerpts: ** don't forget your order of amazingly crispy Cajun Fries, free with Yelp check-in!
cajun fries.author: Geminyna J.
cajun fries.review:
ORDER:
The Prix Fixe dinner for 2 is a steal at $49! We added 1 lb shrimp (+$14) and it easily fed our party of 4, with plenty of left overs to take home. 


FIXED PRICE MENU 
SERVED FAMILY STYLE for sharing:
* hearty bowl of Clam Chowder for 3-4 people, 
* side of vinegary Cole Slaw, 
* roasted Whole Dungeness Crab, 
* savory Garlic Noodles, 
* 6 light fluffy Beignets to end the meal.
** don't forget your order of amazingly crispy Cajun Fries, free with Yelp check-in!


THE BILL:
All that for $15.75 / person!  
2 pitchers of libations later and we doubled the $ amount per person (whoops), but sans alcohol, the food at Swamp is delicious and reasonably priced.


SAUCE RECOMMENDATIONS:
* "Hurricane Sauce" is the all-in house equivalent of Boiling Crab's shabang: Original Cajun, Lemon Pepper, and Garlic Butter (with a mild curry twist).

* Not your typical "Garlic Butter". The unexpected coconut milk base was rich and savory without being the usual oily sauces at other Cajun seafood spots. 


TABLE FAVORITE: 
Glad we tried the Swamp's rendition of Garlic Noodles, despite the mixed reviews on Yelp. 

Perfectly al dente, aromatic garlic flavor, all without the heavy greasy sauce typical of Vietnamese / Cajun Garlic Noodles. 

Pretty please remain consistently delicious. 


SERVICE:
Friendly and attentive.

The Manager interacted with each table, unfazed by the Friday dinner rush. He seated our party of 7 and explained the Swamp's sauce bases and their levels of heat. Nice guy with a great sense of humor. 

Our server made sure our long table remained well appointed with filled water carafes, plenty of napkins, hot towels, etc., all throughout our meal. 


PARKING:
Metered street parking until 6pm. Small public lot behind the building has a high turnover so once or twice around the block and you'll probably land a spot. 


GIST:
Yes we will definitely be back. Perhaps during Happy Hour (3pm to 6pm).


POST-SWAMP:
If you can muster up the stomach space, cross the street! 

It's almost impossible to save room for dessert but our fam favorites are right across the other side of Geary: a homemade scoop of Joe's Ice Cream or milk tea & boba from Sharetea.

excerpts: We ordered 2 pounds of shrimp (1 lb curry coconut and another garlic butter medium with 2 corn mixed in), an order of cajun fries (free with Yelp check-in), and an order of steamed rice.
cajun fries.author: CK G.
cajun fries.review:
Came here on a Tuesday after 6pm. It was not too busy so we were seated right away.

We ordered 2 pounds of shrimp (1 lb curry coconut and another garlic butter medium with 2 corn mixed in), an order of cajun fries (free with Yelp check-in), and an order of steamed rice.

Usually 2 lbs of shrimp isn't enough for us - we'd get 3 lbs and barely have any left over. But this time 2 lbs filled us up; probably because the shrimp were a pretty decent size.

I preferred the garlic butter over the curry coconut, but overall both flavors were good. 

At the end of the meal we were offered warm towelettes in a plastic package to clean our hands; it was refreshing and nice.

I would definitely come back again. Especially for the happy hour oyster deal since my boyfriend loves oysters! And maybe to try the alligator dish ...

excerpts: For appetizers, we ordered the cajun calamari, cajun wings, and got a free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp.
The calamari was pretty good, it had like a curly fries taste to it
and they were really crispy.
The cajun wings were meh...
I thought they were going to be dry rubbed sort of wings, but they are really saucy.
I am guessing the sauce is their hurricane sauce.
I was not digging all the sauce on the wing, although it was okay tasting.
Imagine the shrimp sauce on a wing?
The fries were really good.
cajun fries.author: Vivian Y.
cajun fries.review:
tldr:: Food was okay. Prices are a little higher for the shrimp than I am used too. Dark New Orleans kind of interior design and atmosphere. 

Came to Swamp on a thursday afternoon around 3:30 with my boyfriend for their happy hour which runs from 2-6 pm. Place was kind of empty, but groups came in here and there. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
It was kind of dark inside besides the tables near the window, but I guess that's kind of the feel you would get if you're sitting next to the bar area. Not really digging the interior design, but I am not here to judge what the restaurant looks like.

Service:
The service is pretty good. There was one guy working the front. Only thing that kind of bothered me was that we came in for happy hour, and there is a separate menu for that. We originally wanted to order the happy hour wings and calamari...but when we saw the bill, the guy was like you pointed to the regular menu, not the happy hour one...no big deal though. Wish he was a little more enthusiastic or looked like he even cared about the service, but it's chill; he did what he had to. I liked that at the end of the meal, they gave us a hot towelette; makes the bathroom trip afterwards a lot cleaner as far as touching the handles and what not. 

Taste: 
For appetizers, we ordered the cajun calamari, cajun wings, and got a free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp. The calamari was pretty good, it had like a curly fries taste to it and they were really crispy. The cajun wings were meh... I thought they were going to be dry rubbed sort of wings, but they are really saucy. I am guessing the sauce is their hurricane sauce. I was not digging all the sauce on the wing, although it was okay tasting. Imagine the shrimp sauce on a wing? The fries were really good. They're perfectly crispy and seasoned; comparable to the Boiling Crab ones. 

We also ordered 1 lb of mild shrimp in the hurricane sauce with one corn. Shrimp was so friggen hot, so be careful when you start peeling them. Shrimp was pretty good. Sauce is on the thicker side, but still tasty. 

The bill came out to $60 after tax and tip (bf ordered a lb and 2 corns togo) (before that the total was around $35). I was surprised to see that a lb of shrimp costs $15. I am used to paying ~$10 at boiling crab, so the price kind of shocked me. Overall the food was good. If I am craving Cajun style seafood, I can imagine coming here again, since Boiling Crab is too far away.

excerpts: Fine, jambalaya wasn't an option so gumbo, hot link, Cajun fries and beignets is what I ordered.
Gumbo was pepper, like that was literally the only spice they used.
Hot links side was a half a link cut into 6 pieces (seriously?!).
Cajun fries were french fries with an over abundance of season salt.
And if that wasn't bad enough you can dip your hot link and fries in some authentic Cajun dip made up of a mixture of ketchup and barbeque sauce.
Last, but not least, we get to the beignets.
Only 2 had powdered sugar on them, and they were burnt.
If you are going to make the foolish mistake of burning something, and then have the audacity to serve it, the least you could do is cover that mess with sugar.
I laugh now, but at lunch time it was not so funny.
Thank God
I didn't get the $58 crab.
cajun fries.author: Monica F.
cajun fries.review: Where does one begin with a one star bad review.  The service was horrendous. I was trying to order a po boy and was informed that they no longer serve that. I could have the $58 crab though. In what realm does an $8 sandwich equate to a $60 substitute? Fine, jambalaya wasn't an option so gumbo, hot link, Cajun fries and beignets is what I ordered. Gumbo was pepper, like that was literally the only spice they used. Hot links side was a half a link cut into 6 pieces (seriously?!). Cajun fries were french fries with an over abundance of season salt. And if that wasn't bad enough you can dip your hot link and fries in some authentic Cajun dip made up of a mixture of ketchup and barbeque sauce.  Last, but not least, we get to the beignets.  Only 2 had powdered sugar on them, and they were burnt.  If you are going to make the foolish mistake of burning something, and then have the audacity to serve it, the least you could do is cover that mess with sugar. I laugh now, but at lunch time it was not so funny. Thank God I didn't get the $58 crab.

excerpts: Came here the other night and ordered fresh oysters, a pound of shrimp, a pound of clams, garlic noodles, and cajun fries.
The combined sauce was quite good- super flavorful and not too overpowering.
The garlic noodles were delicious and probably the best I've ever had since they didn't have huge chunks of garlic in it like most places.
However, the fries weren't very good- not sure if it was the cajun powder or if they weren't fried like other places.
The servers were very polite, however, the service was quite slow.
cajun fries.author: Marny N.
cajun fries.review:
Came here the other night and ordered fresh oysters, a pound of shrimp, a pound of clams, garlic noodles, and cajun fries. The combined sauce was quite good- super flavorful and not too overpowering. The garlic noodles were delicious and probably the best I've ever had since they didn't have huge chunks of garlic in it like most places. However, the fries weren't very good- not sure if it was the cajun powder or if they weren't fried like other places. The servers were very polite, however, the service was quite slow. It took a while for us to get all of the items and we had to flag down two servers to get our fries (which we finally received at the end of our meal...)

Not sure if I would return.

excerpts: Make sure to check in to get the free Cajun fries!
cajun fries.author: Roseanne V.
cajun fries.review: I give the food 3 stars but an extra star for quality service. Service was amazing! All servers were attentive and really care for their customers needs. There was no wait time and food came out fairly fast! I got 1 pound of the hurricane sauce mild flavor shrimp and clams. If you like tangy with a kick to it, then you will like this sauce. However, shrimp was a bit overcooked but overall a good dining experience. Make sure to check in to get the free Cajun fries!

excerpts: For fries I recommend the cajun fries over the sweet potatoes, but skip the calamari, it's not worth trying.
cajun fries.author: Karen L.
cajun fries.review:
Awesome.  Not too crowded or loud.  Eating here doesn't get messy either.  

I've ordered the shrimp with lemon pepper.  It's got a nice pepper kick to it; mild and not too spicy, it was tasty.  The garlic noodles are in a small bowl, which was buttery and not overwhelming of garlic.  For fries I recommend the cajun fries over the sweet potatoes, but skip the calamari, it's not worth trying.

This place is comparable to Cajun House, but I prefer coming here instead.

excerpts: The Cajun fries are a good add to munch while you wait
cajun fries.author: Veranna N.
cajun fries.review:
I like that they put their seafood into tin bowls instead of this plastic bag as most other places do.
Service is very friendly and comfortable. 
Beers are available and wonderful to go along with your seafood! 
House Cajun sauce is yum. 
You can add sides into the sauce like sausage or corn. 
The Cajun fries are a good add to munch while you wait

excerpts: Two of us were able to redeem a Yelp check in offer for an order of Cajun fries which was cool.
We placed our orders and the appetizers came came out about 10 minutes later.
cajun fries.author: Camille B.
cajun fries.review:
Great first experience at Swamp.

I called to make a reservation one day before our planned dinner but Swamp is closed on Tuesdays. I left a voicemail and the next afternoon someone returned my call  and I confirmed a reservation for 10 people. 

We actually arrived at the restaurant about 20 minutes before our 615pm reservation but were seated right away since it wasn't busy. Two of us were able to redeem a Yelp check in offer for an order of Cajun fries which was cool. We placed our orders and the appetizers came came out about 10 minutes later. Our entrees were served another 10 mins after that. 

My boyfriend and I shared 2 pounds of shrimp w medium spicy hurricane sauce and it was perrrfect! Just the right amount of spice, nothing unbearable and still very flavorful. We also got corn and garlic noodles. For dessert we got complimentary orders of their beignets for Swamps one year anniversary. They were very light..would be yummy w some chocolate sauce or Nutella mmm. A couple folks with our group ordered the fried banana w Mitchell's ice cream - one mango and the other vanilla (I think?). Gotta get on that next time. 

Anywho, great service and yummmy food. Our waiter was super friendly and even hooked it up w paper bags for our food to go lol. Will definitely be back here soon!

excerpts: We checked in on Yelp to get the free Cajun fries, then ordered the $59 prixe fix for 2.
Slaw, chowder, garlic noodles, a ton on crab, and 4 beignets???
Hello
heaven, I've just died.
I'll be back.
cajun fries.author: Adele A.
cajun fries.review: I feel like I've just discovered the delicious deal of the century. We checked in on Yelp to get the free Cajun fries, then ordered the $59 prixe fix for 2. Slaw, chowder, garlic noodles, a ton on crab, and 4 beignets??? Hello heaven, I've just died. I'll be back.

excerpts: Cajun Fries ($3.50 or Free
if you check-in on Yelp)
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#LWCwmvTqXVsBgOrZ05S5tg)
- A bit salty and lacked in heat.
cajun fries.author: Candice H.
cajun fries.review:
Variety of fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and great for large groups!



Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6) - I was excited to try this as it sounded exotic on the menu.  However, I'll pass on ordering it again the next time I visit.  It just tasted like a regular pork sausage.  

Hush Puppies ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#c8IXP1U-QtPQbdq8kFQmPA) - You get about 7 or 8 in a basket.  Too doughy and lacked in flavor.  I'd say skip this.

**I initially ordered a dozen oysters, but the waiter came back and said they were out, which was why I ordered the hush puppies.**

Cajun Fries ($3.50 or Free if you check-in on Yelp) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#LWCwmvTqXVsBgOrZ05S5tg) - A bit salty and lacked in heat.  However, can't really complain since it was free!

For the assortment of shellfish, there are four different boil flavors and spiciness levels to choose from.  

Boil Flavors:  Original Cajun (no sauce), Garlic Butter, Lemon Pepper, & Hurricane (all-in)

Spicy: None, Mild, Medium, & Spicy Habanero

1 lb. Habanero Hurricane Crawfish ($12) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#rTkc1evTmPI4g7lCfa9pYQ) - Tasty, but too spicy for the hubby.  I enjoyed it.  Next time, I'll have to order a side of French Bread to sop up all the sauce. 

1 lb. Medium Hurricane Clams ($12) - Clams were huge, but a few of them weren't edible as the shells weren't opened all the way. I felt like we didn't get our money's worth since there weren't a lot of clams in the bowl.

Service:
Friendly & attentive

Parking:
Can be a challenge since it's on Geary Street

excerpts: Also we were super excited because with a yelp check in, you get a free side of cajun fries.
and I each got a pound of shrimp in the hurricane sauce (cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper, and coconut curry mixed together) with corn, along with garlic noodles and the cajun fries.
The cajun fries came out first--thin crunchy fries covered with cajun seasoning.
Loved them!!
After a while they did get a little spicy, but you have to expect that from anything cajun haha.
The shrimp came out next in bowls!
I liked this because your hands don't get as messy (for example, at BC or craw station you have to reach your hand into the bag and get your whole hand dirty haha) and it came with a spoon!
We ended up spooning our hurricane sauce on top of our garlic noodles and O M G they were sooo good!!
The garlic noodles were definitely a nice addition--needed a starch to cool our mouths off from the hurricane sauce hahah!!
cajun fries.author: Tara A.
cajun fries.review:
Came here yesterday for a late lunch with my bf! We got here around 3pm, and we were happy to see that their happy hour is from 3-6pm, and you get 15% off your bill!!!! (SCORE) Also we were super excited because with a yelp check in, you get a free side of cajun fries.

My bf and I each got a pound of shrimp in the hurricane sauce (cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper, and coconut curry mixed together) with corn, along with garlic noodles and the cajun fries. 

The cajun fries came out first--thin crunchy fries covered with cajun seasoning. Loved them!! After a while they did get a little spicy, but you have to expect that from anything cajun haha. The shrimp came out next in bowls! I liked this because your hands don't get as messy (for example, at BC or craw station you have to reach your hand into the bag and get your whole hand dirty haha) and it came with a spoon! We ended up spooning our hurricane sauce on top of our garlic noodles and O M G they were sooo good!! The garlic noodles were definitely a nice addition--needed a starch to cool our mouths off from the hurricane sauce hahah!! Super garlicky and not too oily.

The sauce here is thinner than boiling crab or kicking crab, but definitely has good flavors!! I loved the addition of the coconut curry and I could definitely taste it! The only gripe that my bf and I had about the sauce was that it was pretttty spicy. I don't necessarily like or dislike spicy stuff, but I can definitely tolerate it; my sauce definitely had a bigger kick than what I was used to for "mild"! Next time I know to order non spicy, because my bf's sauce still had a kick to it even though he got non spicy (probably just the cajun flavoring). 

Prices are around the same as craw station on 9th. Shrimp is $14/lb and I think that is a bit expensive. The garlic noodles were $7.50 and I think the fries were $3.50 (remember to check in!!!)

Because we came at an off hour, there were only 2 workers but they were both really nice and attentive. The total for the bill was around $34 too!! Great price considering we were both stuffed after!

excerpts: We indulged in raw clams, shrimp in garlic butter sauce, deep fried soft shell crab, cajun fries, and gumbo soup.
Overall, the food was fresh and pretty decent though we had to flag the waitress down few times since during our lunch time
there was only one waitstaff running around.
Pretty good deal since we brought Groupon, can't complain.
Most definitely, returning for crawfish season to get our Cajun fixes.
cajun fries.author: Stella L.
cajun fries.review: We indulged in raw clams, shrimp in garlic butter sauce, deep fried soft shell crab, cajun fries, and gumbo soup. Overall, the food was fresh and pretty decent though we had to flag the waitress down few times since during our lunch time there was only one waitstaff running around. Pretty good deal since we brought Groupon, can't complain. Most definitely, returning for crawfish season to get our Cajun fixes.

excerpts: We ordered a pound of clams in garlic and butter mild sauce, a pound of shrimp in their house medium sauce, garlic noodles, and we also got Cajun fries for free with a check in.
I really enjoyed their garlic noodles the most!
I think they have the best garlic noodles here.
Their Cajun fries were also well seasoned and cooked just the way I like them, perfectly sized and crisp.
The sauces were really good and well seasoned!
The garlic and butter seasoning for the clams were great!
They used a good amount of garlic and butter
so it covered up that clammy smell.
The Cajun house seasoning for the shrimp was great
and I was surprised the by the size of the shrimp.
I thought it was a really great portion and everything tastes really fresh.
Will be coming back here again when the cravings hit!
cajun fries.author: Michele W.
cajun fries.review:
Came here on a Friday afternoon around 3:30. It wasn't busy which is good so I can take my time enjoying my food here. We ordered a pound of clams in garlic and butter mild sauce, a pound of shrimp in their house medium sauce, garlic noodles, and we also got Cajun fries for free with a check in. I really enjoyed their garlic noodles the most! I think they have the best garlic noodles here. Their Cajun fries were also well seasoned and cooked just the way I like them, perfectly sized and crisp.
The sauces were really good and well seasoned! 
The garlic and butter seasoning for the clams were great! They used a good amount of garlic and butter so it covered up that clammy smell. The Cajun house seasoning for the shrimp was great and I was surprised the by the size of the shrimp. I thought it was a really great portion and everything tastes really fresh. Will be coming back here again when the cravings hit!

excerpts:
For a party of 5 adults we ordered (and were completely stuffed after finishing):
- 2 lbs of crab
- 1 lb of clams
- 2 lbs of shrimp
- 3 orders of sausage
- 1 order of gumbo
- 1 order of garlic noodles
- 1 order of cajun fries (free with yelp check in!)
- 5 pieces of corn

Food came out at a good pace and the only hiccups we had with our meal were that the sausage was accidentally left out and that we were slightly overcharged for the crab special.
cajun fries.author: Jenny C.
cajun fries.review:
We came here for my husband's birthday and enjoyed our meal!

For a party of 5 adults we ordered (and were completely stuffed after finishing):
- 2 lbs of crab
- 1 lb of clams
- 2 lbs of shrimp
- 3 orders of sausage
- 1 order of gumbo
- 1 order of garlic noodles
- 1 order of cajun fries (free with yelp check in!)
- 5 pieces of corn

Food came out at a good pace and the only hiccups we had with our meal were that the sausage was accidentally left out and that we were slightly overcharged for the crab special. To Swamp's credit, each issue was quickly remedied! We also used a groupon with the meal which helped bring down the cost.

We're already talking about the next time we'll be going back!

excerpts: Swamp is located on the busy streets of Geary, but I don't think parking is too bad as compared to 5th Ave.. and they also have the awesome check-in deals for dine-ins - FREE cajun fries as appetizers!
cajun fries.author: Mandy G.
cajun fries.review:
I am the poster child for Swamp! (Inside joke between my bf & I, hehe) 

One thing for sure, this place isn't swampy, hehe. I've been here twice and have had a good experience for both. My bf & I were both craving cajun food (second time) and it was between Swamp & Cajun House. Last time we were to Cajun House, it was super crowded, hard to find parking, and a bit of disappointment after purchasing a GroupOn deal. Swamp is located on the busy streets of Geary, but I don't think parking is too bad as compared to 5th Ave.. and they also have the awesome check-in deals for dine-ins - FREE cajun fries as appetizers! 

The interior here kinda brings me back home in NOLA because of all the festive decorations they have up. The staff is friendly and attentive. The manager(?) I think .. whoever the guy is, is funny. 

My typical order is always a pound of shrimp and a side of corn and rice. Hurricane flavor with medium spicy (always a regret). 

Pricing for my order: 
Shrimp - $14/lb 
Corn - $0.75
Rice - $1.50 
Coke/soft drink - $2.50 (free refill!) 

I guess for my review, I will let you know what my bf & I do. When our order comes out, we like to dump all the shrimp onto the plate to cool off. After a couple mins (even when still kinda hot), we peel all the shrimps and dump the excess remains into a bowl (provided by staff) and put the shrimps meat into the bowl that it came with (into the sauce bowl). Before we add the rice into the sauce bowl, we take out the excess sauce with a spoon and put it onto our plates, since we have no where else to put it (and in case you took out too much, you can add it back in). Lastly, we add the rice into the sauce bowl that already has the shrimp, and we mix it! Ta-da!! Even the manager guy liked our idea! ;) 

As for the medium spicy, I always forget that I shouldn't order it and regret it during my meal. For my second visit, I asked our waitress how spicy it would be and she said on a scale of 1-10, it'd be a 6. I took the chance and it felt like an 8!! T_T I should just order mild next time .. 

From what I remember on our first visit, we ordered Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6.50) and it tasted like chicken to us. It's always a good experience to try something new though, even if you may or may not like it. The gumbo ($8) from what I remember was good, nothing all that spectacular but maybe I'm biased because I lived in NOLA for awhile. 

Overall, I always enjoy my experience here and would definitely come back. When ordering the pound of shrimps, I highly recommend the hurricane sauce! Add a corn to your liking too ;)

Want to know the inside joke for the poster child thing? It's cause my bf & I were seated next to the front window when the restaurant was empty. People would see us eating and stop and stare or look at the menu before walking off or coming in. We would have a little argument that one of us was catching the attention and being the poster child, haha.

excerpts: I've tried the dungeness crab in coconut curry, coleslaw, cajun fries, hot links, garlic noodles, grilled asparagus, sautéed string beans, and a pound of shrimp tossed in spicy hurricane sauce.
cajun fries.author: Ann S.
cajun fries.review:
Sooooo... this place is quickly becoming one of my addictions. I'm what you would consider an Asian version of Mr. Bubba, himself. 

I sure do love me some shrimp. 

I like 'em sautéed, deep fried, barbecued, on kabobs, grilled, sashimi style, etc etc, but most of all, I like 'em boiled and slathered with heavily seasoned sauce. 

Mmmm mmmm! 

I came here late night ready for some good grubbin' and sure enough, I was not disappointed. 

I've tried the dungeness crab in coconut curry, coleslaw, cajun fries, hot links, garlic noodles, grilled asparagus, sautéed string beans, and a pound of shrimp tossed in spicy hurricane sauce. It was all so good! 

As the indecisive person that I am, I would recommend the hurricane sauce. It's a combination of all the sauce options. No need to choose. You get it all! Personally, I think it tastes best too.

Oh and don't think you can roll up in here all cute and dainty. They hand you a bib for a reason. I must've been flinging crab meat all into my hair throughout the entire dinner. 

Great service, casual ambiance.

Winner winner shrimpy dinner.

excerpts: The only thing I didn't like was the Cajun fries because they put garlic flakes and just too much garlic overall.
Happy hour deals are good and the service here is great!
cajun fries.author: Michelle Ann C.
cajun fries.review: Came here on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the two item combo with shrimp and crawfish in a spicy habanero lemon pepper sauce. The amount of spice was perfect. I liked that all the spices didn't clump up at the bottom like at Boiling Crab. The shrimp was a little overcooked but the crawfish was amazing and super fresh. The only thing I didn't like was the Cajun fries because they put garlic flakes and just too much garlic overall. Happy hour deals are good and the service here is great!

excerpts: My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.
The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!
cajun fries.author: Herb L.
cajun fries.review:
My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.  The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!  Fries had just the right amount of seasoning.

The pound of shrimp with the medium spicy hurricane sauce was good, and it really should be ordered with some bread so you can sop up the sauce.  That sauce was *really* good.  

We also ordered their lobster special with the "Golden Shallot Peppercorn" seasoning and it was excessively good.  Take a lobster, chop it up Chinese style, and then Cajun-ize the seasoning.

excerpts: Check-in on Yelp for free cajun fries!!
cajun fries.author: Samantha C.
cajun fries.review:
Check-in on Yelp for free cajun fries!! And happy hour between 2-6pm = 15% off entire check! 

Overall, Swamp seems to be a cleaner, "classier" version of Boiling Crab with a more extensive menu (garlic noodles and other hot dishes). However, prices are more expensive at $12-15/lb and service is much slower and very spotty.  

I've only tried the shrimp ($14/lb). The shrimp is fresh and HUGE (perhaps better quality than Boiling Crab) and the Original cajun flavor is really good. It is also a lot cleaner and easier to eat, because it is served in a bowl instead of a plastic bag. 

Service was really really slow.. and spotty. 

I would eat here again but only because there is no Boiling Crab in SF :( and because there is no wait!!

excerpts: Overall, good experiences here and don't forget about the free Cajun Fries with a Yelp check in.
cajun fries.author: Carmelisa M.
cajun fries.review: I've always had a good experience at Swamp. Every time I've been, there hasn't been a long wait. The waiters are very attentive to customers and check on you frequently. Compared to places like Boiling Crab where they serve their food in bags, Swamp serves it in big bowls. I really like this because it's easier to dip the food into the sauce and its a lot less messy. I love the Hurricane Sauce! You should also try Lemon Pepper mixed with Garlic Butter. A pretty good mix! Their Garlic Noodles are decent, but they taste pretty good when you add the sauce from the seafood! Give it a try! Overall, good experiences here and don't forget about the free Cajun Fries with a Yelp check in.

excerpts: We also got free cajun fries for checking in on yelp.
cajun fries.author: Michelle J.
cajun fries.review:
Our group of 5 came here around 6pm on a Saturday night and we had no trouble getting seated. We started off with 2 dozen oysters. They were good (pretty big + fresh) but not amazing. We also got free cajun fries for checking in on yelp. The fries were fantastic.

I ordered 1lb of shrimp in the hurricane flavor, no spicy. The hurricane flavor is the Boiling Crab "whole shebang" sauce equivalent, with all the boil flavors combined. The sauce was comparable to other similar places I love (Boiling Crab, Kickin Crab)- it was flavorful with a good consistency. 

However, unlike the other places, Swamp's Hurricane sauce contains coconut curry which really made a noticeable difference. I could very distinctly taste the curry and the coconut was very fragrant. Not sure if I liked it or not, and probably could have done without it, but it certainly was interesting. 

For portions, my friends and I felt like they gave us less shrimp than other places do. Amongst our group, 3 of us frequent Boiling/Kickin crab in the Bay, and usually we're more full after 1lb of shrimp than we were at Swamp. But actually I felt like the potentially smaller portion size was perfect, because I was at a good level after the meal. 

For sides, you can choose several things to be added into your sauce. I highly, highly recommend getting at least 1 or 2 pieces of corn. The corn is sweet and hot, and tastes super good drenched in sauce. We also ordered garlic noodles, which I thought were phenomenal. The bowl was pretty small (think 2 girl adult hands cupped together) but it was worth it because the noodles were insanely good.

excerpts:
Free Cajun fries
The crab
15 % off my bill for being there during happy hour
So much food!!!
Found parking in the back
The decor is cute.
cajun fries.author: Lobster G.
cajun fries.review:
Giving it 5 stars based on the service. 
Stuff I liked: 
Friendly and attentive waitstaff 
Free Cajun fries
The crab
15 % off my bill for being there during happy hour
So much food!!!
Found parking in the back
The decor is cute. 
The instant instagram feed 

Stuff I felt could have been better:
Not enough napkins!!!
The music! They had radio Disney on which was awful. In keeping with the theme of the restaurant, why not some southern classic rock like C.C.R. or Lynyrd Skynyrd?

excerpts: Tip: You get one free cajun fries with check-in.
cajun fries.author: Ron D.
cajun fries.review:
After reading some of the reviews, I feel like it all comes down to preference. I prefer Swamp's Hurricane sauce/flavor (spicy), rather than Boiling Crab's. From my experience, I thought Swamp's was less greasy than BC. I always feel like crap after eating at BC, because of all the grease. I had the crab in the Hurricane sauce (the Hurricane sauce has a sweet, curry taste to it), probably smiled the entire time eating it haha. The shrimp with lemon pepper is definitely what I will order the next time I come back.

Side note: They do serve pitchers of beer.

Tip: You get one free cajun fries with check-in.

+Staff were friendly and attentive.
-Inside looks a bit outdated and tacky. I could imagine Chef Robert Irvine come out of no where and do a Restaurant Impossible make-over.

excerpts: don't forget to check in on Yelp for free Cajun fries.
cajun fries.author: lala l.
cajun fries.review:
Definitely my to go place when I'm craving for boiling crab. The BF and I usually order a lb of shrimp in either the hurricane or garlic butter sauce (both really good) with 6 pieces of hot link, 2 corn, and garlic noodles. Thats enough to fill us up until the next morning ! Go in the afternoon because they offer happy hour and no wait. 
 This restaraunt is a must try!! don't forget to check in on Yelp for free Cajun fries.

excerpts: We also check-in on Yelp to receive free cajun fries, a bowl of rice, garlic pasta and oysters for appetizers.
cajun fries.author: Christina N.
cajun fries.review:
Fiancé wanted me to try this place, since there are no Boiling Crab restaurant near San Francisco area. Walked in and it was dead, but we arrived around 5:30pm so it was still early. I ordered combo with crawfish and shrimp with garlic and butter while fiancé ordered shrimp only with all the garlic and butter and coconut curry. We also check-in on Yelp to receive free cajun fries, a bowl of rice, garlic pasta and oysters for appetizers.    

Oyster came out first and they were decent. The seafood comes in metal bowls and they give you empty bowls to put the shells which is nice so you don't a mess make everywhere. It took awhile to peel the seafood because it was scorching hot, but we were hungry so we fought through the heat to peel them. My fiancés' one pound shrimp had about 10-12 shrimps in there and I had 6-7 shrimps and 9 crawfish. We managed to eat everything in sight and was pretty satisfied and full. 

Overall, I have a bias because I compare all seafood places to Boiling Crab and this restaurant is decent, but not as good as boiling crab. I personally don't like curry sauce in my seafood so that's why they lost a star for me and as the prices for boiling crab is cheaper than Swamp. Service was excellent and I would go back if my fiancé wants to go.

excerpts: I. Our go to items are: raw oysters, Cajun fries, garlic noodles, the shrimp and crawfish
(Hurricane Cajun, medium), and sometimes we add the sausages.
Highly recommended eatery, also not bad as take out.
I have a long drive home, so I reheat the shrimp/crawfish by throwing everything into a pot on the stove for a few minutes.
cajun fries.author: Calina N.
cajun fries.review: This is a top favorite restaurant for my husband and I. Our go to items are: raw oysters, Cajun fries, garlic noodles, the shrimp and crawfish (Hurricane Cajun, medium), and sometimes we add the sausages. Highly recommended eatery, also not bad as take out. I have a long drive home, so I reheat the shrimp/crawfish by throwing everything into a pot on the stove for a few minutes.

excerpts: The Cajun fries had me at helloooooo.
Can you taste me now?
This place makes Joe's Crab Shack look like a piece of root beer cake that not even grandma would eat hahahah.
cajun fries.author: Brent M.
cajun fries.review:
This place was so OFF THE CHAIN I wanted to BARK!  The 2 pound crawfish that we ordered with the hurricane mild sauce was like opening up a can of whoop ass on your taste buds!  It has been Taste bud certified by me! 


The Cajun fries had me at helloooooo.  Can you taste me now?  This place makes Joe's Crab Shack look like a piece of root beer cake that not even grandma would eat hahahah.

excerpts: -FREE Cajun Fries w/ yelp check in - It could use more seasoning, but hey it was free?
cajun fries.author: Michelle H.
cajun fries.review:
I ordered:
-Alligator Sausage (~$6?) - It came with a side of cole slaw. I wasn't expecting it to taste anything different than a typical sausage, so that's what it tasted like. Since they use alligator meat, the portion is smaller than a usual sausage. 
-Crawfish beignets (~$6?) - I was mildly disappointed with this. The taste was kinda "fishy" and the dough wasn't light and airy as what I would expect from the texture of a beignet. 
-Shrimp (1lb, mild spicy hurricane sauce) ($14) - I was expecting this sauce to taste close, or nearly close to the shabang boiling crab but was deeply disappointed. Not only did I feel like the portion of 1lb was smaller, but the sauce was bland and flavorless.
-FREE Cajun Fries w/ yelp check in - It could use more seasoning, but hey it was free? 

I give them 3 stars for a good effort and I guess if you live in SF where there is no boiling crab, this is the closest thing. Most of the dishes I had were lightly salted so at the very least, its slightly healthier/less sodium than boiling crab? :P

excerpts: I love their cajun fries and the fast service.
The food is delicious!!!
cajun fries.author: Marjorie K.
cajun fries.review: One of my favorite place to eat at when my friends and I crave for seafood. I love their cajun fries and the fast service. The food is delicious!!!

excerpts: Don't forget to get the free cajun fries with the check in.
cajun fries.author: Christopher S.
cajun fries.review:
The service was excellent. They constantly keep you shell bowl empty and your cups of water full. 

Food: Lobster was decent for the price. But the garlic butter was awesome. Get that on everything. 

Clams were small. I don't recommend. 


Tip! Don't forget to get the free cajun fries with the check in.

excerpts: The free cajun fries for checking in are a big plus and I love that they serve the seafood boil in special heating bowls rather than plastic bags like others do.
cajun fries.author: Joanne T.
cajun fries.review: Love love love this place.  The free cajun fries for checking in are a big plus and I love that they serve the seafood boil in special heating bowls rather than plastic bags like others do.  I always order the hush puppies and a variety of shellfish in their hurricane sauce. Compared to other places that serve boiled and seasoned seafood, Swamp has a great non oily sauce.  My hands aren't covered in grease after eating here. This place is good for groups, but make sure you make a reservation on weekends since this place is pretty popular.

excerpts: Especially the cajun fries which are the bob dot com.
Crisp and tasty and an exploding taste of peppers gives this dish an authentic thumbs up!
Whenever I crave that good tornado sauce and those cajun fries I will hop on over to Swamp.
cajun fries.author: Jessica E.
cajun fries.review:
When I don't feel in the mood to take that 2 hour drive and wait for an extra 2 hours in line for the Boiling Crab, Swamp destroys those cravings for Cajun food, in a good way.

I love the tornado mix at medium, (similar to the whole shabang at the Boiling Crab), and the shrimp is also flavorful and amazing. However, I'd wish they would add some more garlic to the sauce which ultimately gives it an extra kick to the whole order. The sides are also pretty good. Especially the cajun fries which are the bob dot com. Crisp and tasty and an exploding taste of peppers gives this dish an authentic thumbs up! The garlic noodles are also very scrumptious. 

For dessert had the beignets. Really small plate but I guess it was because we used a free yelp deal. -_- Pretty tasty, but by that time I was already full so I didn't enjoy them as much.

Overall, Swamp is my next favorite after the Boiling Crab and plus it is more local and less of a wait. Whenever I crave that good tornado sauce and those cajun fries I will hop on over to Swamp.

excerpts: We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!!
Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy.
For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce.
Crawfish was out of season.
The flavor was so delicious!!!
The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles!
Fully enjoyed every bite of it.
cajun fries.author: Nhung D.
cajun fries.review:
Had high hopes for this place due to all of the good reviews and I must say, it definitely lived up to my expectations. We came on a Saturday night around 9PM. Called in about 15 mins early to see if there was a wait and the person we spoke with said he would save a table for our party of five! Got there and there was a table ready for us in a packed restaurant, how awesome is that! 

Now onto the food..

We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!! Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy. For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce. Crawfish was out of season. :( The flavor was so delicious!!! The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles! Fully enjoyed every bite of it. We also ordered the gumbo which was just OK. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't order it again.

Compared to Boiling Crab: the sauce was not as thick, but definitely flavorful. It was much easier to enjoy as they put it in a bowl instead of a plastic bag.. Easier to use a spoon to scoop up some delicious sauce onto my garlic noodles with shrimp. They both have distinct tastes so if you're used to eating at BC all the time, then make sure to come here with an open mind.

Service was great! They tended to us quite regularly and cleaned up our table as much as they could throughout the course of the meal. No complaints there.

Overall, I would definitely come back! :-)

excerpts: On separate occasions, I've had the crawfish, cajun fries, chicken wings, shrimp and sausage.
Cajun fries and chicken wings are okay, items that you can find anywhere at a different restaurant.
Shrimp and crawfish are pretty decent, the sauce is runny and has a watered down consistency unlike that of Boiling Crab's oily and thick sauce.
cajun fries.author: Mabel Y.
cajun fries.review:
The cajun food lover in me stays true to Boiling Crab. Swamp is a decent alternative if San Jose is too far.

On separate occasions, I've had the crawfish, cajun fries, chicken wings, shrimp and sausage. Cajun fries and chicken wings are okay, items that you can find anywhere at a different restaurant. Shrimp and crawfish are pretty decent, the sauce is runny and has a watered down consistency unlike that of Boiling Crab's oily and thick sauce. The sausage are perfect bursts of flavor and definitely spice up your bags of seafood.

The service here is always amazing, just wish the food was a tad bit better.

excerpts: We checked in on Yelp and got an order of cajun fries on the house.
Crispy, crunchy fries, with a bit of a punch--so good.
Even better cause they were free.
cajun fries.author: Audrey T.
cajun fries.review:
SWAMP. In my book, second only to Boiling Crab. Yea, I went there. So good I had dinner here twice in a span of four days (and no, I'm not ashamed).

My typical order: pound of shrimp, mild, hurricane sauce, and one cob of corn. YUM. If you're still feeling famished, throw in an order of sausage as well. The hurricane sauce is SO friggin good. My friends and I think it is tomato based. Who knew a sauce that wasn't loaded with sticks of butter would still be delicious? Not me, no siree bob. And dinner would be incomplete without some sides. We checked in on Yelp and got an order of cajun fries on the house. Crispy, crunchy fries, with a bit of a punch--so good. Even better cause they were free. Also yummy were the deviled wings, alligator sausage (highly recommended if you are a fan of Spam haha), garlic noodles, and of course some french bread to sop up that decadent sauce. 

The owners are really nice too. They like to come around and make sure everything is dandy. Great service, yummy food. Swamp's where I'll be when I'm in the city and too lazy to drive to Boiling Crab.

excerpts: Ordered a pound of shrimp in their hurricane sauce, some crawfish beignets, and checked in for free cajun fries.
Fries were good, crispy and the seasoning was banging.
The shrimp was pretty fresh and big - definitely no baby shrimps in the bucket.
I was really excited for the beignets
but I guess when you expect too much, you become that much more disappointed when what you get isn't what you wanted.
As other reviewers mentioned, it was pretty fishy inside -
I had to mask the fishy taste by dipping it in the hurricane sauce...
though the breading outside the filling was a lot, it soaked up the hurricane sauce pretty nicely.
cajun fries.author: Ava F.
cajun fries.review: Average food but good service. Ordered a pound of shrimp in their hurricane sauce, some crawfish beignets, and checked in for free cajun fries. Fries were good, crispy and the seasoning was banging. The shrimp was pretty fresh and big - definitely no baby shrimps in the bucket. I was really excited for the beignets but I guess when you expect too much, you become that much more disappointed when what you get isn't what you wanted. As other reviewers mentioned, it was pretty fishy inside - I had to mask the fishy taste by dipping it in the hurricane sauce... though the breading outside the filling was a lot, it soaked up the hurricane sauce pretty nicely.

excerpts: I enjoyed the Cajun fries as well although the seasoning reminded me of the one used at Quickly for their fries and popcorn chicken.
cajun fries.author: BizzyLizzy K.
cajun fries.review:
Just went to Rockin Crawfish about 4 or 5 days ago so will compare to that.

I was so happy the sauce was thicker here than at Rockin Crawfish, but ultimately would still want it thicker.

The shrimp was mediocre but the crawfish was good.

I enjoyed the Cajun fries as well although the seasoning reminded me of the one used at Quickly for their fries and popcorn chicken.

We ordered for pick up and the older Asian man was very curteous.  The place was clean and I liked that our to-go items were neatly packed in large box and instead of bagging the seafood, it was in Tupperware - just felt cleaner.

Unfortunately, the food wasn't memorable but I would definitely be willing to try again.

excerpts: Like everyone else recommends, don't forget to check in for free cajun fries!
We had the clam chowder, garlic noodles, shrimp, and crawfish.
Like every cajun seafood restaurant, the sauce is always extremely flavorful.
What stood out to me was the sweet french bread that customers usually order to dip in their  sauce.
Of course we had to try it, and it was great!
The bread comes out warm and lightly toasted.
Nothing extremely exciting, nothing bad either.
No complaints here.
cajun fries.author: Annie L.
cajun fries.review: Came here with some friends on a Saturday night. Like everyone else recommends, don't forget to check in for free cajun fries! We had the clam chowder, garlic noodles, shrimp, and crawfish. Like every cajun seafood restaurant, the sauce is always extremely flavorful. What stood out to me was the sweet french bread that customers usually order to dip in their  sauce. Of course we had to try it, and it was great! The bread comes out warm and lightly toasted. Nothing extremely exciting, nothing bad either. No complaints here.

excerpts: My go-to order there is usually 2 lbs of shrimp in hurricane mild, 1lb of clams in hurricane mild, 2 garlic noodles, 2 corn and FREE Cajun Fries (via the Yelp Check-in).
I love how the clams are always huge and all of them are open.
I hate it when I go to restaurants and half of the clams aren't cooked.
cajun fries.author: Leah F.
cajun fries.review:
Whenever my Mom and I are craving Boiling Crab, we head to Swamp. 
We always get there before 6 to get Happy Hour pricing (15% off) and we love the staff. They're always friendly, attentive and the "scraps" pile of the shrimp and clam shell bowl is always emptied.

My go-to order there is usually 2 lbs of shrimp in hurricane mild, 1lb of clams in hurricane mild, 2 garlic noodles, 2 corn and FREE Cajun Fries (via the Yelp Check-in). I love how the clams are always huge and all of them are open. I hate it when I go to restaurants and half of the clams aren't cooked. The shrimp has always been big and not overcooked. 

The Hurricane sauce that combines all of the sauces together creates a distinct sauce that separates them from Boiling Crab's Whole Sha-Bang. Perhaps its the addition of herbs and spices plus the coconut curry? I think I may like Swamp's sauce the best out of all of the Cajun food places (boiling crab, craw station, kicking crab).

My Mom and my favorite item has to be the GARLIC NOODLES!!! We used to order one order and now we get one each. One of the staff told us it was the same recipe as  PPQ Dungeness Island!! Ah! No wonder! You must try the garlic noodles. 

I hope Swamp sticks around, its definitely my favorite cajun/boiling crab style restaurant in San Francisco for sure.

excerpts: Be sure to check in for free cajun fries!
cajun fries.author: Mimi V.
cajun fries.review:
I was so excited to find out about crawfish restaurants not too far from my house. This place had four stars, so we thought to give it a try.

We got the crawfish in hurricane sauce with corn, sausage and potatoes. Be sure to check in for free cajun fries!

Unfortunately, I was disappointed. I've had better. Here are the reasons why:

1. Crawfish comes out in a bowl. A BOWL. What happened to the bag? I know SF is an ecofriendly city, but come on! I love rolling  my crawfish around in the sauce. The bowl isn't as fun and the sauce stays on the bottom.

2. I don't think the crawfish were fresh and along the same lines, they were small. BOTH disadvantages to a high rating. 

3. It's weird, but I expect the typical teenage staff - they move fast! Sometimes, it took us forever to get SWAMP's servers' attention. 

Overall, it satisfied my craving. The fries made the dinner worth it - they were yummy. I also like additions, so corn, potatoes and sausage were great too. The Hurricane sauce was okay - we got mild and probably wouldn't be able to handle the other levels. Be sure to ask for salt, pepper and lime sauce. They don't bring it out otherwise. We may be back...maybe.

excerpts:
Cajun Fries: $3.50
2 Corn: $0.75/each
Sausage (6 pieces): $2.50
: Peel most of your shrimp and put it back in the sauce or else it will taste bland
 
 Cajun Fries
- Normal portion size.
-Lacked Cajun flavor: basically it was regular french fries.
cajun fries.author: Janelle P.
cajun fries.review:
I went here with with my boyfriend and we enjoyed it!

My review is based on our experience at Boiling Crab, Craw Station, and Cajun House. 

What we ate:
1 pound Hurricane Boil Shrimp: Mild $12/lb
Cajun Fries: $3.50
2 Corn: $0.75/each
Sausage (6 pieces): $2.50
Steam Rice: $1.50

Total cost without tip: $22.79

Food Review:  Overall Good

Hurricane Boil Shrimp: Mild 
 - Great sauce but we were looking for something with more "POW"/ spiciness.
- The sauce had a great texture where it was not too watery and not to thick. 
- Shrimp Tip: Peel most of your shrimp and put it back in the sauce or else it will taste bland
 
 Cajun Fries
- Normal portion size.
-Lacked Cajun flavor: basically it was regular french fries. (We asked to get more powder on it to make it better -- and it did)

Corn 
-Good corn but we wished it had a more crisp kernels. 
- The boil tasted great on it

Sausage 
- Flavor was average
- Small portions but consistent with the price

Steam Rice:
-Slightly sticky but acceptable

Service Review: Above average
- The waitresses were very helpful but both were definitely new to the job.
- They were so helpful that they asked if we were "ok" 3 times within 10 minutes 
- Additionally whenever we were close to running out of water they filled it up
- Another patron asked what was in the jumbo and the waitress did not know the answer besides "chicken and ......"
- Friendly staff

Decor/ Environment: Good
- Large seating area
- Bar Seating
- Large TV screens
- Top 40 music playing

Tips & Thoughts
- We will come again!
- Happy Hour 3-6PM which is 15% off everything (beer & wine included)
- You can order beer by the pint and wine by the glass or bottle -- hopefully they have beer pitchers soon!

Ranking local San Francisco Cajun Styles Restaurants: 
-1. Swamp
-2. Cajun House
-3. Craw Station

**Boiling Crab is still the best!!!!**

excerpts: Cajun fries were free with yelp check in.
Definitely would go again.
Don't forget to order garlic noodles and add corn to your order~ scallop was fresh,big and juicy!
$22 for a dozen scallops.
Similar experience as boiling crab except that it doesn't come in a plastic bag.
Comes in a bowl!
cajun fries.author: Elena K.
cajun fries.review: Fresh shrimp in tornado sauce with a hint of spiciness~ Cajun fries were free with yelp check in. Definitely would go again. Don't forget to order garlic noodles and add corn to your order~ scallop was fresh,big and juicy! $22 for a dozen scallops. Similar experience as boiling crab except that it doesn't come in a plastic bag. Comes in a bowl!

excerpts: The garlic noodle was good, the cajun fries is yummy, the calamari was just right.
Honestly, its a little sad that there is no real amazing cajun seafood joint in San Francisco.
You literally have to venture outside of the city to attain great cajun seafood.
cajun fries.author: Angela V.
cajun fries.review: I absolutely love cajun seafood, in particular crawfish.  This place cannot compare to Boiling Crab or any places I've eaten at in Sacramento or San Jose.  But it honestly gets the job done. The seafood is fresh and their hurricane sauce isn't too shabby.  Its very clean and the owner is very nice and upbeat.  The garlic noodle was good, the cajun fries is yummy, the calamari was just right.  Honestly, its a little sad that there is no real amazing cajun seafood joint in San Francisco.  You literally have to venture outside of the city to attain great cajun seafood.

excerpts: though is that they currently have a free order of cajun fries as their check-in offer.
cajun fries.author: David C.
cajun fries.review:
Meh, definitely have had better cajun styled food around town. I went and got a pound of the shrimp in the hurricane sauce. There wasn't anything that was wrong with the sauce and the shrimp, but there wasn't anything outstanding about it either. 

The price range, and the menu is very comparable to the Cajun House which also happens to be in the inner Richmond area, but I've found that their sauces has better flavours. One neat thing about this place though is that they currently have a free order of cajun fries as their check-in offer.

excerpts: It was my first time here & all we ordered was Cajun fries, 2 anchor steams, garlic butter shrimp & the hurricane mussels.
We received the shrimps & mussels but never got our beers & fries.
We literally had to ask 3 different people.
I don't think I would ever recommend this place to anyone.
P.S.
The 2 stars are for the mussels & Cajun fries.
cajun fries.author: Maria P.
cajun fries.review: I was not at all pleased with this . I guess u can say I had a bad first experience. I was craving garlic butter shrimp so my boyfriend decided to bring me here since I didn't wanna drive all the way to San Mateo. It was my first time here & all we ordered was Cajun fries, 2 anchor steams, garlic butter shrimp & the hurricane mussels. We received the shrimps & mussels but never got our beers & fries. We literally had to ask 3 different people. I don't think I would ever recommend this place to anyone. P.S. The 2 stars are for the mussels & Cajun fries.

excerpts:
+ free order of Cajun fries with check in 
+ hurricane sauce was AMAZING
+ great portions
+ good price 
+ prompt and friendly service
cajun fries.author: Laura L.
cajun fries.review:
Came here on a Friday night with my boyfriend. Ordered shrimp and crab legs and beignets for dessert. 

+ free order of Cajun fries with check in 
+ hurricane sauce was AMAZING
+ great portions
+ good price 
+ prompt and friendly service 

I don't have any complaints. This was a very enjoyable experience.

excerpts: For checking in on Yelp, you get a free side of Cajun fries which was a nice addition because I wanted to add that anyway.
cajun fries.author: Janny S.
cajun fries.review:
I can't believe its my first time eating Cajun style seafood boil and I am a big fan of seafood! Why are all these Louisiana seafood boil restaurants here in the Bay Area opened by Asian people? I'm always a little perplexed by that. They must have a lot of  Cajun culinary talent!

Started off with a dozen of Kusshi, Washington oysters to share. They were fresh and meaty, but didn't have a lot of flavor. I usually enjoy oysters that are sweet and briny. It came with one slice of lime which was weird because I think oysters should be served with an abundance of lemons. There were 3 of us and we went with two orders of the 2 item combo, the first combo with clams and mussel, and the 2nd with crawfish and shrimp, in the hurricane boil (all the flavors in one - Original cajun, Garlic Butter, and Coconut Curry), medium spicy and threw in 3 corns, $14/pound. The hurricane boil flavor is definitely recommended; the sauce is rich from the coconut curry and spices. I loved it. My favorite items from the 4 we ordered are the clams and the shrimp because they were much more rewarding and meatier. The clams were big and plump that night. I have made the decision that I am not a fan of crawfish because for the amount of work you have to put in, the reward is meager. The garlic noodles are delicious and garlicy. I like to pour the hurricane sauce all over it for more flavor! For checking in on Yelp, you get a free side of Cajun fries which was a nice addition because I wanted to add that anyway. I love free!

It wasn't very busy that night so the service was great! They came around to empty our shell bowls frequently. One big plus about this place is that the food is served in nice metal bowls, we get real plates and utensils instead of paper plates, plastic forks and food served in plastic bags. This was definitely a plus! I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets! So much to offer on their menu!

excerpts: I recommend you get the crab legs with buttered garlic and garlic noodles and make sure you check in because they give you free Cajun fries ;)
cajun fries.author: Mary Grace B.
cajun fries.review: I love this place not only is the food amazingly good it's in reasonable price the staff is so welcoming and the establishment itself is superclean. I recommend you get the crab legs with buttered garlic and garlic noodles and make sure you check in because they give you free Cajun fries ;)

excerpts: Cajun Fries - Missing, so

I can't comment
Fried Catfish - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Fried Oysters - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Clam Chowder - ok taste, but too watery
Deviled Wings - not very gd, didn't like the sauce, not very big wings
Garlic Noodle - pretty good, lots of garlic, fresh,
cajun fries.author: Sonia D.
cajun fries.review:
Overall, food was too salty! This is my first time ordering for delivery, so maybe there being too much salt was a one-time thing.

Cajun Fries - Missing, so I can't comment
Fried Catfish - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Fried Oysters - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Clam Chowder - ok taste, but too watery
Deviled Wings - not very gd, didn't like the sauce, not very big wings
Garlic Noodle - pretty good, lots of garlic, fresh, would order again

If they can reduce the salt, I may order regularly from them in the future.

excerpts: Cajun Fries:
Free with check in on yelp!
Pretty good, a bit spicy.
cajun fries.author: Lily W.
cajun fries.review:
Is not bad, but maybe I need to try more.

Came with a few friends and we could only decide on shrimp...so we had 3 pounds of shrimp. In 3 different flavors. The shrimp itself was quite good - only one was the "mushier" that I read in another review. The majority of the shrimp were pretty fresh. And pretty large.

hurricane sauce: a little spicy. Felt like there's curry in there somewhere. Pretty good.

Lemon Pepper: Sour. And Pepper. 'nuf said.

Garlic Butter: My least favorite. It was ok...but I could not taste garlic nor butter distinctively. It was like a bland tika masala sauce. 

Garlic Noodles: ok. Not too salty, which often happens with it.

Cajun Fries: Free with check in on yelp! Pretty good, a bit spicy.

excerpts: We ordered the dinner for 2 deal (for $49 before discount), 1 lb of crawfish, corn, and (with a yelp check in) also got a Cajun fries for free.
cajun fries.author: Tracy L.
cajun fries.review:
Had our crab craving yesterday so we came here for an early dinner. To our pleasant surprise, we got 15% off our total bill. Score!

We ordered the dinner for 2 deal (for $49 before discount), 1 lb of crawfish, corn, and (with a yelp check in) also got a Cajun fries for free. 

The food is great and the service is excellent. We would definitely return, which says a lot since our list of returned restaurant is less than 10 in all over Bay Area.

excerpts: Had the Cajun fries to start.
They were spicy and good!
Ordered the king crab boil with the garlic sauce.
Delicious!
Food was served fast and warm.
They even special made a lunch item at dinner for my boyfriend who doesn't do seafood.
Service was also great.
Great place to stop in at if your looking for something different and tasty!!!
cajun fries.author: Melissa B.
cajun fries.review: First time here and I must say I was impressed!  Had the Cajun fries to start. They were spicy and good! Ordered the king crab boil with the garlic sauce. Delicious!  Food was served fast and warm. They even special made a lunch item at dinner for my boyfriend who doesn't do seafood. Service was also great. Great place to stop in at if your looking for something different and tasty!!!

excerpts:
The Cajun fries are really simple and good, just some fries doused in old bay seasoning.
A pound of shrimp is definitely enough food for one person, but the muscles and clams are a bit less filling just because of the overall weight.
Crawfish were out of season when I went, unfortunately, but the shrimp were great regardless.
Happy hour is 15% off and ends at 6. 
The discount applies to your whole check, so get there early!
cajun fries.author: Harry L.
cajun fries.review:
Great little place run by a nice asian family. The Cajun fries are really simple and good, just some fries doused in old bay seasoning.
A pound of shrimp is definitely enough food for one person, but the muscles and clams are a bit less filling just because of the overall weight.
Crawfish were out of season when I went, unfortunately, but the shrimp were great regardless.
Happy hour is 15% off and ends at 6. The discount applies to your whole check, so get there early!

excerpts: They have a check-in freebie for free cajun fries, hence why we picked this place compared to the other cajun seafood place  on Geary.
Walked in on a Saturday night around 6:15 and it was EMPTY.
I couldn't believe it.

1 lb clams, hurricane style, medium -- Tasty
2 orders rice -- Have to soak up the juices
1 order cajun fries (free) -- taste like normal fries with a cajun seasoning dusted on top.

Surprisingly hot and crispy
1 order sweet potato fries -- nice crisp and not soggy!
1 order fried calamari --
Some places you feel it's 80% fried batter, NOT HERE.
cajun fries.author: Jenna H.
cajun fries.review:
It's no Boiling Crab, but it satisfied my "cajun seafood" fix on my birthday. They have a check-in freebie for free cajun fries, hence why we picked this place compared to the other cajun seafood place  on Geary. Walked in on a Saturday night around 6:15 and it was EMPTY. I couldn't believe it. We found awesome parking and didn't have to wait! 

What we got:
2 lbs shrimp, Hurricane style (The whole shebang), Medium spicy -- Nice BIG shrimps!
1 lb clams, hurricane style, medium -- Tasty
2 orders rice -- Have to soak up the juices
1 order cajun fries (free) -- taste like normal fries with a cajun seasoning dusted on top. Surprisingly hot and crispy
1 order sweet potato fries -- nice crisp and not soggy! 
1 order fried calamari -- Some places you feel it's 80% fried batter, NOT HERE. Actually very minimal batter.

The difference of this place and other cajun seafood establishments is they don't serve it to you in a plastic bag. There are plates and utensils on the table, and they bring your food in a pot. They give you an extra bowl for shells and routinely come around and empty the shells as you go.

Service was attentive, albeit it was extremely empty on a saturday night. Surprised too since we came during the Outsidelands festival and figured it would be crowded with festival goers.

excerpts: As for the food-- We ordered a dozen half shell raw oysters, fried catfish, cajun fries (free with your first time Yelp check-in there), whole dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce, garlic noodles, and for dessert the fried bananas & vanilla icecream.
The cajun fries were a little on the spicy side.
The kick was a little overwhelming where at one point I couldn't feel my lips, bc they were just that much on fire.
(BUT! I'm not going to ding them for a tiny error of over seasoned fries.)
The dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce was cooked perfectly.
The sauce was off the chain, so creamy/milky.
I poured the sauce over my garlic noodles as well!
The garlic noodles didn't stick to each other and they were soft and tender.
Dessert was splendid.
It was the perfect ending to our meal.
cajun fries.author: Cassie D.
cajun fries.review:
Although the name doesn't sound too appealing to the ear... the place manages to stick with and keep up with their name as the common theme throughout the restaurant. I like it! When it comes to these types of restaurants I don't expect to sit down and eat in a place that looks fancy. The concept is based on using your hands and not forks, knives, & spoons! (Which they provide though) This restaurant style is popping up all over the Bay Area now and yet some have not managed to keep up with the game, Swamp definitely does! 

The man running the place who I believe to be the owner is very nice. As the evening rolled around to 7-8p the place began to get packed and there were only 2 servers plus the owner himself totaling 3 people who were serving the entire resto. With just them the service began to lag a bit. The bf and I didn't mind bc we were in no rush to be somewhere. They did apologize each time they came to the table for the lag of their service as they too knew they were short staffed. 

As for the food-- We ordered a dozen half shell raw oysters, fried catfish, cajun fries (free with your first time Yelp check-in there), whole dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce, garlic noodles, and for dessert the fried bananas & vanilla icecream. 

The oysters were fresh and refreshing (wish we ordered more). The fried catfish was battered with a light beer batter and not with your normal flour/cornmeal. The fish wasn't overcooked, it was tender and flaky. The cajun fries were a little on the spicy side. The kick was a little overwhelming where at one point I couldn't feel my lips, bc they were just that much on fire. (BUT! I'm not going to ding them for a tiny error of over seasoned fries.) The dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce was cooked perfectly. The sauce was off the chain, so creamy/milky. I poured the sauce over my garlic noodles as well! The garlic noodles didn't stick to each other and they were soft and tender. Dessert was splendid. It was the perfect ending to our meal. Not overly sweet! 

Will come here again! This resto gets my recommendation.

excerpts: I love how you can get a free side of cajun fries with a check in, TOTALLY worth it because the Cajun fries is delicious.
It comes out piping hot with a healthy sprinkling of seasoning.
cajun fries.author: Amy L.
cajun fries.review:
If you happen to be in the area and happen to crave some Creole/Cajun food. I love how you can get a free side of cajun fries with a check in, TOTALLY worth it because the Cajun fries is delicious. It comes out piping hot with a healthy sprinkling of seasoning. It's salty and spicy and what a good fry should be. 

This place can fit big parties, so it can accomadate large parties. I know a lot of people might compare this place to Boiling crab and in a way the menu is simple like boiling crab. But, there are unique items on the menu as well. 

Garlic noodles; delicious and the noodle is like chow mein. 
Shrimp with the hurricane is pretty much a mixture of all the seasoning. It is their house special and it is really delicious. It is kind of like a soup and the flavors are really not overly salty. 
Gumbo: I would opt out of getting this item. Definitely not their strongest and the ingredients are really sub par. 

I would definitely go back if I am around the area.

excerpts: The cajun fries were OK, but not spectacular as it was difficult to taste the seasoning.
#3 - On the Ropes: We happened to have a Yelp coupon for free cajun fries.
I'm a scaredy cat, so after #1 & #2, I asked my wife to present the coupon to the guy.
She showed the coupon which still needed a few clicks to complete the transaction.
The guy very curtly said to her to click "this" now "that" now "this.

"  I don't recall the commands on the phone, but basically instead of saying, OK, you just need to click through these steps, he elevated everyone's blood pressure in the room by using a high volume to spew the commands at her.
cajun fries.author: Brian L.
cajun fries.review:
The main dish here came through and my wife is hoping to go back again.  This was my first time going here. 

The service from the waiter (possibly the guy running the place) is deplorable and combative. 

Food: We had a prawn and shrimp boil with cajun seasoning. The prawn were undersized, but my wife really liked them as they had good flavor. The shrimp (whole and with veins) was good sized and tasted fresh. The watermelon iced tea was nearly undrinkable. The cajun fries were OK, but not spectacular as it was difficult to taste the seasoning.  If you ask for more ketchup, they'll bring the bottle over and squirt some into the small ketchup dish instead of giving you the bottle. 

Service: Based on the service within only the first few moments of walking in the door, I was ready to walk out of the door. A few simple correspondences as a guest of the establishment shouldn't get your blood boiling and discomfort level up. For the quick and dirty on the place, you can stop here, if you are interested in knowing what happened, I've outlined the 4 painful experiences below. 

Unfortunately tone and volume are not yet transmissible via text, so you will need to imagine a very loud and angry guy who can make people uncomfortable with simple words. There were at least 5-6 witnesses (which is what I believe they should be termed in this type of situation) in the restaurant. 

#1 - Taken Aback: Walked in and the place was at about 20% capacity. The guy said "can I help you" from all the way across the restaurant which is a strange way to greet people.  Being that it was my first time here, I also walked in with that normal level of social anxiety of not knowing where to sit.  I responded in a joking manner that we're just trying to find a place to sit.  The guy told me that you don't choose, he will seat you himself.  Taken aback, I jested that there should be a sign if that is the case, but he said that they don't need a sign since he just tells people where to sit.... This went on for a demeaning 30-40 seconds. 

#2 - The Jab: They give you two menus, one of them has all the main seafood and one has drinks & lunch specials.  Outside the door they have a sign advertising Po-Boy sandwiches, this doesn't appear to be dependent on the time of day.  Not finding the Po-Boy on the regular menu, my wife found it on the lunch special page.  I asked if it is possible to get a poor boy at this time (after the end of lunch specials), the guy told me he could give it to me, but it wouldn't be at the happy hour price.
