I was fine with this pricing fact.. I guess.. but the way he said it was very rude and condescending. I would think that it's either on the menu or not (especially when it's on the sign outside and plastered in ads on the window). 

#3 - On the Ropes: We happened to have a Yelp coupon for free cajun fries.  I'm a scaredy cat, so after #1 & #2, I asked my wife to present the coupon to the guy.  She showed the coupon which still needed a few clicks to complete the transaction.  The guy very curtly said to her to click "this" now "that" now "this."  I don't recall the commands on the phone, but basically instead of saying, OK, you just need to click through these steps, he elevated everyone's blood pressure in the room by using a high volume to spew the commands at her. Sometimes an economy of words with people can seem so much ruder...

#4 - The Death Blow:  The menu for the seafood boils have prices by the pound.  We ordered a combo shirimp/prawn at about $14/lb, but didn't exactly say how many pounds and the guy didn't ask.  After ordering, and given the awful experience so far, I did start to worry that perhaps the default might be more than a pound, so I asked my wife to confirm with the guy when she walked back from washing her hands.  She asked the guy on her way back, and the guy got very loud and confrontational to explain how the menu works and that if you order the combo, it is simply $14.  She said that she was just worried because we didn't say one way or another and the price is in per pound increments.  The guy said he doesn't need to ask since it just is $14. She explained that it's our first time here so we didn't know how it works.  Disregarding this comment, the guy then "went over her head" and came over to me to explain how the menu works.  I told him that we just weren't sure and wanted to make sure and that I was the one who actually had the question.  He failed to grasp the situation and his handling was quite rude - particularly trying to go over my wife's head as though I could somehow explain his specious argument to her (if you've ever ordered something on a menu listed as market price, you know that you had better double check prices first!). 

P.S. Luckily he disappeared 20 minutes into our experience, so we were able to let our guard down and try to enjoy our meal on an otherwise nice Friday afternoon.

excerpts: Ordered the alligator sausage, cajun fries, garlic noodles, 1 lb of shrimp (hurricane medium spicy), and 1 lb of mussels.
The cajun fries needed to be crunchier/crispier and were steak-cut which I don't prefer.
cajun fries.author: Sophia L.
cajun fries.review:
Ordered the alligator sausage, cajun fries, garlic noodles, 1 lb of shrimp (hurricane medium spicy), and 1 lb of mussels. 

The alligator sausage wasn't that great, pretty oily, and the taste was unmemorable.The cajun fries needed to be crunchier/crispier and were steak-cut which I don't prefer. The garlic noodles are yummy though - should give those a try! 

As for the seafood, the shrimp and mussels were both very fresh. But the hurricane sauce wasn't thick enough to coat the shrimp so you have to dip the shrimp in there quite a few times. In my opinion, the mussels were the best thing on the menu. This place isn't bad, but of course, nowhere as good as Boiling Crab. (There's a reason all these imitation BC places have no wait.)

excerpts:
Any who we ordered 

Shrimp hurricane style mild with 2 corns it's was yummy, it came in a nice bowl keeping it warm 

Calamari  yummy 
Free Cajun fries with yelp checkin also 
yummy

Watermelon ice tea
cajun fries.author: Erica S.
cajun fries.review:
So I ate here for my 26th birthday yesterday  and I liked it ! There was 18 ppl in my party and the service was okay I think they did pretty good considering there's only 2 ppl working the front ... 

Any who we ordered 

Shrimp hurricane style mild with 2 corns it's was yummy, it came in a nice bowl keeping it warm 

Calamari  yummy 
Free Cajun fries with yelp checkin also 
yummy

Watermelon ice tea  so good I had 2 glasses 

Crawfish beignet was ehh - tasted like a piroshki wouldn't ride that again 

Didn't order dessert cuz I had my bday cake 

We will be back

excerpts: Cajun Fries - not bad..
cajun fries.author: Donna H.
cajun fries.review:
Shrimp - mediocre quality. Mushier than good shrimp. 
Mussels -also mediocre - a bit fishy.
Clams - good
Fried Oysters - big and juicy.. yum.
Corn was sweet.
Cajun Fries - not bad.. a tad salty.

Garlic Butter sauce was tasty/ok but mediocre and good for dipping bread into. It wasn't as garlicky as I had hoped it would be.. 

Lemon Pepper sauce was tasty/ok.

Best dish had to be the garlic noodles. They were really flavorful -- a tad on the oily side, but delicious.

Service was friendly. 4 flat screens tv's at the bar = great for watching simultaneous bay area sports teams if they happen to play at the same time.. ahem giants/warriors.

Overall 3.5 -- It's not bad, but I'm not dreaming about that garlic sauce. I might have to come back to try their other sauces..

excerpts: The cajun fries could be better and the alligator sausages was not to die for.
cajun fries.author: Alan L.
cajun fries.review:
First time trying this place due to good reviews and my friends had gave it a shot, so I needed to come by and try it.  First off, the restaurant was pretty empty, so that tells you something already that the seafood is not being rotated enough for everything to be "fresh".   We got the hurricane and it was good.  

Pros: Great service, the servers will monitor to make sure water was filled.  The shrimp was good, fresh and tasty.  The oysters were also good.  

Cons: CRAWFISH - They were FROZEN!!!! and the server did NOT warn us that the crawfish are not fresh.  Unlike boiling crab, or any other crawfish place I've eaten, they will first alert you that the crawfish is frozen before serving it.  So okay... it was frozen, then they should slice the price down by half.  But that did not happen.  Luckily we only ordered 1 lb of crawfish.  The cajun fries could be better and the alligator sausages was not to die for.  The main course (crawfish) was a flop, however, shrimp and oysters were good.  

Will I come back?  Not really, because the crawfish really threw me off.  I hope they will tell people before serving them frozen, because if you are a seafood eater, you can most definitely tell from fresh or frozen.  And if it's frozen, please lower your price.

excerpts: in addition to our boil, we also ordered a side of cajun fries with was delish as well.
But I think what makes this place stand out was the great service.
cajun fries.author: Jennifer O.
cajun fries.review:
Went here with my boyfriend and thoroughly enjoyed both the food and the experience. We ordered a 3lb bowl of crawfish and shrimp in the hurricane sauce and it was to die for. very delicious. I was a little nervous about ordering that much food, but it honestly wasn't that much given that it is shellfish after all. most of the weight is the shell. With that said, I finished the food and felt satisfied -- not stuffed, which was perfect. and that hurricane sauce was the bomb!! 

in addition to our boil, we also ordered a side of cajun fries with was delish as well. But I think what makes this place stand out was the great service. The waiter as well as the restaurant owner checked on us several times, and truly made us feel at home. 

Will definitely be back when I'm in the mood for some flavorful and spicy crawfish!

excerpts: The hush puppies are pretty good, the calamari is ok (kinda a small amount), and the cajun fries are delish, the alligator sausage kinda just tastes like sausage though.
cajun fries.author: Rohan D.
cajun fries.review:
Scrumptious! The hush puppies are pretty good, the calamari is ok (kinda a small amount), and the cajun fries are delish, the alligator sausage kinda just tastes like sausage though.


The broths for boils are all good, I had the garlic butter + clams and the crawfish + the all in broth. The guy there recommended getting some french bread and dipping it in the broth (best idea ever).

excerpts:
[+] Check in on YELP, get free cajun fries

[+]
[-] Cajun Fries - super spicy for some reason...
cajun fries.author: Tammy F.
cajun fries.review:
Went here last week...very nice greeting by all servers/boss

The first thing I noticed was the boss was drinking wine at the bar..but serve people as well....but then he would cheer loudly for the game...but really just sitting there watching the game. I hope tips aren't divided evenly bc thats not fair for the servers that are actually working. 

Atmosphere: Stylish...a little more classier than the normal Cajun house...it is also more family friendly.

PROS
[+] Soft Bar - wine, beer on tap

[+] Friendly male server (for the day we went anyway)

[+] Happy Hour (even though we missed it)

[+] Check in on YELP, get free cajun fries

[+] Using bowls instead of bags, felt more clean..but the bag does steam the juices better.

CONS
[-] Calamari ($8)- too thick, hard to chew, sauce was too spicy

[-] Cajun Fries - super spicy for some reason...a lil too much spices

[-] Crawfish ($12/lb) - hurricane sauce, medium....When I bite off the head, it was BLACK..you can taste the bittnerness and how unfresh it is....I LOVVVEEEE eating crawfish but it just wasn't good. Sauce also didn't cover the bitterness...im pretty sure it was frozen...most places charges frozen seafood cheaper depending on the season. But I guess they just aren't honest about it.

[-] Shrimp ($12/lb) - It was either old, or left outside for too long. It had a smell to it. Like it's very old. We couldn't even eat it bc it just smells awful. It wasn't the sauce. It was the actual shrimp meat. You can just tell it wasn't fresh and it might have expired, or been left out too long.

[-] We ordered the clam chower, but server totally forgot it. 


Did I mention I had a stomachache during the night? I was sleeping and woke up with a terrible stomachache. I felt so sick! I almost wanted to go to the ER. It musta been the shrimp or the crawfish. ARGH...NEVER AGAIN!!!

Go to Rockin' Crawfish, or Boiling Crab instead!

excerpts: Lastly, don't forget to check in and receive your free order of Cajun Fries!
They were cooked to perfection!
cajun fries.author: Denzell S.
cajun fries.review: I've practically tried every creole/cajun shrimp restaurant around the Peninsula, with the exception of Red Crawfish, and this is by far my favorite cajun shrimp style joint in San Francisco. I know the name doesn't sound appetizing, but don't let that stop you! It's tasty Hurricane flavor holds as a strong contender to Boiling Crab's Whole Sha-bang. Not only was their flavor great, but it was more of a soup and less oily compared to other shrimp spots. The only downside I can note was their small rice portion. I literally had to order 2 sides of rice. Lastly, don't forget to check in and receive your free order of Cajun Fries! They were cooked to perfection!

excerpts:
Mussels in Lemon Pepper-Clams are way better

Cajun fries were yummy and cripsy

Corn is a must

Garlic noodles were good

Raw Oysters-fresh

Good price, great flavors, good service.
cajun fries.author: Karen H.
cajun fries.review:
YUMMY! My fave place in SF. 

Shrimp in Garlic Butter

Clams in Lemon Pepper

Crawfish in Hurricane-This I thought was ok only, but I am not a huge fan of Crawfish.

Mussels in Lemon Pepper-Clams are way better

Cajun fries were yummy and cripsy

Corn is a must

Garlic noodles were good

Raw Oysters-fresh

Good price, great flavors, good service. WIll be back.

I like that they serve in dishes and not in a plastic bag and they give you plates and forks to eat with.

excerpts: Cajun fries were delicious and the muscle hurricane boil was amazing...
cajun fries.author: Helen N.
cajun fries.review:
The Hurricane Habanero level spicy boil is not to be reckoned with. It's hotter than you think. Hotter than I thought, and hotter than my date. 

Service was awesome. Everyone is super friendly, attentive, and funny. Definitely a family feel. 
Decor/ ambiance won't astonish you, but thats why the food is good and the prices are reasonable. 
Cajun fries were delicious and the muscle hurricane boil was amazing... it hurt a little.

Oysters were fresh and I wanted 15,0000 of them.

excerpts: Cajun Fries $3.50 or FREE with yelp check-in.
(4.5 of 5) Pretty good and even better when it was free.
The fries were good wedge sizes but surprising the Cajun flavoring was outstanding.
The Cajun powder wasn't too salty and it had a good heat hint at the end.
It was really really really good.
But the yam fries taste just a little better.
* Deviled Wings (6) $6 (3.5 of 5) Not too spicy even though they are called deviled wings.
But they are super fat wings.
cajun fries.author: Janice T.
cajun fries.review:
Great place for large groups. Lots to eat, great fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and free to be loud!!! I wasn't expecting this place to be great, but it was pretty good.
 
* 1 dozen Kusshi on the half shell $18 (4 of 5) Fat and creamy raw oysters served with lemon, cocktail sauce, and horseradish. The oysters were fresh and very good size. Delicious for $18.
* Sweet Potato Fries $4.50 (5 of 5) Fabulous. Looked like long cork screws and they tasted so good. Crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside. It was a really really really really good yam fry. Yummy!
* Cajun Fries $3.50 or FREE with yelp check-in. (4.5 of 5) Pretty good and even better when it was free. The fries were good wedge sizes but surprising the Cajun flavoring was outstanding. The Cajun powder wasn't too salty and it had a good heat hint at the end. It was really really really good. But the yam fries taste just a little better. 
* Deviled Wings (6) $6 (3.5 of 5) Not too spicy even though they are called deviled wings. But they are super fat wings. 
* Grilled Alligator Sausage $6 (2.5 of 5) Very excited to taste this. It was one sausage sliced in half and grilled. It was a little fishy. But tasted better when we sprinkled lemon juice on top of it. Then it tasted like a better chicken sausage. This is definitely a pass when I go back a second time.
* Fried Calamari $8 (3 of 5) Not bad but not great.
* Fried Oysters $8 (5 of 5) Great batter and great size. The fried oysters were still moist and juicy in the middle. I would re-order and re-order. Yummy!
* Fried Fish Fillet $8 (3.5 of 5) Tasted like really good and crispy fish fillet (like McDonald's). Again great frying and great batter choice. 
* Garlic Noodle $7 (4.5 of 5) I think this is one of my preferred garlic noodles now. It was great noodle choice because it was soft and chewy. I really liked the portion and the overall taste and texture. If I can't eat Than Long's garlic noodle, this would be my next go to place.
* Garlic Butter Crab $30/each (4 of 5) Tasty. Very nice sauce. And exactly what it is named, garlic + butter. Tasted extra good when we poured the sauce over the garlic noodle. Delicious.
* Hurricane Shrimp and corn and sausage $12/lb + 0.75each + $2.50 (6 pieces) (4.5 of 5) Hurricane is supposedly a mix of all flavors. I liked it, especially with rice or the French Bread. It was pretty good.  
* Soda $2.50 free refill
* Pitcher of Beer $16

This place was great for our group of ten. They were nice and accommodating. All the items very fairly tasty. Most of the frying dishes were yummy and great with the soda/beer. The seafood bowls were also very tasty too.

excerpts: we tried 1/2 lb of crawfish and shrimp, 1lb of crab legs, corn n Cajun fries.
The shrimps were huge and the run off broth was perfect with bread.
Definitely coming back.
Points for the great service
, owner is super cool, Makes recommendations and is a funny guy.
cajun fries.author: Miguel C.
cajun fries.review:
+ Great, spicy, flavorful shrimp/crawfish.
+ served in bowls. (Not in a plastic bag like other  similar places)
+ fast attentive service
 
Stopped by on a Saturday night, thought we'd give this new place a try. The  food was so good- we tried 1/2 lb of crawfish and shrimp, 1lb of crab legs, corn n Cajun fries. The shrimps were huge and the run off broth was perfect with bread. Definitely coming back. Points for the great service, owner is super cool, Makes recommendations and is a funny guy.

excerpts: Oh yea don't forget to check in on yelp for your free order of cajun fries!
LOL you can throw the fries in the garlic butter sauce after you are done with the crab but don't come looking for me if your doctor tells you that you have elevated cholesterol!
cajun fries.author: Allison T.
cajun fries.review:
I have tried almost every crawfish restaurant in the city and keep coming back to this one.  I admit I was a bit skeptical at first but an glad I decided to give this place a shot.  Kind of does help that my son always wants to eat crawfish.  I came in again for dinner last night and once again was not disappointed.  I have tried a lot of the items here but their garlic butter crab is my all time favorite.  It was so good that I ordered 3 of them last night but if your getting up in your age like me...ask for mild...has a kick to it.  The garlic noodles also went very well with the crab.  My sister always orders the fried oysters and the alligator sausage is very good.  The kids like the hurricane flavor of the crawfish....pretty tasty since its a mixture of all their flavors. 

Oh yea don't forget to check in on yelp for your free order of cajun fries! LOL you can throw the fries in the garlic butter sauce after you are done with the crab but don't come looking for me if your doctor tells you that you have elevated cholesterol!

excerpts:
1 IB of shrimp (hurricane / mild)
2 corn
1 side of bread
1 order of fried fish
1 order of cajun fries (comp'd w/ yelp check in)

some of the cajun seasoning they use on the cajun fries (IMO)

Lastly, everything total was well worth it.
cajun fries.author: Kenny L.
cajun fries.review:
Another new cajun style joint in the City? I'm not mad at that

This spot is definitely family owned and I always respect that. They greet you nicely here as you walk in and they make good suggestions on what to order if it's your first time here. 

I believe the owner was the one who seated us and kind of gave us a 2 second overview of their menu before we dove into it

We ended up ordering:
1 IB of shrimp (hurricane / mild)
2 corn
1 side of bread
1 order of fried fish
1 order of cajun fries (comp'd w/ yelp check in)
1 order of gumbo w/ rice

Overall, i have to say my favorite part was the shrimp. The juices and sauce it came with in the bowl was PERFECT (not too watery and not too saucey), just the right texture. 
It wasn't too spicy for mild which was also perfect. 

The gumbo wasn't bad, but I've had some better gumbo in my days of having cajun food. The fries were a nice add since it was a comp'd w/ the yelp check in. 

The fish was MEH, pretty bland and the pieces were really small. I think they would be better w/ some of the cajun seasoning they use on the cajun fries (IMO)

Lastly, everything total was well worth it. I'd be back again the next time I want some cajun!

excerpts: FREE cajun fries when you check in.
They're ok.
cajun fries.author: Timothy L.
cajun fries.review:
Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane boil: 4/5
Shrimp and mussels tasted good to me. I don't really know what "fresh" tastes like, but they weren't fishy and the shrimp were quite plump. The Hurricane boil was also pretty tasty. We got mild and it was probably between a mild and a medium. Also had some sausage and corn in there. Flavors mixed well with those two. The toasted bread we got on the side was delicious in the boil.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter boil: 5/5
They're pre-cut into smaller sizes and pre-cut from end to end for easy opening. Crab was plump and tender. Garlic Butter boil was awesome. I'd have to say better than the Hurricane boil. Wish we had the corn in the Garlic Butter boil. Pick out some crab meat, put it on the toasted bread, spoon over some Garlic Butter boil... and that is a winning combo! Unfortunately, King Crab is quite pokey! So just be careful with your fingers when trying to pry open the shells.

Other: 4/5
We had a giant bug near the window. Should have known beforehand that bugs are always by the windows. They were nice enough to move us over to another table without hassle. FREE cajun fries when you check in. They're ok. Free is good, but I wouldn't purchase them.

I like that the food comes in bowls rather than bags. Makes less of a mess and dipping things into the boils is a lot easier.

I'd come back here again. Boiling crab is too far even though I like their food too.

excerpts: There was a yelp check-in offer where you receive an order of Cajun fries when you check-in.
About 4 of us took advantage of it and Swamp accomodated the offer.
The Cajun fries were good and had spice.
cajun fries.author: Richard B. F.
cajun fries.review:
I went to Swamp for a friend's Birthday this past Saturday 3.16.2013. This place reminds me of Boiling Crab minus the long wait and the plastic bags they serve the seafood in. I went with a group totaling 13 people. 

To start things off, the owners and servers were extremely friendly. They had a few beers on Tap I had the Hennepin which was good. There was a yelp check-in offer where you receive an order of Cajun fries when you check-in. About 4 of us took advantage of it and Swamp accomodated the offer. The Cajun fries were good and had spice.

A few of us grouped together and ordered a few things. We ordered Crab, Shrimp, Gumbo, Etoufee & Aligator Sausage. ALL DISHES WERE EXCELLENT! A few of us in the group preferred mild seasoning and their mild was actually pretty spicy. Although it was spicy, it was still good! On paper the Alligator sausage sounds exotic, but tasted like a regular sausage. They could have easily served us regular sausage and said that it was Alligator.

Overall, I would definitely go back for the food. I would also definitely go back for the extremely friendly and funny staff & owner.

excerpts: We got free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp, which is a cool bonus.
The fries were pretty good.
They were a little spicy, but not too spicy.
I also had the clam chowder and garlic fries.
Next time, I'd probably just go w/
cajun fries.author: Vincent L.
cajun fries.review:
Hurricane sauce was really good w/ the shrimp. Everyone reviewed the alligator sausages, so I had to try it. It kind of tasted like regular pork sausage, but slightly different. It was a little more tender, but the taste and texture was mostly like pork sausage. We got free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp, which is a cool bonus. The fries were pretty good. They were a little spicy, but not too spicy. I also had the clam chowder and garlic fries. Next time, I'd probably just go w/ just their specialty: any of the seafood w/ the hurricane sauce.

The service was really good. Our server made sure we had everything we needed and was very friendly. He also had good and detailed suggestions about the menu.

I'd be glad to go back to this place.

excerpts: Altogether, I'd say that this place has pretty decent portion sizes for the price, and you get also get free cajun fries for checking in on Yelp.
The cajun fries are pretty popping too.
cajun fries.author: Danny C.
cajun fries.review: First off, the service here is freaking awesome. It's definitely not boiling crab, but it's not packed either. Alligator sausages and hush puppies to start. I'd recommend both, especially the hush puppies which taste like fried cornbread goodness. The garlic noodles are a good side, but they were right when they said we should get some french bread to dip into our sauces (mild hurricane with crawfish, shrimp, clams, and crab legs). The crab legs aren't a great deal, and the crawfish aren't very large, but man was everything spicy. Altogether, I'd say that this place has pretty decent portion sizes for the price, and you get also get free cajun fries for checking in on Yelp. The cajun fries are pretty popping too.

excerpts: - Cajun Fries: A MUST.
Free with the YELP check-in offer.
A ton of flavor packed in these perfectly fried potatoes.
- Shrimp in Hurricane Sauce: Hurricane is a mixture of all their sauce offerings: Cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper.
Mild was good for me, since I'm a whimp when it comes to spicy things but Medium was more flavorful compared to the group.
cajun fries.author: Tracy T.
cajun fries.review:
Highlights
- I came with a group of 6 on a week night after a Giants game and there was no wait.
- Bar area and tables, take your pick and good for large groups. 
- Includes TVs so you can definitely catch a game here as well as order beer and wine. 
- The perfect cajun seafood fix spot in SF. Not in the ghetto, clean, and close by.
- Oysters: Tasted fresh, but nothing special. 
- Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw. Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage. 
- Cajun Fries: A MUST. Free with the YELP check-in offer. A ton of flavor packed in these perfectly fried potatoes. 
- Shrimp in Hurricane Sauce: Hurricane is a mixture of all their sauce offerings: Cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper. Mild was good for me, since I'm a whimp when it comes to spicy things but Medium was more flavorful compared to the group. So good with their garlic noodles!

Improvements
- Dungeness crab in garlic butter: recommended by the waiter. Nothing special here. I would rather order another lb of the hurricane shrimp instead of this one. 
- Clams in hurricane sauce: I was never a fan of clams, so am my personal preference I would skip this one next time. If you love clams, this one is for you.  

Tip
- Parking can be difficult especially during lunch, dinner, and weekends.

excerpts: We also got some free cajun fries thanks to the yelp check-in offer.
Cajun fries first and they looked like regular fries I could get at Burger King, but with some spices on them.
The alligator sausage came after and it was grilled.
The taste was badically like eating chicken.
Nothing special.
Our shrimp and mussels finally came out, and to my dumbness, went straight for the shrimp's head and it burned my tongue.
Dumb move, i know.
I thought the spicy habenero hurricane sauce would've killed me
but it didn't.
It seemed like it was just a mild sauce.
But on the other hand, the corn that was in the hurricane sauce was definitely the spicy one.
Weird.
The shrimp in the garlic butter had to be my favorite.
How I ate them was that I would peel the shrimps first, then pur them back into the garlic butter sauce and let them sit there for a minute or two to have a coat of the sauce.
It's the same as dipping the shrimp, I know.
cajun fries.author: Sylvia b.
cajun fries.review:
It was our first time, so we weren't sure what to expect on a Friday night. There were probably 4 or 5 people there at the most. We were immediately seated and were expecting a menu right after. We waited for about 2-3 minutes just for a menu. Crazy. It wasn't even busy. We ordered the alligator sausage, 1lb of mussels in the spicy habenero hurricane sauce with corn and sausages, 1lb of shrimp in a medium garlic and butter sauce and sausages. We also got some free cajun fries thanks to the yelp check-in offer.

Cajun fries first and they looked like regular fries I could get at Burger King, but with some spices on them. The alligator sausage came after and it was grilled. The taste was badically like eating chicken. Nothing special. Our shrimp and mussels finally came out, and to my dumbness, went straight for the shrimp's head and it burned my tongue. Dumb move, i know. I thought the spicy habenero hurricane sauce would've killed me but it didn't. It seemed like it was just a mild sauce. But on the other hand, the corn that was in the hurricane sauce was definitely the spicy one. Weird. The shrimp in the garlic butter had to be my favorite. How I ate them was that I would peel the shrimps first, then pur them back into the garlic butter sauce and let them sit there for a minute or two to have a coat of the sauce. It's the same as dipping the shrimp, I know. But people have different techniques.

Overall, I's say it was pretty good. It was just the service in the beginning that got to me. But after that, they were pretty tentative. Maybe I'll come back. But I'd like to try other places similar to this one, too.

excerpts: Cajun Fries:
B - Crunchy and spicy, a little too spicy..
cajun fries.author: Gary W.
cajun fries.review:
1 lb Shrimp in Garlic Butter. Med spice: A - Nice and spicy, just how I like it. Shrimp was pretty big, which meant there weren't as much shrimp, but enough to fill me up.

Cajun Fries: B - Crunchy and spicy, a little too spicy.. all of the spices were piled on a couple of fries.

1/2 Dozen Oysters: C - These oysters were tiny!!! tasted good with ponzu sauce and horseradish, but not worth the price.

excerpts: If you check-in on yelp you get free cajun fries which is a good starter while you decide what you want to order.
Bill the manager here is the man
, I've come 5-6 times and he knows me, he hooked it up on my birthday meal here and usually throws in some beignets for me and my friends on a regular.
I've suggested to Bill to make their sauces thicker and they have since made that a regular thing, they added more ingredients to thicken the sauce and give it more flavor.
There's really no other Cajun establishment that competes with the flavors of this place in the city in my opinion, red crawfish is good
but I like this place more.
I will continue to be a loyal customer to this place.
cajun fries.author: Mike C.
cajun fries.review:
I gotta say, this is my favorite place to goto for Cajun seafood. Forget boiling crab thats 40 minutes away and 1.5+hr wait. Swamp has the best sauces, thick, flavorful, and the right amount of spiciness, I usually get the hurricane. I have ordered the crab, clams, mussels, shrimp, and they were all good. Their garlic noodles were the best I ever had even better than thanh long and I usually order one just for myself(It goes great with their sauces). They have the $49 set menu that gives you a fresh crab(not frozen), clam chowder, cole slaw, and beignets(perfect sweetness, light, fluffy. There are TV's around to watch your favorite sports teams, good selection of beers on tap at the bar and pitchers to go along with it, the place seats around 40+ people. If you check-in on yelp you get free cajun fries which is a good starter while you decide what you want to order. Bill the manager here is the man, I've come 5-6 times and he knows me, he hooked it up on my birthday meal here and usually throws in some beignets for me and my friends on a regular. I've suggested to Bill to make their sauces thicker and they have since made that a regular thing, they added more ingredients to thicken the sauce and give it more flavor. There's really no other Cajun establishment that competes with the flavors of this place in the city in my opinion, red crawfish is good but I like this place more. I will continue to be a loyal customer to this place. Thanks Bill!

P.S. There is a 15% off your bill happy hour from 3-6pm everyday

excerpts: But I checked in on Yelp and got the free cajun fries.
The yelp offer will say offer valid until 12-31-2014
so I asked him if it was still valid after I checked in
and he said something and walked away.
But we got the fries and 3-6pm is happy hour
so we got 15% off the tab.
Don't ask the old man about happy hour either, he won't be happy to answer.
Besides the service, the hurricane sauce is very good.
It has a more liquid consistency than other major crawfish joints.
But definitely very flavorful.
I will come back for the food.
The shrimp was huge and cooked well.
cajun fries.author: Guen S.
cajun fries.review: I must've came in the wrong hour. 3pm restaurant is empty so we get seated right away. The short old man is extremely mean! Every question I asked, he replied with an attitude and short answer as if I should've known the answer to my own question! But I checked in on Yelp and got the free cajun fries. The yelp offer will say offer valid until 12-31-2014 so I asked him if it was still valid after I checked in and he said something and walked away. But we got the fries and 3-6pm is happy hour so we got 15% off the tab. Don't ask the old man about happy hour either, he won't be happy to answer. Besides the service, the hurricane sauce is very good. It has a more liquid consistency than other major crawfish joints. But definitely very flavorful. I will come back for the food. The shrimp was huge and cooked well.

excerpts: Free Cajun Fries when you check-in!
cajun fries.author: Isabel L.
cajun fries.review:
Free Cajun Fries when you check-in! 

Got the Hurricane sauce shrimp and Hurricane sauce King Crab Legs (Swamp's take of Boiling Crab's Whole Shabang Sauce)

I wanted the shrimp but was most disappointed in the shrimp, sadly.  The shrimp was fresh (shrimp head was so good!) but did not have enough of that hurricane sauce flavor blended in.  It was bland.

The King Crab Legs, oh my god, I'd come back for this for sure.  I'm not even a fan of crabs.  Oddly, the same hurricane sauce for the crab was extremely flavorful compared to the hurricane sauce for the shrimp.  Why is that? The crab leg shells are already cut up and sliced for you, and was soft enough to rip apart with your hands.  This made it easier to just pick out the crab meat (and also the reason why the flavor seeped in so well compared to the shrimp). And I love that it still has some of that crab gunk in there (don't know what its called, but it's the only thing I'd eat from the crab head)

It's good if you don't want to go all the way to SJ for Boiling Crab!

Gimme those king crab legs!!

excerpts: Their cajun fries are great (also free with check-in) and their shrimp is delicioso.
Minus one star because the customer service is a little shotty with the elder gentleman who sometimes makes you feel in trouble with the way he barks at you for your order.
Besides that there is nothing to complain about
and I always leave satisfied.
cajun fries.author: Puka N.
cajun fries.review: If you're ever craving Boiling Crab, but don't want to make the drive all the way to San Jose then this is the place to be. Their cajun fries are great (also free with check-in) and their shrimp is delicioso. Minus one star because the customer service is a little shotty with the elder gentleman who sometimes makes you feel in trouble with the way he barks at you for your order. Besides that there is nothing to complain about and I always leave satisfied.

excerpts: However, the Cajun fries and the French bread dipped in the sauce were delicious.
Second and third times coming here
I ordered shrimp with garlic butter sauce, no spice.
It was the best!!
It actually reminded me of Giovanni's shrimp truck in Oahu.
All shrimp is served head on, she'll on
so as you can imagine it's super messy ( which is why you get a bib and wet naps.)
the garlic butter sauce is delicious.
On our last time coming here we tried the chicken wing and hush puppy appetizers, which I didn't care for.
The Asian man working here was very entertaining and made is laugh the whole time.
They serve beer and wine ++.
Checked in here with Yelp and got a free order of yummy Cajun fries!!
Parking is a challenge in this neighborhood- be prepared.
cajun fries.author: Cyn L.
cajun fries.review: We've been here three times and it's been very consistent. First time, I ordered shrimp with hurricane sauce, added sausage and corn on the Cobb. It was so spicy I couldn't enjoy it, just felt burning spice all over my lips and throat. However, the Cajun fries and the French bread dipped in the sauce were delicious. Second and third times coming here I ordered shrimp with garlic butter sauce, no spice. It was the best!! It actually reminded me of Giovanni's shrimp truck in Oahu. All shrimp is served head on, she'll on so as you can imagine it's super messy ( which is why you get a bib and wet naps.) the garlic butter sauce is delicious. On our last time coming here we tried the chicken wing and hush puppy appetizers, which I didn't care for. The Asian man working here was very entertaining and made is laugh the whole time. They serve beer and wine ++.  Checked in here with Yelp and got a free order of yummy Cajun fries!! Parking is a challenge in this neighborhood- be prepared.

excerpts: When you check- in on Yelp you get free complimentary Cajun fries for dine- in only!
cajun fries.author: Karyn H.
cajun fries.review: Love this little gem !  They have a great happy hour from 2-6pm! $1 oysters which my friend loved! Very fresh ! When you check- in on Yelp you get free complimentary Cajun fries for dine- in only! I ordered their watermelon iced tea which was also blended perfectly with fresh watermelon. I drank it too fast because it was so good! We also ordered 1 lb. of shrimp with their signature hurricane sauce with medium spice and added additional corn and hot links in there, let me tell you, AMAZING! You gotta suck the juices from the shrimp head , and after peeling dip it back into the sauce for the best flavor! Lastly ordered 1 lb. of the king crab legs for $29. Not too bad. We had to get the garlic butter sauce for the crab of course! No mistakes here! It was to die for! They perfectly pre- cut the crab legs for you but also bring you some shell crackers just in case you need them! Again, once you take the meat out, dip it back into that sauce! You will not regret it! I will definitely be coming back here. Their groupon is definitely worth it as well! $15 for $25 worth for 2 people!

excerpts: the Cajun fries are also great
cajun fries.author: Robert L.
cajun fries.review: it's so hard to find a Cajun place that has good sauce and good shrimp. I finally found swamp and it lives up to my standards. sometimes the shrimp is over cooked and sometimes the sauce is nasty but swamp had them both perfectly. the Cajun fries are also great

excerpts: The first thing we ordered was the cajun fries that we got for free.
If you checked in, you get free fries.
But anyways, the fries were great.
Light, crisp, and just enough seasoning.
cajun fries.author: Sheryll V.
cajun fries.review:
The first time I wanted to try Swamp, I was very excited. Found parking right in front and paid for meter. Walked to the door to find out they were closed. CLOSED ON TUESDAYS?! What is this. Went back home to my cravings unsatisfied. A few weeks later I went back on a Thursday. They just opened so my friend and I were seated quickly. 

The first thing we ordered was the cajun fries that we got for free. If you checked in, you get free fries. But anyways, the fries were great. Light, crisp, and just enough seasoning. We also ordered the grilled alligator sausage as an appetizer. It was ok. Not something I would order again, but at least I can say I tried it. And for the main, I ordered a pound of Hurricane Shrimp. Very delicious! Wasn't expecting their sauce to taste so good.

Friendly service. Our waiter was patient and gave good suggestions. I believe the owner was there as well. Checking up with every table and making sure our food was good. 

And to my surprise the bill was cheaper than I had expected. Turns out we came during happy hour, which took of 15%.  Despite swamp being closed on Tuesdays I still give it five stars. Clean restaurant, friendly service, and awesome food. Can't wait to go back.

excerpts: I ordered 1lb of shrimp in the hurricane sauce at a medium spice level along with some Cajun fries.
The shrimp was soft & over cooked and the sauce had no spice whatsoever.
the fries were mediocre but also, no spice.
Honestly, I would not come here again & would much rather make the drive down to sj to satisfy my cravings cuz I was left disappointed after my meal at Swamp.
cajun fries.author: melanie c.
cajun fries.review: if you're a fan of boiling crab, Swamp does not even come close. came here a couple months ago with some co-workers for dinner & since I'd been having HUGE cravings for boiling crab, I was very excited to try a place close by & according the yelp ratings, comparable to boiling crab. I ordered 1lb of shrimp in the hurricane sauce at a medium spice level along with some Cajun fries. The shrimp was soft & over cooked and the sauce had no spice whatsoever. the fries were mediocre but also, no spice. Honestly, I would not come here again & would much rather make the drive down to sj to satisfy my cravings cuz I was left disappointed after my meal at Swamp.

excerpts: Hot tip - check in on Yelp and get a free order of Cajun fries.
They're yummy and spicy, get a cold one to go with the spice.
My table split an order of the alligator sausage because, why not - it's alligator sausage!
It was tasty, kind of a small order but enough that each of the four of use could get a few bites.
For dinner I split an order of the garlic butter crayfish with a side of garlic noodles.
We ordered mild for the sauce and it had quite a kick, plenty enough of a kick for me that's for sure.
Definitely order a side of french bread to sop up all of the delicious sauce at the bottom of the bowl.
The crayfish took some work to eat, but I donned my plastic bib and dug in.
Delicious.
And the garlic noodles on the side were a nice accompaniment.
I left full and happy.
cajun fries.author: Elizabeth W.
cajun fries.review: Swamp was a great spot for my first ever crayfish adventure.  Hot tip - check in on Yelp and get a free order of Cajun fries.  They're yummy and spicy, get a cold one to go with the spice.  My table split an order of the alligator sausage because, why not - it's alligator sausage!  It was tasty, kind of a small order but enough that each of the four of use could get a few bites.  For dinner I split an order of the garlic butter crayfish with a side of garlic noodles.  We ordered mild for the sauce and it had quite a kick, plenty enough of a kick for me that's for sure.  Definitely order a side of french bread to sop up all of the delicious sauce at the bottom of the bowl.  The crayfish took some work to eat, but I donned my plastic bib and dug in.  Delicious.  And the garlic noodles on the side were a nice accompaniment.  I left full and happy.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I ordered an alligator sausage, 2 sodas ( they forgot to serve and did not apologize when asked for it), Cajun fries, a gumbo with rice and a pound of shrimp, and apparently that was not enough for their attentions, even though they were not busy.
cajun fries.author: Maggie L.
cajun fries.review: Food was ok but the service really need some improvement. Make sure you dress up and order their crab if you expect better service. My boyfriend and I ordered an alligator sausage, 2 sodas ( they forgot to serve and did not apologize when asked for it), Cajun fries, a gumbo with rice and a pound of shrimp, and apparently that was not enough for their attentions, even though they were not busy.

excerpts: Be sure to check in to get your free cajun fries :)
cajun fries.author: Matt A.
cajun fries.review: Great food and cool owner. Be sure to check in to get your free cajun fries :)

excerpts: If you check-in, you get a free side of cajun fries.
They were pretty fresh and crispy fries.
Once the order came, the crawfishes were very fresh and succulent.
Sizes range from small to medium.
I would not suggest getting the corn.
It was a sweet corn that was not absorbing the sauce
what so ever.
The sauce itself was pretty spicy as I was continuously reaching for my cup of water.
The consistency of the sauce was thin compared to boiling crab, but sweet which reminded me of chinese curry.
I suggest ordering a side of baquette.
The baquette is also fresh and perfect for dipping.
Yum!
I have not been this satisfied with my Louisiana crawfish craving in a long time.
The service was great!
Our waiter made us feel comfortable with asking him for condiments and such.
cajun fries.author: Becky Q.
cajun fries.review:
Ladies an gentleman, can we have a round of applause for the best Louisiana shrimp and crawfish restaurant in San Francisco! Whooo! As a fan of the fabled Boiling Crab, we've gone to several restaurants in the city of mediocre sauce or seafood. We have drove pass Swamp several times and I have been curious to try it. Upon arrival at the restaurant, I was quite surprised that it was not the typical generic boiling crab decorations with the wooden pillars and fish nets. Instead, there was a stand with an assortment of seafood laid out for decoration near the entrance, Marci gras mask and beads amidst red walls. In the back of the restaurant, there is  a mini bar.  

We ordered the kusshi/washington oysters for $18 and those were fresh and briny. 
  
There were four flavors : original cajun, garlic butter, lemon butter, and hurricane (the combination of everything) in either no spice, mild, medium, and spicy habanero. My rule of thumb is to always choose the second to spiciest as I usually can take most spices. Next, we choose however much pound of seafood amongst shrimp, mussels, clams, crawfish, and so on. Crawfishes and shrimps are about 12 dollars a pound. I ordered a pound of medium crawfish in the hurricane flavor with a corn thrown in. If you check-in, you get a free side of cajun fries. They were pretty fresh and crispy fries. Once the order came, the crawfishes were very fresh and succulent. Sizes range from small to medium. I would not suggest getting the corn. It was a sweet corn that was not absorbing the sauce what so ever. The sauce itself was pretty spicy as I was continuously reaching for my cup of water. The consistency of the sauce was thin compared to boiling crab, but sweet which reminded me of chinese curry. I suggest ordering a side of baquette. The baquette is also fresh and perfect for dipping. Yum! I have not been this satisfied with my Louisiana crawfish craving in a long time.  
 
The service was great! Our waiter made us feel comfortable with asking him for condiments and such. He was extremely nice.  

I am sold, I am coming back pretty soon!

excerpts: The garlic noodles & cajun fries were good too.
I think we'll be coming back here if we're ever craving seafood and in the area.
cajun fries.author: Sara L.
cajun fries.review: I tried this place because my friends told me about it. Came here on father's day to take the baby daddy out. We enjoyed the dinner. The young waiter & waitress were nice, they did their job right. We ordered 2 lbs of shrimp with the hurricane flavor. The flavoring was less oily than boiling crab, and your food is served in a bowl instead of a bag. Shrimp tasted fresh and not over cooked. The garlic noodles & cajun fries were good too. I think we'll be coming back here if we're ever craving seafood and in the area.

excerpts: Cajun fries was free with checkin on yelp, so woot woot (free....
they just know how to draw me in).
Nice and hot, and tasty.
The only thing I didn't care too much for during the meal was the garlic noodles.
cajun fries.author: Johnson S.
cajun fries.review:
Came here for dinner since the city seems to have a new Cajun place... I came with a friend... not expecting much since the city doesn't have much to offer compared to places in San Jose. BUT OMG! It may not be as good as boiling crab or other places, but it's definitely, in my opinion, the best place so far in San Francisco. Assuming that everything stays the same and the seafood stays fresh, then I won't have to be making my long journeys to San Jose anymore... or as much at least! And guess what!??!! They offer UNLIMITED soda refills!!!! Unlike other Cajun places in the city, they give you just can soda which you have to pay for each one. Being a soda lover myself, I love that it's free refills here!

Okay, onto the food! Ordered 1lb of crawfish, mild hurricane. Nice little kick but very flavorful. Some of the crawfish were tiny though, while some was average sized. I guess it's not their fault, they should consider another vendor of crawfish though. Ordered 2lbs of shrimp, mild hurricane again. Again, very flavorful. Eat it fast because near the end, I guess we let the shrimp soak too long in the sauce (which is pretty hot) so it overcooked the shrimp... so it became chewy in the end. The only sad thing was that they didn't give limes and salt/pepper for you to squeeze and dip into. I'm not sure if it's going to be like that forever or if it's just now... but I hope they consider offering that. Cajun fries was free with checkin on yelp, so woot woot (free.... they just know how to draw me in). Nice and hot, and tasty. The only thing I didn't care too much for during the meal was the garlic noodles. The noodles were like they left it out too long so they all were stuck to each other... also needed more of that garlic flavor or whatever they need to make it taste like garlic noodles. 

Service was excellent, always brought us more napkins, checked on us a few times, and the guy kept refilling my water without me having to ask (then again, it wasn't too busy... so I don't know how they would do if it were busy though). Place is pretty clean and the restrooms seem pretty well maintained. Oh, and they don't serve their food out of plastic bags! At first it didn't seem the same... but I guess it's better since you don't know what kind of chemicals may be leeching from the plastic into your food! Overall, I'm happy that there is finally ONE good Cajun place in San Francisco! Hopefully they keep doing what they're doing cause I'll keep coming back if they do!

excerpts: The oysters, Cajun fries, sweet potato fries were good.
And the servers were nice and attentive.
Maybe I'm use to the places in SJ
but I wish I could've found one close to them in the city.
All in all this place was eh
cajun fries.author: K C.
cajun fries.review: Went with my family to try a new Cajun place in sf. Honestly the food was just ok. I got a pound of shrimp with the third level of spiciness. It wasn't spicy at all, the flavor was good but the level of heat was minimal almost none. Which was pretty disappointing.  The oysters, Cajun fries, sweet potato fries were good. And the servers were nice and attentive. Maybe I'm use to the places in SJ but I wish I could've found one close to them in the city. All in all this place was eh

excerpts: My gf saw the Yelp ad about getting the free Cajun Fries.
cajun fries.author: Guy A.
cajun fries.review:
This is our second time to this restaurant and this place rocks!!!  Nothing fancy, but the food is excellent and the service is great!!!  

We started the meal with the Calamari appetizer.  They were yummy!!  My gf saw the Yelp ad about getting the free Cajun Fries.  Those were very good!!!

Ordered the Hurricane mild sauce shrimp and King Crab Legs with Butter Garlic Sauce.  Added a couple of corns in with the crab legs.  If you like spicy shrimp, you will like the Hurricane sauce, has a pretty good kick!!  King Crab Legs with the Butter Garlic Sauce was delicious!!!!  So was the corn drenched in the Butter Garlic Sauce!!!

We also ordered a side of the Garlic Noodles.  These noodles are to die for!!!

Everything was excellent!!!  Can't wait to hit this place again soon!!

excerpts: The cajun fries were pretty good too.
However as the night went on I noticed that there was really only one waitress that was actually doing her job.
Wish I could have just tipped that one person.
Overall pretty good though!
cajun fries.author: Ada W.
cajun fries.review: I got the pound of shrimp with corn and sausages as well as the garlic noodles. The noodles were amazing! The shrimp on the other hand didn't seem that fresh when I was eating it. The cajun fries were pretty good too. However as the night went on I noticed that there was really only one waitress that was actually doing her job. Wish I could have just tipped that one person. Overall pretty good though!

excerpts: More bonus points because you can get free cajun fries just for checking in here!
The best part about this place though?
They actually have non-spicy sauces for those of us that are babies and can't handle spiceness.
But for those of you that love spicy, they have that too!
Overall, I can't get enough of this place, and I can't wait for crawfish season to come back in
cajun fries.author: Marlene C.
cajun fries.review:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVEEEE THIS PLACE! I seriously cannot say enough good things about this place. First and foremost, the service is great. I don't know his name, but I think he is the owner (the older Asian gentlemen). He always greets us and continuously checks up on us throughout our meal to make sure that everything is perfect. Bonus points because I feel like his concern for us is genuine. The food itself is great too! Make sure you go when crawfish are in season though. GARLIC NOODLES ARE A MUUUUUUST!! More bonus points because you can get free cajun fries just for checking in here! The best part about this place though? They actually have non-spicy sauces for those of us that are babies and can't handle spiceness. But for those of you that love spicy, they have that too! Overall, I can't get enough of this place, and I can't wait for crawfish season to come back in so I can come in regularly :)

OH and one more bonus point for convient location plus never struggling to find parking

OH OH and one more bonus point for never having to wait at all to get seated!

excerpts:
at least be generous with your sides

the cajun fries are tasty, but i wouldnt call it cajun.
cajun fries.author: Emily M.
cajun fries.review:
pros:  people would like the taste of the sauce, the shrimp is big, the service was good and attentive, and the place is clean. 

other than that, i was really disappointed by this place. i'm not expecting boiling crab, nothing can be the same ive realized, but the PORTIONS were so small. 

1 lb of shrimp: the shrimp were big, but it really did not fit 1 lb, maybe 3/4 of a lb

my friend paid $1 for potatoes, and only half a small potato came. that is ridiculous. at least be generous with your sides

the cajun fries are tasty, but i wouldnt call it cajun. it's more like thicker softer fries wtih salt and pepper and some spices, but not what you think is "cajun." plus the portions were half of boiling crab's fries. 

this would be a nice place for richer folks to enjoy some seafood in some fancy sauce bowl, but for the rest of us who want to get our moneys worth with some good food, it is definitely not worth it.

excerpts: We ordered a dungeness crab, a pound of shrimp, a pound of crawfish, cajun fries, garlic noodles, corn, the alligator sausages and a dozen oysters.
To start, the oysters were so-so but the cajun fries were perfectly seasoned.
The garlic noodles were decent but not spectacular.
I was excited to try the alligator sausages.
They were delicious but did not taste any different than a well-made pork sausage.
Now to the seafood.
The dungeness crab was probably about 2 lbs and tasted very fresh.
It might have been my favorite part of the meal.
The shrimp were big and tasted pretty fresh as well.
We ordered the crawfish because that was what they were known for.
That was a disappointment, however.
The crawfish were definitely NOT FRESH and were very small.
There was barely much to eat after taking the head and shell off.
In half of the crawfish I ate, the meat was falling apart and not chewy, telltale signs that they have been sitting around in the back for a while.
I will only come back for the dungeness crab and the shrimp, but I think there are better options in the Bay Area.
FYI a Rockin Crawfish location just opened in this area.
cajun fries.author: Alfred L.
cajun fries.review:
Swamp was a new Cajun seafood place that tried to follow the likes of Boiling Crab so I gave it a try. They gave us a bib and covered the tables with paper, so I didn't mind getting a little messy.
We ordered a dungeness crab, a pound of shrimp, a pound of crawfish, cajun fries, garlic noodles, corn, the alligator sausages and a dozen oysters. To start, the oysters were so-so but the cajun fries were perfectly seasoned. The garlic noodles were decent but not spectacular. I was excited to try the alligator sausages. They were delicious but did not taste any different than a well-made pork sausage.
Now to the seafood. The dungeness crab was probably about 2 lbs and tasted very fresh. It might have been my favorite part of the meal. The shrimp were big and tasted pretty fresh as well. We ordered the crawfish because that was what they were known for. That was a disappointment, however. The crawfish were definitely NOT FRESH and were very small. There was barely much to eat after taking the head and shell off. In half of the crawfish I ate, the meat was falling apart and not chewy, telltale signs that they have been sitting around in the back for a while.
I will only come back for the dungeness crab and the shrimp, but I think there are better options in the Bay Area. FYI a Rockin Crawfish location just opened in this area.

excerpts: We received free Cajun fries since we used the yelp check in.
They forgot about it but they quickly gave it to us afterwards.
One of the waitresses was really nice and accommodating, checking up on us and making sure we were taken care of.
The other waitress, however, had a smug look on her face the whole time.
She seemed really unhappy to be working there and never once did she smile.
That was a bit of a buzzkill to my dinner, it's like you can't even pretend to be happy even if you're having a bad day?
Other than that, me and my man were full but we did get stomach pains couple hours later.
We actually expect that when we are eating Cajun food but this happened way sooner than expected.
The costs are on the pricey side but it is delicious that I would return back.
The owners are really nice
and I wouldn't not come back just because of the unfriendly waitress.
cajun fries.author: Brenda K.
cajun fries.review: This place was really good. Upon entering, we were greeted a couple seconds late by what seems to be one of the owners? Super nice and friendly. He found out it was our first time and welcomed us. I found that to be really good customer service for some reason.. Anyways, we received our shrimp and clams in the Cajun sauce in medium. The portions were huge and the sauce was so good that I would drink it. The oysters were also very fresh but it was a little on the pricey side. We received free Cajun fries since we used the yelp check in. They forgot about it but they quickly gave it to us afterwards. One of the waitresses was really nice and accommodating, checking up on us and making sure we were taken care of. The other waitress, however, had a smug look on her face the whole time. She seemed really unhappy to be working there and never once did she smile. That was a bit of a buzzkill to my dinner, it's like you can't even pretend to be happy even if you're having a bad day? Other than that, me and my man were full but we did get stomach pains couple hours later. We actually expect that when we are eating Cajun food but this happened way sooner than expected. The costs are on the pricey side but it is delicious that I would return back. The owners are really nice and I wouldn't not come back just because of the unfriendly waitress.

excerpts: What I can say is that their sweet potato fries are much tastier than the cajun fries.
I would not recommend ordering the garlic butter sauce, it does not have much flavor.
I hope my next visit would not be the same as the last because I thought, I might've just found a great seafood establishment like boiling crab.
cajun fries.author: Ann L.
cajun fries.review: Not sure what happened but my first time was great, however when I revisit Swamp, the taste was lacking.  My hurricane sauce was watered down and was not as tasty as the first visit.  Maybe they had a different cook or something but the place was definitely not busy.  What I can say is that their sweet potato fries are much tastier than the cajun fries.  I would not recommend ordering the garlic butter sauce, it does not have much flavor.  I hope my next visit would not be the same as the last because I thought, I might've just found a great seafood establishment like boiling crab.

excerpts: Good Cajun fries too.
Those around us seemed to enjoy the boils
but I'm too lazy to want to do my own shucking.
I should have gotten oysters too.
cajun fries.author: Roger H.
cajun fries.review: Do NOT get the gumbo! While it has a few - very few - lumps of tasty seafood and sausage, 95% is thick, worthless gunk.  The fried calamari was good, also the seafood bengets.  Good Cajun fries too.  Those around us seemed to enjoy the boils but I'm too lazy to want to do my own shucking.  I should have gotten oysters too.

excerpts: We also got free Cajun fries for checking in.
Lastly a side of garlic fries.
We got the seafood hurricane style and medium spicy.
We thought that would be pretty spicy already since the next level would be spicy habanero.
It was pretty mild to me
but I'm thai
so I guess my spicy tolerance is just too high.
Even though it was spicy every tasted awesome.
The owner at least I'm assuming was the owner came over a few times and checked on us.
He was very nice and helped make the experience even better.
Will definitely be back.
Maybe I'll try spicy habanero next time.
cajun fries.author: Sara S.
cajun fries.review: Just ate here. And the food is pretty great. I ordered the crawfish, shrimps, and calms. I know sounds like a lot but I came with friends too so it was actually a good amount. We also got free Cajun fries for checking in. Lastly a side of garlic fries. We got the seafood hurricane style and medium spicy. We thought that would be pretty spicy already since the next level would be spicy habanero. It was pretty mild to me but I'm thai so I guess my spicy tolerance is just too high. Even though it was spicy every tasted awesome. The owner at least I'm assuming was the owner came over a few times and checked on us. He was very nice and helped make the experience even better. Will definitely be back. Maybe I'll try spicy habanero next time.

excerpts: My bf and I ordered crawfish in  hurriane sauce,  shrimp in garlic butter,  garlic noodles,  and cajun fries.
The hurricane sauce has a sweet and sour taste and not the cajun taste.
The garlic butter sauce tasted very rich.
The garlic noodle was good with a hint of garlic taste.
Canjun fries was ok.
Howevee,  service was great.
The server cones by our table a few times to make sure evwrything was okay.
It was worth a try to dine here
but I would definately pick Rockin Crawfish over Swamp.
cajun fries.author: Yen M.
cajun fries.review: My bf and I ordered crawfish in  hurriane sauce,  shrimp in garlic butter,  garlic noodles,  and cajun fries.  The hurricane sauce has a sweet and sour taste and not the cajun taste.  The garlic butter sauce tasted very rich.  The garlic noodle was good with a hint of garlic taste. Canjun fries was ok. Howevee,  service was great.  The server cones by our table a few times to make sure evwrything was okay.  It was worth a try to dine here but I would definately pick Rockin Crawfish over Swamp.

excerpts: We ordered a pound of crayfish with sausage, cajun fries, hushpuppies.
cajun fries.author: David M.
cajun fries.review:
GF and I stopped in here for an early dinner.  We live close by so had been curious about this new place.

Food's pretty decent.  We ordered a pound of crayfish with sausage, cajun fries, hushpuppies.

The crayfish were pretty good though I had forgotten how much of a pain it is to eat them.  Too much work for too little meat, IMO.  If we would go there again I think we would get the shrimp.

We got the hurricane, habanero boil.  Good flavor and nice broth to dip the hushpuppies in.

The fries, as mentioned in another review, were uninspiring. Pretty mediocre actually.

Hushpuppies were OK.  They came with this honey butter stuff that was pretty solidified in the ramekin.  I just dipped them in the ketchup and boil/broth and they were pretty good that way.

If I go there again I will order shrimp or mussels, some french bread to dip in the broth, and maybe try the alligator sausage.  

Service was friendly and prompt.  Decent place to get some shellfish.

excerpts: Also got free cajun fries with our yelp check in!
cajun fries.author: Valerie A.
cajun fries.review: We saw this place in the neighborhood and thought we'd give it a try since we've never tried cajun food before. The place was pretty fast, reasonable, and the boil was pretty good (we got crayfish and shrimp). The gumbo we ordered was kind of grossly thick and overly flowered, but generally this place was good. Also got free cajun fries with our yelp check in!

excerpts: My family and I ordered gumbo, cajun fries, garlic noodles, and shrimp with the hurricane sauce.
Everything came out relatively quick.
Cajun fries were good, wasn't too salty.
Gumbo was alright, it seemed to lack more flavor.
Shrimp and hurricane sauce was okay.
The sauce has a water like consistency but the shrimp were huge!
The sauce I believe is a mixtures of garlic butter and lemon pepper, did not really wow me.
My favorite dish was the garlic noodles.
I felt that the noodles had the right amount of garlic flavor and more importantly, not oily.
Customer service was good, they kept refilling our waters, asked how our food was, and asked if we needed anything else.
They do not have dessert here so they can't sing happy birthday unless you bring your own cake.
Well our server said he would sing if we had brought our own cake haha.
cajun fries.author: Brigitte M.
cajun fries.review: Came here for a birthday dinner on an early Sunday evening. It was not crowded at all. My family and I ordered gumbo, cajun fries, garlic noodles, and shrimp with the hurricane sauce. Everything came out relatively quick. Cajun fries were good, wasn't too salty. Gumbo was alright, it seemed to lack more flavor. Shrimp and hurricane sauce was okay. The sauce has a water like consistency but the shrimp were huge! The sauce I believe is a mixtures of garlic butter and lemon pepper, did not really wow me. My favorite dish was the garlic noodles. I felt that the noodles had the right amount of garlic flavor and more importantly, not oily. Customer service was good, they kept refilling our waters, asked how our food was, and asked if we needed anything else. They do not have dessert here so they can't sing happy birthday unless you bring your own cake. Well our server said he would sing if we had brought our own cake haha.

excerpts: First the food... we had oysters, crawfish and shrimp and cajun fries.
Everything was very good!
We also tried the fried
oysters,,but that was not
a winner- but leave that more up to personal preference on taste or raw vs. cooked oysters.
We also had some bread which was standard French bed :)
Ok now for the service...
As many people noted before, some of the servers were a little much...
but-
I think thats just the nerves of recently opening.
We chatted with them since we casually sat at the bar for dinner and
after a bit- they relaxed and thats when it really got good.
Charlie-
the manager I thing- was AWESOME!!!!
He and the BF chatted about  oysters and what not
and it was nice that he actually knew about the cuisine they were serving.
He was supper friendly and we were hooked.
We live across town but will make the trip over for sure!
Lastly...the pricing!
All I can say is that $10 for a half dozen GOOD QUALITY oysters..man that is worth the drive alone.
Very cool spot
and I think as more people hear about it and the staff see that people like their food and restaurant- it will only  get better.
cajun fries.author: Claudia V.
cajun fries.review: Wow!  This place was great!  First the food... we had oysters, crawfish and shrimp and cajun fries.  Everything was very good! We also tried the fried oysters,,but that was not a winner- but leave that more up to personal preference on taste or raw vs. cooked oysters. We also had some bread which was standard French bed :)  Ok now for the service...As many people noted before, some of the servers were a little much...but- I think thats just the nerves of recently opening.  We chatted with them since we casually sat at the bar for dinner and after a bit- they relaxed and thats when it really got good.  Charlie- the manager I thing- was AWESOME!!!!  He and the BF chatted about  oysters and what not and it was nice that he actually knew about the cuisine they were serving.  He was supper friendly and we were hooked.  We live across town but will make the trip over for sure!  Lastly...the pricing!  All I can say is that $10 for a half dozen GOOD QUALITY oysters..man that is worth the drive alone.  Very cool spot and I think as more people hear about it and the staff see that people like their food and restaurant- it will only  get better.

excerpts: Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet.
beignet.author: Joy W.
beignet.review:
Excellent, PPQ brought Cajun seafood to the Richmond. We had been curious about Swamp, with its eye-catching name in blue lettering and black awning. The interior has some interesting faux window paintings of scenic ocean views. The rest of the restaurant is very simple without all the usual cheesy seaside decorations.
So we came for an early dinner once and sat by the window. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw some spindly legs moving along the wall. I turned to check out what was in my peripheral vision and it was a daddy long-legs. Since the restaurant was still fairly empty, they didn't mind us switching to another table. It's no one's fault. I just remember it vividly. Maybe the spider likes Cajun food too?

The shellfish menu is pretty simple. You just...
1) Choose your shellfish. Pay by the pound.
2) Choose a sauce/flavor.
3) Choose level of spice.
There is a good selection of starters and sides. Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet. 

We went with the 2-item Combo ($15/lb.) of Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane / Mild Sauce,
& added Corn ($0.75) + Hot Link Sausage ($2.95):
The shrimp were tender and sweet, and the mussels were nice and springy. The dark red Hurricane sauce was quite tasty. I think the spicy sausages we added brought the mild close to a medium spice.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter ($29/lb):
These king crab legs tasted fresh, tender, and sweet. The leg meat was nice and springy. I appreciate that the crab legs were cut into smaller segments. They fit nicely in the bowls and made for easier eating. It went really well with the creamy garlic butter sauce.

We checked in for the free Cajun fries. They were a thicker cut, not too crunchy, lightly seasoned, pretty good. 

After we ate all the contents in our bowls, we were still left with a lot of sauce, which was perfect for dipping the toasted bread.

I enjoyed the dishes we ordered. I have to say I prefer the garlic butter to their hurricane sauce. I would come back to try out the rest of their menu, including the alligator sausage. I had some alligator in Australia and I quite like it! I'd definitely like to take advantage of their Happy Hour menu (2-6PM) too.

excerpts:
Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet.
beignet.author: Courtni W.
beignet.review:
Service: 

Waiter was 50 flavors of salty and rushed us to order as soon as we sat down. The staff spoke Cantonese to each other and would talk negatively about the customers. 

Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet. Dough was too doughy and there wasn't enough of crawfish. Very average. 

Shrimp: got the hurricane cajun flavor. The texture of the shrimp was decent and the flavor wasn't bad. Not worth $15.50 for the pound. You can find shrimp of equal quality at other places significantly cheaper. 

Gumbo: Very plain even after adding salt. Didn't taste homey and comforting like a gumbo should. I would not order this.

excerpts: My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.
The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!
beignet.author: Herb L.
beignet.review:
My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.  The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!  Fries had just the right amount of seasoning.

The pound of shrimp with the medium spicy hurricane sauce was good, and it really should be ordered with some bread so you can sop up the sauce.  That sauce was *really* good.  

We also ordered their lobster special with the "Golden Shallot Peppercorn" seasoning and it was excessively good.  Take a lobster, chop it up Chinese style, and then Cajun-ize the seasoning.

excerpts: I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.
My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
The crawfish beignet was interesting.
It wasn't bad.
I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.
There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.
I'll pass on ordering it again.
beignet.author: Scott A.
beignet.review:
I first went there after searching Yelp for new places to try.  I came across this one.  Being from South Louisiana, I'm always searching for places to "take me back".  

On Jan, 18, I drove to SwampSF from Oakland.  Not really set on a particular dish, I order the Oyster Po-Boy, to go. While waiting for my order, I wanted to buy one of their shirts, but the server couldn't find the size I was looking for.  :(  

When I got back to my car, the food smelled so good, I had to try it before I got home.  I ate half of the Po-Boy before I put the car in drive.  It was delicious.  Perfectly fried.

I told my coworkers about the place.  I could tell their mouths were drooling.

On 2/2, I took a coworker friend there.  He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.  I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.  He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.  He's still talking about it.  My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".  The crawfish beignet was interesting.  It wasn't bad.  I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.  There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.  I'll pass on ordering it again.  Overall the food was good, and they had the size of shirt I was looking for.

I'll definitely return.

excerpts: The taste was kinda "fishy" and the dough wasn't light and airy as what I would expect from the texture of a beignet.
-Shrimp (1lb, mild spicy hurricane sauce) ($14)
- I was expecting this sauce to taste close, or nearly close to the shabang boiling crab but was deeply disappointed.
Not only did I feel like the portion of 1lb was smaller, but the sauce was bland and flavorless.
beignet.author: Michelle H.
beignet.review:
I ordered:
-Alligator Sausage (~$6?) - It came with a side of cole slaw. I wasn't expecting it to taste anything different than a typical sausage, so that's what it tasted like. Since they use alligator meat, the portion is smaller than a usual sausage. 
-Crawfish beignets (~$6?) - I was mildly disappointed with this. The taste was kinda "fishy" and the dough wasn't light and airy as what I would expect from the texture of a beignet. 
-Shrimp (1lb, mild spicy hurricane sauce) ($14) - I was expecting this sauce to taste close, or nearly close to the shabang boiling crab but was deeply disappointed. Not only did I feel like the portion of 1lb was smaller, but the sauce was bland and flavorless.
-FREE Cajun Fries w/ yelp check in - It could use more seasoning, but hey it was free? 

I give them 3 stars for a good effort and I guess if you live in SF where there is no boiling crab, this is the closest thing. Most of the dishes I had were lightly salted so at the very least, its slightly healthier/less sodium than boiling crab? :P

excerpts: Includes clam chowder (3), 2 lb crab in sauce of your choice (3+), Cole slaw (4), and beignet (4) for dessert.
Food was fine and a great value, but the service was atrocious.
2 wait staff split time at our table.
During the meal BILL at least checked in once.
But the waitress IGNORED us completely, never asking anything and actively avoided us!
It took us almost 30 minutes to get dessert after dishes were cleared, and only after I walked up to BILL at the register!Fire your waitress and turn some tables = happy customer= make money
beignet.author: Scott S.
beignet.review: Thursday night dining for 2. Had the crab dinner special for $59. Includes clam chowder (3), 2 lb crab in sauce of your choice (3+), Cole slaw (4), and beignet (4) for dessert. Food was fine and a great value, but the service was atrocious. 2 wait staff split time at our table.  During the meal BILL at least checked in once. But the waitress IGNORED us completely, never asking anything and actively avoided us! It took us almost 30 minutes to get dessert after dishes were cleared, and only after I walked up to BILL at the register!Fire your waitress and turn some tables = happy customer= make money

excerpts: The crawfish beignet was nice and savory.
There's more crawfish there then in our combination and less work.
It reminds me of a donut with savory crawfish inside.
The garlic noodle was the last to come out
and we were waiting for a long time to go with the "mild" spicy Hurricane.
The "mild" really need something to go with it.
The garlic noodle had at least half a stick of butter?
(That is just a guess).
I can keep on eating that garlic noodle, but had to stop since I was really full from so much food.
They do have a set meal for $59 with clam chowder soup and probably everything we had.
I had to take home the sauce, no sense to waste such yummy sauce.
beignet.author: Helen L.
beignet.review: Groupon is way too dangerous for my waistline!  No, I didn't have the alligator, need to work my way through that menu to it.  Came exactly at 5:55 pm, had 5 minutes to order from their Happy Hour Menu, and so glad I did!  The oysters were so fresh, so next time we have to order at least a dozen!  Only $1 each, what the hey!  Splurge!  It's so great to have someone shuck them and present them, all I do is slurp them.  We had cajun chicken wings.  If my non-spicy friend can eat them, you can too!  We had to order the rest through the main menu since groupon does not cover Happy Hour items.  We had the 2 combinations with Hurricane sauce:  Mussels and crawfish.  Skip the crawfish next time, not much meat.  Stick with the shrimp.  Service was great, ask and you will receive.  Love having the bib, just because the messy person inside me always wants to come out.  The crawfish beignet was nice and savory.  There's more crawfish there then in our combination and less work.  It reminds me of a donut with savory crawfish inside.  The garlic noodle was the last to come out and we were waiting for a long time to go with the "mild" spicy Hurricane. The "mild" really need something to go with it.  The garlic noodle had at least half a stick of butter?  (That is just a guess).
