I can keep on eating that garlic noodle, but had to stop since I was really full from so much food.  They do have a set meal for $59 with clam chowder soup and probably everything we had.  I had to take home the sauce, no sense to waste such yummy sauce.

excerpts: Crawfish beignet was NO BUENO.
Cannot compare, after you've had Brenda's beignet.
beignet.author: Ryan E.
beignet.review:
Place is pretty good! The broth is thinner than most places like kickin' crab or boiling crab. I like the spicy level they have. The group I was with said it was a little spicy so it really depends on your endurance of spice. The flavor is all there though, regardless of spice level. $14 per pound for a pound of shrimp. Seems a little pricier than other places. Service is A+ I loved our server, he was super funny and joked around with us while getting us anything we needed. Water levels were always full. 

Crawfish beignet was NO BUENO. Cannot compare, after you've had Brenda's beignet. 

There's parking in the back! And remember to check in for free caujin fries!

excerpts:
I had 2 glasses 

Crawfish beignet was ehh - tasted like a piroshki
beignet.author: Erica S.
beignet.review:
So I ate here for my 26th birthday yesterday  and I liked it ! There was 18 ppl in my party and the service was okay I think they did pretty good considering there's only 2 ppl working the front ... 

Any who we ordered 

Shrimp hurricane style mild with 2 corns it's was yummy, it came in a nice bowl keeping it warm 

Calamari  yummy 
Free Cajun fries with yelp checkin also 
yummy

Watermelon ice tea  so good I had 2 glasses 

Crawfish beignet was ehh - tasted like a piroshki wouldn't ride that again 

Didn't order dessert cuz I had my bday cake 

We will be back

excerpts: The only good thing is they serve crawfish beignet.
Ordered a crab but had no taste.
Service is so so.
beignet.author: Pasha C.
beignet.review: Not as good as kickin crab or Ray's crab shack.  The sauce at swamp wasn't too tasty.  The only good thing is they serve crawfish beignet.  Ordered a crab but had no taste.  Service is so so.

excerpts: We ordered the crawfish beignet.
Lightly gummy but good flavor.
Needed spice.
beignet.author: Carol m.
beignet.review:
Sadly disappointed on Fat Tuesday! We stopped in around four to have cajun food. 
No cajun music just elevator music. Owners are vietnamese and HAVE NO SOUL!
We ordered the Alligator sausage. No way to tell if it was alligator or pork or turkey or chicken or tofu. Very mild no spice. It needed a sauce. We asked the server and she said no sauce. I noticed on the menu there was a remoulade sauce. We ordered a serving of it. Helped somewhat. The coleslaw was amazing.
We ordered the crawfish beignet. Lightly gummy but good flavor. Needed spice. We requested tabasco and a serving of the white sauce from the coleslaw. Helped.
We ordered the soft shell crab. Very crispy but the body hadn't been cleaned well and was strong tasting. It came vietnamese style with pepper and lime. Overall good.
I ordered the Deviled Chicken wings. They were not spicy and came with a ranch style sauce. As I remembered it there was no sauce.
Husband ordered the fried shrimp sandwich with added coleslaw. Love the coleslaw! The sandwich was large and filling. BUT NOT SPICY!
We ordered a pitcher of anchor steam. She never brought water or additional napkins. 
Total bill was $55.96. I DID NOT TIP. I WOULD NEVER RETURN!!

excerpts: The last time we went he brought out a birthday beignet for my mom enough for the whole party to share - bonus points for that.
Went twice for birthdays in a month.
Love that they offer free fries when you check-in on Yelp.
That's how you incentivize a loyal customer base!
beignet.author: Trina D.
beignet.review: Awesome restaurant! Tasty food - we ordered the hurricane shrimp, garlic butter crab, garlic noodles, clams and raw oysters. Love all of it! All were cooked very nicely, not over cooked. When I eat here it feels more home-y than other restaurants. When I come here I actually feel like I'm having a family dinner rather than being rushed out. This isn't boiling crab so PUH-LEASE don't complain it doesn't taste like it!!! The server (he told us his name is Bill but I don't know if that's his real name) is such a jokester and really made his best efforts in serving us. He makes the trip out here extra fun! The last time we went he brought out a birthday beignet for my mom enough for the whole party to share - bonus points for that. Went twice for birthdays in a month. Love that they offer free fries when you check-in on Yelp. That's how you incentivize a loyal customer base!

excerpts: Fried banana ice cream was perfect way to end the meal
fried banana ice cream.author: Paul B.
fried banana ice cream.review: Peaceful, intimate, no-nonsense atmosphere. We ordered two pounds of crayfish, which was just about enough to feed two. French bread was great for dipping in the sauce, and when the bread was through we ordered garlic noodles. Were able to catch some of the 2nd quarter of the nights Warriors/Hornets game on the screens. Fried banana ice cream was perfect way to end the meal

excerpts: Their watermelon iced tea was
SO F****** GOOD.
watermelon iced tea.author: Dara S.
watermelon iced tea.review:
Stumbled upon this spot while I was in the area waiting for my boyfriend. I noticed their Happy Hour sign and was pretty impressed how they include weekends as well. So we ordered garlic noodles, oysters, wings, calamari, and got a free order of cajun fries from checking in on Yelp. We also ordered drinks. Their watermelon iced tea was SO F****** GOOD. It was so refreshing with the right amount of sweetness and it also had pieces of watermelon in it. 

We spent about $30 for all that food and we didn't even finish our noodles because we were so full. Def worth trying out if you're in the area. HH is from 2-6pm everyday. And the owner was a really nice guy.

excerpts: The watermelon iced tea was pretty good as well, and you can tell they used real watermelon as some of the white seeds and pulp were in the cup.
watermelon iced tea.author: Sandy K.
watermelon iced tea.review: Way better than crawstation in sunset. I ordered a pound of their shrimp in hurricane Cajun, medium spicy. The sauce was a little on the sweet side, but the flavor was all there. The medium spicy wasn't spicy at all really though, so it makes me want to try their next level up which was habanero spicy or something. I also tried a bit of my friends shrimp in coconut curry sauce which was also pretty good. It tasted more like a Thai curry, which I thought went well with the shrimp. Service was good and the beer was nice and cold. The watermelon iced tea was pretty good as well, and you can tell they used real watermelon as some of the white seeds and pulp were in the cup.

excerpts: The perks are the food, service, and watermelon iced tea.
watermelon iced tea.author: Lei F.
watermelon iced tea.review:
First experience but won't be my last!

It's better than boiling crab, hands down! The perks are the food, service, and watermelon iced tea. 

Make sure you get the garlic noodles!

excerpts: The watermelon iced tea was nearly undrinkable.
watermelon iced tea.author: Brian L.
watermelon iced tea.review:
The main dish here came through and my wife is hoping to go back again.  This was my first time going here. 

The service from the waiter (possibly the guy running the place) is deplorable and combative. 

Food: We had a prawn and shrimp boil with cajun seasoning. The prawn were undersized, but my wife really liked them as they had good flavor. The shrimp (whole and with veins) was good sized and tasted fresh. The watermelon iced tea was nearly undrinkable. The cajun fries were OK, but not spectacular as it was difficult to taste the seasoning.  If you ask for more ketchup, they'll bring the bottle over and squirt some into the small ketchup dish instead of giving you the bottle. 

Service: Based on the service within only the first few moments of walking in the door, I was ready to walk out of the door. A few simple correspondences as a guest of the establishment shouldn't get your blood boiling and discomfort level up. For the quick and dirty on the place, you can stop here, if you are interested in knowing what happened, I've outlined the 4 painful experiences below. 

Unfortunately tone and volume are not yet transmissible via text, so you will need to imagine a very loud and angry guy who can make people uncomfortable with simple words. There were at least 5-6 witnesses (which is what I believe they should be termed in this type of situation) in the restaurant. 

#1 - Taken Aback: Walked in and the place was at about 20% capacity. The guy said "can I help you" from all the way across the restaurant which is a strange way to greet people.  Being that it was my first time here, I also walked in with that normal level of social anxiety of not knowing where to sit.  I responded in a joking manner that we're just trying to find a place to sit.  The guy told me that you don't choose, he will seat you himself.  Taken aback, I jested that there should be a sign if that is the case, but he said that they don't need a sign since he just tells people where to sit.... This went on for a demeaning 30-40 seconds. 

#2 - The Jab: They give you two menus, one of them has all the main seafood and one has drinks & lunch specials.  Outside the door they have a sign advertising Po-Boy sandwiches, this doesn't appear to be dependent on the time of day.  Not finding the Po-Boy on the regular menu, my wife found it on the lunch special page.  I asked if it is possible to get a poor boy at this time (after the end of lunch specials), the guy told me he could give it to me, but it wouldn't be at the happy hour price. I was fine with this pricing fact.. I guess.. but the way he said it was very rude and condescending. I would think that it's either on the menu or not (especially when it's on the sign outside and plastered in ads on the window). 

#3 - On the Ropes: We happened to have a Yelp coupon for free cajun fries.  I'm a scaredy cat, so after #1 & #2, I asked my wife to present the coupon to the guy.  She showed the coupon which still needed a few clicks to complete the transaction.  The guy very curtly said to her to click "this" now "that" now "this."  I don't recall the commands on the phone, but basically instead of saying, OK, you just need to click through these steps, he elevated everyone's blood pressure in the room by using a high volume to spew the commands at her. Sometimes an economy of words with people can seem so much ruder...

#4 - The Death Blow:  The menu for the seafood boils have prices by the pound.  We ordered a combo shirimp/prawn at about $14/lb, but didn't exactly say how many pounds and the guy didn't ask.  After ordering, and given the awful experience so far, I did start to worry that perhaps the default might be more than a pound, so I asked my wife to confirm with the guy when she walked back from washing her hands.  She asked the guy on her way back, and the guy got very loud and confrontational to explain how the menu works and that if you order the combo, it is simply $14.  She said that she was just worried because we didn't say one way or another and the price is in per pound increments.  The guy said he doesn't need to ask since it just is $14. She explained that it's our first time here so we didn't know how it works.  Disregarding this comment, the guy then "went over her head" and came over to me to explain how the menu works.  I told him that we just weren't sure and wanted to make sure and that I was the one who actually had the question.  He failed to grasp the situation and his handling was quite rude - particularly trying to go over my wife's head as though I could somehow explain his specious argument to her (if you've ever ordered something on a menu listed as market price, you know that you had better double check prices first!). 

P.S. Luckily he disappeared 20 minutes into our experience, so we were able to let our guard down and try to enjoy our meal on an otherwise nice Friday afternoon.

excerpts: I ordered their watermelon iced tea which was also blended perfectly with fresh watermelon.
I drank it too fast because it was so good!
We also ordered 1 lb. of shrimp with their signature hurricane sauce with medium spice and added additional corn and hot links in there, let me tell you, AMAZING!
You gotta suck the juices from the shrimp head , and after peeling dip it back into the sauce for the best flavor!
Lastly ordered 1 lb. of the king crab legs for $29.
Not too bad.
We had to get the garlic butter sauce for the crab of course!
No mistakes here!
It was to die for!
They perfectly pre- cut the crab legs for you but also bring you some shell crackers just in
case you need them!
Again, once you take the meat out, dip it back into that sauce!
You will not regret it!
I will definitely be coming back here.
Their groupon is definitely worth it as well!
$15 for $25 worth for 2 people!
watermelon iced tea.author: Karyn H.
watermelon iced tea.review: Love this little gem !  They have a great happy hour from 2-6pm! $1 oysters which my friend loved! Very fresh ! When you check- in on Yelp you get free complimentary Cajun fries for dine- in only! I ordered their watermelon iced tea which was also blended perfectly with fresh watermelon. I drank it too fast because it was so good! We also ordered 1 lb. of shrimp with their signature hurricane sauce with medium spice and added additional corn and hot links in there, let me tell you, AMAZING! You gotta suck the juices from the shrimp head , and after peeling dip it back into the sauce for the best flavor! Lastly ordered 1 lb. of the king crab legs for $29. Not too bad. We had to get the garlic butter sauce for the crab of course! No mistakes here! It was to die for! They perfectly pre- cut the crab legs for you but also bring you some shell crackers just in case you need them! Again, once you take the meat out, dip it back into that sauce! You will not regret it! I will definitely be coming back here. Their groupon is definitely worth it as well! $15 for $25 worth for 2 people!

excerpts: We always had the clam and mussel combo.
Decent size and good sauce.
We had corns and regular sausages.
Mix well with the sauce of the shrimp and the combo.
mussel combo.author: Julie N.
mussel combo.review:
Came here for brother's bday couple weeks ago since he was craving for crawfish and wanted to try a new place. My family were pretty sad and disappointed that they didnt have the crawfish saying that they're out of season. Even the lobster was out of season. Whoever i talk to on the phone to make a reservation could have told me that they didnt have crawfish in season. We couldnt do nothing about it since we were at the table and just wanted to give this place a try.

This place was alright. Nothing special about this place. Its expensive and they dont give you much. One of the things that we order was the oyster as one of our appetizer. its so small that its like bite size. 

Had the garlic. They give in a small bowl. Its not enough for 5 people. It tasted alright

Shrimps are pretty big and juicy...good sauce. Usually when you get 1 or 2 lbs of shrimps, its always more than 15 pieces if 1 lbs and maybe more than 20 pieces if 2 lbs. i dont know if they're cheap on giving out the shrimps or not, but they give so little.
We always had the clam and mussel combo. Decent size and good sauce. We had corns and regular sausages. Mix well with the sauce of the shrimp and the combo. This restaurant put your shrimps and clam/mussels was in bowl rather than the traditional plastic bag

Alligator sausage. Nothing special. Taste like regular grill sausage but it was fun it eat since it was new

Spill water on my brother and beer on the table. Should have gave us discount for spilling our drink. But the waiter was nice that he said sorry and trying to clean our table. Not sure if i would come back here again

excerpts: It's basic shit, Anyways, ordered the shrimp n mussel combo.
Shrimp
we're good, but the mussels were in the older side.
Not "bad" yet, but close to.
Shrimp were good though.
Got the free check in fries.
Spicy, but nothing to complain about.
And then our king crab legs came.
I took a bit and already had garlic noodles in my mouth
so when I swallowed I had this odd taste in my mouth.
I took another small bite of just crab alone and spit it out.
Grabbed another from our bowl, opened the shell, and put my nose in it.
To my disgust, it smelled like straight bleach.
Burned the freak at of my nose.
I let my bf smell it and the pure look of "wtf omg" on his face made my stomach sink knowing that I already swallowed a bit of rotten ammonia crab.
I mean like this wasn't even SLIGHTY off.
This crab was bad days ago!!!!!
How the shit do you do that!?????
No idea.
So I told the waitress.
She apologized and took it back to get me a fresh one.
Then came back with some stupid bullshit answer of her saying that the cooks said it smelled like that cause it probably wasn't cooked all the way.
I just sat silent thinking, if this girl knew who we were she wouldn't dare give some excuse so stupid that would try to OK rotten seafood.
Moving on, they comped the garlic noodles.
Big whoop.
The whole damn meal should have been comped.

Right after we ate, I ran across the street to walgreens to get pepto bismol and other stomach relaxers in case I would fall ill from my bite, but luckily all I experienced was some odd stomach cramps that kept me from sleeping that night.
But I'll take that over being flat out glued to the toilet and having to go to the hospital!!!
I would never go back.
And I'll never let any friends or family try this place.
That's just scary.
Hope this review helps everyone out there.

excerpts: Crab legs with lemon pepper, clams/shrimp combo with coconut curry, calamari, green beans and coleslaw.
I was not a big fan of coleslaw but green beans were great!
shrimp combo.author: Erena S.
shrimp combo.review:
We look so happy getting seafood! We ordered 3 dishes and we ordered more.  Crab legs with lemon pepper, clams/shrimp combo with coconut curry, calamari, green beans and coleslaw. I was not a big fan of coleslaw but green beans were great! We needed vegetable.

So fortunate to be friends for almost 20 years and we look like 3 year old babies here.

excerpts: We also got the clams and shrimp combo with the hurricane sauce in mild so the kids can have some too.
The garlic noodles were very tasty and even better when you add some of the hurricane sauce for a kick, got this idea from another review.
The calamari was very good too.
I would definitely come back to this place whenever I am in the area.
The service was friendly and attentive.
shrimp combo.author: Ravenous T.
shrimp combo.review: I was skeptical because of some of the reviews but I usually take them with a grain of salt and go strait to the photos. I'm glad I did with this place because the food was the bomb! The seafood was fresh and the sauces were better than most. We got the Crab with the new peppercorn sauce, yum! We also got the clams and shrimp combo with the hurricane sauce in mild so the kids can have some too. The garlic noodles were very tasty and even better when you add some of the hurricane sauce for a kick, got this idea from another review. The calamari was very good too. I would definitely come back to this place whenever I am in the area. The service was friendly and attentive.

excerpts: The garlic noodles, hush puppies, calamari, crab and shrimp combo cannot go wrong!
I myself tried the shrimp and clams combo with the all sauce mix, and my dine in partner tried the crab with garlic butter sauce.
No complaints.
The sauce is different, it is not greasy nor heavy.
It doesn't make you feel gross after eating an entire dish.
I suggest this place for anyone looking for something different in sauce quality.
